{"uri": "8117800477", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:14:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:14:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:13:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/sports/ipl-2024-srhs-head-abhishek-deliver-fireworks-chase-down-166-in-just-9-4-overs-against-lsg/articleshow/109957609.cms", "title": "IPL 2024: SRH's Head-Abhishek deliver fireworks, chase down 166 in just 9.4 overs against LSG", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their Indian Premier League (IPL) match at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad. Sunrisers Hyderabad openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma attacked from the start, securing a ten-wicket victory and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs. SRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses, and 14 points, while LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses, and 12 points.Sunrisers Hyderabad openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smashed Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) bowlers to the pulp, registering a ten-wicket victory and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in their Indian Premier League (IPL) game at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) did not waste any time as openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma attacked right from the start. In just the second over, Abhishek smashed Yash Thakur for four successive boundaries, looting 17 runs from the over.\n\nThe next over was Head's turn to swing his bat, launching Krishnappa Gowtham for three sixes and a four, getting 22 runs from the over.\n\nA massive six over long-on on a Ravi Bishnoi delivery took SRH to the 50-run mark in just 3.1 overs. Head smashed him for a four and then a six over long-off to concluded the fourth over on a high, getting 17 more runs.\n\nThe next over saw Abhishek giving the strike to Head and then the Australian proceeding to tear into Naveen-ul-Haq with 4,4,6,4 and 4. Head reached his half-century, his fourth in the tournament, in 16 balls with five fours and five sixes.\n\nAbhishek ended the powerplay on high, once again targeting Yash with two fours and two sixes and taking SRH to 107/0 at the end of six overs, with Head (58*) and Abhishek (46*) unbeaten. SRH reached the 100-run mark in just 5.4 overs.\n\nAbhishek reached his second fifty in the tournament in 19 balls, with six fours and four sixes. Ayush Badoni's first over did turn out to be good, as he gave away 19 runs, including two sixes and a four, all by Abhishek.\n\nSRH brought up their 150-run in 8.2 overs, with Head (85* in 27 balls) and Abhishek 63* in 23 balls) unbeaten.\n\nSRH ended their run-chase in less than 10 overs, finishing at 167/0 in 9.4 overs, with Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes).\n\nEarlier, a fine half-century from Ayush Badoni and his partnership with Nicholas Pooran helped Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) reach a modest total of 165/4 in their Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nLSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg.\n\nIn the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. At the end of six overs, LSG was 27/2, with KL (19*) and Krunal (2*) unbeaten.\n\nIn the seventh over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, Krunal relieved some pressure by smashing him for two sixes and getting his team a total of 15 runs out of it.\n\nBy drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs.\n\nThe 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket.\n\nBrief Scores: Lucknow Super Giants: 165/4 (Ayush Badoni 55*, Nicholas Pooran 48, Bhuvneshwar Kumar 2/12) lost to Sunrisers Hyderabad: 167/0 in 9.4 overs (Travis LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nAlso Read | Mumbai Indians Out of IPL 2024 Playoffs Race As SunRisers Hyderabad Beat Lucknow Super Giants.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) did not waste any time as openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma attacked right from the start. In just the second over, Abhishek smashed Yash Thakur for four successive boundaries, looting 17 runs from the over.\n\nThe next over was Head's turn to swing his bat, launching Krishnappa Gowtham for three sixes and a four, getting 22 runs from the over.\n\nAlso Read | Viyaskanth Vijayakanth Quick Facts: Here's All You Need To Know About Wanindu Hasaranga's Replacement in SRH For IPL 2024.\n\nA massive six over long-on on a Ravi Bishnoi delivery took SRH to the 50-run mark in just 3.1 overs. Head smashed him for a four and then a six over long-off to concluded the fourth over on a high, getting 17 more runs.\n\nThe next over saw Abhishek giving the strike to Head and then the Australian proceeding to tear into Naveen-ul-Haq with 4,4,6,4 and 4. Head reached his half-century, his fourth in the tournament, in 16 balls with five fours and five sixes.\n\nAbhishek ended the powerplay on high, once again targeting Yash with two fours and two sixes and taking SRH to 107/0 at the end of six overs, with Head (58*) and Abhishek (46*) unbeaten. SRH reached the 100-run mark in just 5.4 overs.\n\nAbhishek reached his second fifty in the tournament in 19 balls, with six fours and four sixes. Ayush Badoni's first over did turn out to be good, as he gave away 19 runs, including two sixes and a four, all by Abhishek.\n\nSRH brought up their 150-run in 8.2 overs, with Head (85* in 27 balls) and Abhishek 63* in 23 balls) unbeaten.\n\nSRH ended their run-chase in less than 10 overs, finishing at 167/0 in 9.4 overs, with Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes).\n\nEarlier, a fine half-century from Ayush Badoni and his partnership with Nicholas Pooran helped Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) reach a modest total of 165/4 in their Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nLSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg.\n\nIn the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. At the end of six overs, LSG was 27/2, with KL (19*) and Krunal (2*) unbeaten.In the seventh over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, Krunal relieved some pressure by smashing him for two sixes and getting his team a total of 15 runs out of it.\n\nBy drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs.\n\nThe 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket.\n\nBrief Scores: Lucknow Super Giants: 165/4 (Ayush Badoni 55*, Nicholas Pooran 48, Bhuvneshwar Kumar 2/12) lost to Sunrisers Hyderabad: 167/0 in 9.4 overs (Travis Head 89*, Abhishek Sharma 75*). The 57th match of the Indian Premier League 2024 (IPL 2024) was held at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad.\n\nSRH were invited to bowl first in the match and the bowlers did a fantastic job by restricting LSG to 165/4. Chasing the target, SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma came out all guns blazing and demolished the LSG bowling attack. Head slammed 89 runs in 30 balls while Abhishek Sharma blasted 75 runs in 28 balls to complete the run chase inside 9.4 overs.\n\nAt the post-match presentation ceremony, Pat Cummins said that the duo of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma changed the pitch with their batting. Pat Cummins said:\n\n\"(On did he change the pitch) Maybe Travis and Abhishek did. We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs.\"\n\nWhile speaking about Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, Pat Cummins said that both of them are incredible players and bowling against them is very hard. He stated:\n\n\"(On Travis Head) He's been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional. (On Abhishek Sharma) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them.\"\n\nPat Cummins further said that the par scores in T20 cricket have increased and with the wickets being batting-friendly, the job has become tough for bowlers. Pat Cummins asserted:\n\n\"(On where the game is headed) I think the scores have gone up, and when the wickets are good, it is tough to come up with answers against batters when they get going. The boys have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal.\"\n\nLucknow Super Giants and Sunrisers Hyderabad faced off each other for the first time on April 4, 2022, at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, Mumbai. Batting first, KL Rahul (68) and Deepak Hooda (51) smashed half-centuries and took LSG to 169 for 7. A combined batting effort saw SRH post a good total of 182/6 on the board. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay. It is something I have been working on (spin-hitting), it will be a big part of the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game. The last 12 months, that is how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that is what I have been told to do here as well.\"\n\nPraising his opening partner Abhishek for his hard work and \"deep thinking\", Head said that the uncapped Indian star's spin play is \"second to none\".\n\nAlso Read | Viyaskanth Vijayakanth Quick Facts: Here's All You Need To Know About Wanindu Hasaranga's Replacement in SRH For IPL 2024.\n\n\"We complement each other very well. In just the second over, Abhishek smashed Yash Thakur for four successive boundaries, looting 17 runs from the over. The next over was Head's turn to swing his bat, launching Krishnappa Gowtham for three sixes and a four, getting 22 runs from the over.\n\nA massive six over long-on on a Ravi Bishnoi delivery took SRH to the 50-run mark in just 3.1 overs. Head smashed him for a four and then a six over long-off to concluded the fourth over on a high, getting 17 more runs. The next over saw Abhishek giving the strike to Head and then the Australian proceeding to tear into Naveen-ul-Haq with 4,4,6,4 and 4. Head reached his half-century, his fourth in the tournament, in 16 balls with five fours and five sixes.\n\nAbhishek ended the powerplay on high, once again targeting Yash with two fours and two sixes and taking SRH to 107/0 at the end of six overs, with Head (58*) and Abhishek (46*) unbeaten. Ayush Badoni's first over did turn out to be good, as he gave away 19 runs, including two sixes and a four, all by Abhishek.\n\nSRH brought up their 150-run in 8.2 overs, with Head (85* in 27 balls) and Abhishek 63* in 23 balls) unbeaten. LSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg. In the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. By drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs. The 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten. Badoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership. Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. {"uri": "8118551220", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "06:00:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T06:00:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T06:00:20Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/firstcricket/sports-news/ipl-2024-sunrisers-hyderabad-lucknow-super-giants-srh-vs-lsg-analysis-head-abhishek-sharma-13768889.html", "title": "IPL 2024: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma defy odds on slow Hyderabad track as SRH trounce LSG", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad's Travis Head, left, and Abhishek Sharma congratulate each other after their team's win over Lucknow Super Giants in Hyderabad on Wednesday. AP\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) are back doing Sunrisers Hyderabad things in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Not only did they thump Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 10 wickets on Wednesday, but also dashed Mumbai Indians\u00e2\u20ac\u2122 (MI) hopes of making the IPL playoffs as Hardik Pandya and Co became the first team to be eliminated from the IPL this season.\n\nTravis Head, Abhishek Sharma dominate proceedings yet again\n\nSRH have made a name for themselves by being dominant bowlers on their home turf at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. The Pat Cummins-led outfit have won three out of their four matches at the venue this season so far, with their only defeat coming against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on 25 April.\n\nAlso read | SRH shatter records in rapid run-chase against LSG\n\nThat was while chasing, as they eventually lost by 35 runs, and while the Orange Army aren\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t known to be \u00e2\u20ac\u0153chase masters\u00e2\u20ac in the IPL as far as this season is concerned, Travis Head (89*) and Abhishek Sharma (75*) proved otherwise on Wednesday. The famed SRH opening duo have batted on their terms throughout the season with some free-flowing performances, and it was something similar on Wednesday against a hapless LSG bowling lineup.\n\nOn a rather slow wicket to bat on in Hyderabad, LSG did exactly that after they won the toss. And that backfired early on, with dismissals of Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis as Bhuvneshwar Kumar struck twice in the powerplay. KL Rahul\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s strike-rate was once again under scrutiny after hitting just one four and one six in a 33-ball knock of 29. Hitting at a strike-rate of below 100 is far from ideal in a T20 and Rahul was undone by the length balls and inswingers that Bhuvneshwar kept producing.\n\nThe LSG captain was dismissed by Pat Cummins in the 10th over after he holed out to T Natarajan at long leg.\n\nLSG were 57/3 at that stage and were further restricted to 66/4 in the 12th following Krunal Pandya\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s wicket. What followed, however, was a valiant fightback from Nicholas Pooran (48*) and Ayush Badoni (55*), who put on an unbeaten 99 runs off 52 deliveries for the fifth wicket. Lucknow eventually managed to post 165/4, a total that Badoni felt bowlers could defend if there was no dew on offer.\n\nAs Badoni predicted, there wasn\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t much dew. But, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, the ever-dependable \u00e2\u20ac\u0153Travishek\u00e2\u20ac opening duo, defied the odds. Hoping that spinners would be of good use on the slower surface against SRH, Rahul turned to off-break bowler Krishnappa Gowtham to begin the bowling attack.\n\nThe first over was largely a disciplined one from Gowtham, barring a boundary off Head in the last ball of that over. However, in just his second over, the all-rounder would get bashed for some merciless boundaries from the Australia big-hitter. Head began with a maximum over the bowler, before slamming a couple more sixes towards the sightscreen later in the over. A total of 22 runs had come off the 35-year-old\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s second over and added to Lucknow\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s misery as SRH rushed to 47/0 in just three overs.\n\nAbhishek Sharma, meanwhile, had begun his assault even before. In the second over, when he hit four fours off Yash Thakur. The 50-run stand between Abhishek and Head came in less than four overs, courtesy of a maximum from the former over long-on. To be exact, the half-century run partnership came off just 19 balls, the same amount of deliveries Abhishek got to his fifty.\n\nDot balls were hard to come by for Lucknow and the innings appeared as of a highlights package. Just 14 dot balls were bowled during these 9.4 overs that SRH took to finish the match as Abhishek and Head got going and compelled the bowlers to dance to their tunes.\n\nAnd just like that, SRH got to 107 inside the powerplay without losing a wicket. That was the second-highest powerplay total this IPL after SRH\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s 125/0 against Delhi Capitals (DC) earlier. LSG also missed pacer Mohsin Khan due to a head injury and that hurt their chances big time. In only his first over, Naveen-ul-Haq went for 23 runs as he bowled the fifth over of the chase. SRH were more than halfway through, having reached 87/0 by then. Ravi Bishnoi also got punished by both the openers for regular boundaries.\n\nThe heavy defeat left skipper KL Rahul clueless. \"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on tv. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" Rahul said after the match, adding that the visitors were at least \"40-50 runs\" short.\n\nThe loss leaves LSG with more work left to be done in order to qualify for the playoffs. Two victories in their last two matches would only take them to 16 point s, which may not be enough given that Chennai Super Kings (CSK) have an extra game in hand.\n\nCSK (Fourth, 12 points) DC (Fifth, 12 points) and LSG (Sixth, 12 points) are in a tight contest for possibly the fourth playoff spot, and it\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s anyone\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s guess as to who among the three teams Travis Head achieved a 50 from just 16 balls, while Abhishek Sharma reached his half-century in 19 balls, leading SRH to a stunning victory over Lucknow. With the win, SRH now move to the third spot in the IPL 2024 points table.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG captain KL Rahul opted to bat first. I think the scores have gone up, and when the wickets are good, it is tough to come up with answers against batters when they get going. The boys have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal.\"\n\nComing to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nHead took home the 'Player of the Match' award. LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) did not waste any time as openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma attacked right from the start. In just the second over, Abhishek smashed Yash Thakur for four successive boundaries, looting 17 runs from the over.\n\nThe next over was Head's turn to swing his bat, launching Krishnappa Gowtham for three sixes and a four, getting 22 runs from the over.\n\nA massive six over long-on on a Ravi Bishnoi delivery took SRH to the 50-run mark in just 3.1 overs. Head smashed him for a four and then a six over long-off to concluded the fourth over on a high, getting 17 more runs.\n\nThe next over saw Abhishek giving the strike to Head and then the Australian proceeding to tear into Naveen-ul-Haq with 4,4,6,4 and 4. Head reached his half-century, his fourth in the tournament, in 16 balls with five fours and five sixes.\n\nAbhishek ended the powerplay on high, once again targeting Yash with two fours and two sixes and taking SRH to 107/0 at the end of six overs, with Head (58*) and Abhishek (46*) unbeaten. SRH reached the 100-run mark in just 5.4 overs.\n\nAbhishek reached his second fifty in the tournament in 19 balls, with six fours and four sixes. Ayush Badoni's first over did turn out to be good, as he gave away 19 runs, including two sixes and a four, all by Abhishek.\n\nSRH brought up their 150-run in 8.2 overs, with Head (85* in 27 balls) and Abhishek 63* in 23 balls) unbeaten.\n\nSRH ended their run-chase in less than 10 overs, finishing at 167/0 in 9.4 overs, with Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes).\n\nEarlier, a fine half-century from Ayush Badoni and his partnership with Nicholas Pooran helped Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) reach a modest total of 165/4 in their Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nLSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg.\n\nIn the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. At the end of six overs, LSG was 27/2, with KL (19*) and Krunal (2*) unbeaten.\n\nIn the seventh over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, Krunal relieved some pressure by smashing him for two sixes and getting his team a total of 15 runs out of it.\n\nBy drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs.\n\nThe 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket.\n\nBrief Scores: Lucknow Super Giants: 165/4 (Ayush Badoni 55*, Nicholas Pooran 48, Bhuvneshwar Kumar 2/12) lost to Sunrisers Hyderabad: 167/0 in 9.4 overs (Travis Head 89*, Abhishek Sharma 75*). Sunrisers Hyderabad openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smashed Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) bowlers to the pulp, registering a ten-wicket victory and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in their Indian Premier League (IPL) game at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nSpeaking after the match, Head said in the post-match presentation, \"Had a lot of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Abhishek Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay. It is something I have been working on (spin-hitting), it will be a big part of the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game. The last 12 months, that is how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that is what I have been told to do here as well.\" Praising his opening partner Abhishek for his hard work and \"deep thinking\", Head said that the uncapped Indian star's spin play is \"second to none\".\n\n\"We complement each other very well. We didn't think about it till the Timeout, but after that, the boys came out and told us to score quickly. The crowd was exceptional tonight, that is what we needed after losing the last two. I haven't got many things over him, so that is good to know that I have more runs than David Warner did in his first SRH season,\" he concluded. Coming to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG. Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket. SRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is in the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points. {"uri": "8119184079", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "13:05:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T13:05:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T13:04:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2933392-better-behind-closed-doors-brett-lee-on-animated-discussion-between-kl-rahul-lsg-owner-goenka-after-crushing-defeat", "title": "\"Better behind closed doors\": Brett Lee on animated discussion between KL Rahul, LSG owner Goenka after crushing defeat | Sports-Games", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) destroyed the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), dominating them with the new ball and then chasing the target of 166 in 9.4 overs without losing a wicket\n\nFormer Australian pacer Brett Lee said on Thursday that the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) owner Sanjiv Goenka should have held discussions with the skipper KL Rahul behind closed doors after the team was steamrolled by Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) who won by 10 wickets and achieved the target in less than 10 overs. After the match, a video from the animated discussion has been doing the rounds on the internet in which franchise owner Sanjiv Goenka is seen talking to Lucknow skipper KL Rahul near the LSG dugout.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) destroyed the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), dominating them with the new ball and then chasing the target of 166 in 9.4 overs without losing a wicket in the IPL match played on Wednesday. It was the fastest 10-over score in T20. Speaking about the video at an event in Delhi, Lee said the conversation should have happened behind the doors.\n\n\"It gets tough as a team owner, as a captain and a coach. You try to do the best you can. When yesterday, LSG made 160-odd and SRH blew them away without losing a wicket, people are going to ask you questions. But there is a time and place. There is a place behind closed doors that would have been a better option, rather than the whole world watching. On the other side, you look at the passion of owners and coaches for their team, they want them to do well.\" Though KL has helped the team win matches with his captaincy tactics, his strike rate has been under the scanner this season. In 12 matches, he has scored 460 runs at an average of 38.33 and a strike rate of just over 136, with three half-centuries. His best score is 82.\n\nAfter the match, Rahul said he was at a loss for words for the Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's blitzkrieg hitting. \"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills,\" Rahul said.\n\nThe loss was LSG's sixth in the IPL 2024, and because of the wide margin of defeat, it damaged their net run rate as well. They are currently ranked sixth after falling below Delhi Capitals. LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand and LSG had a score of 165/4 in 20 overs. Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters. SRH are at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. {"uri": "8117886065", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:25:16", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:25:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:22:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/sports-news-had-these-boys-batted-first-sachin-hails-srhs-opening-pair-of-head-abhishek-following-win-over-lsg-5950955.html", "title": "Sports News | Had These Boys Batted First..: Sachin Hails SRH's Opening Pair of Head-Abhishek Following Win over LSG | LatestLY", "body": "Mumbai (Maharashtra) [India], May 8 (ANI): Following Sunrisers Hyderabad's (SRH) ten-wicket win against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH), legendary Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar hailed its explosive opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, saying that they would have scored 300 runs for their side had they batted first.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smashed Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) bowlers to the pulp, registering a ten-wicket victory and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in their Indian Premier League (IPL) game at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nAlso Read | Mumbai Indians Out of IPL 2024 Playoffs Race As SunRisers Hyderabad Beat Lucknow Super Giants.\n\nTaking to the X (formerly Twitter) after the game, Sachin wrote, \"A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300! #SRHvLSG #IPL2024.\"\n\nhttps://twitter.com/sachin_rt/status/1788253499622338968\n\nAlso Read | Viyaskanth Vijayakanth Quick Facts: Here's All You Need To Know About Wanindu Hasaranga's Replacement in SRH For IPL 2024.\n\nHead is the third-highest run-getter this season with 533 runs in 11 matches at an average of 53.30 and a strike rate of 201.89, with a century and four fifties. His best score is 102.\n\nAbhishek is the 11th-highest run-getter with 401 runs in 12 matches at an average of 36.45 and a strike rate of 205.64, with two fifties. His best score is 75*.\n\nComing to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Abhishek Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay. It is something I have been working on (spin-hitting), it will be a big part of the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game. The last 12 months, that is how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that is what I have been told to do here as well.\"\n\nPraising his opening partner Abhishek for his hard work and \"deep thinking\", Head said that the uncapped Indian star's spin play is \"second to none\".\n\n\"We complement each other very well. We didn't think about it till the Timeout, but after that, the boys came out and told us to score quickly. The crowd was exceptional tonight, that is what we needed after losing the last two. I haven't got many things over him, so that is good to know that I have more runs than David Warner did in his first SRH season,\" he concluded.\n\nComing to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in first 10 overs and losing three wickets. {"uri": "8117846900", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:50:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:50:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:50:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.news18.com/cricket/ipl-2024-srh-vs-lsg-kl-rahul-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-sunrisers-hyderabad-beat-lucknow-super-giants-by-10-wickets-8883218.html", "title": "Am Lost for Words! KL Rahul Numb After Travis Head-Abhishek Sharma Blitzkrieg - News18", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants KL Rahul skipper was at a loss for words after Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma helped Sunrisers Hyderabad win by 10 wickets.\n\nKL Rahul was at a loss for words after Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's blitzkrieg hitting helped Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) outplay Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 10 wickets in their 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL) clash at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nIPL 2024: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants - HIGHLIGHTS | REPORT\n\nThe LSG skipper said that he had no words to describe the batting they just witnessed, adding that everything seemed to be hitting the middle of SRH openers' bats.\n\n\"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills,\" KL Rahul said after the match.\n\nKL also added that the pitch did not change much and the only way to stop batters from coming in with this mindset was by picking wickets in the powerplay, which they did not.\n\n\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" he said.\n\nHead (89 not out, 30b) and Abhishek (75 not out, 28b) pummelled LSG bowlers for their stand for the opening wicket and raced past the target of 166 in just 9.4 overs.\n\nStay updated with the latest from IPL 2024, including top contenders for the IPL 2024 Orange Cap and IPL 2024 Purple Cap. Explore the complete IPL 2024 Schedule, IPL 2024 Points Table and players with the Most Sixes, Most Fours and Most Fifties in IPL 2024\n\nEarlier, Ayush Badoni's unbeaten fifty carried LSG to 165 for four on a slow pitch. For the Lucknow Super Giants, Badoni (55 not out) and Pooran (48 not out) played handy knocks. Pooran and Badoni added 99 runs for the unbroken fifth wicket for SRH.\n\nKL accepted that LSG were 40-50 runs short but added that Pooran and Badoni batted well to take them to 166.\n\n\"Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum,\" KL said.\n\n\"Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. {"uri": "8119182292", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "13:03:45", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T13:03:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T13:03:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7254902124404907, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/better-behind-closed-doors-brett-lee-on-animated-discussion-between-kl-rahul-lsg-owner-goenka-after-crushing-defeat20240509182718/", "title": "\"Better behind closed doors\": Brett Lee on animated discussion between KL Rahul, LSG owner Goenka after crushing defeat", "body": "New Delhi [India], May 9 (ANI): Former Australian pacer Brett Lee said on Thursday that the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) owner Sanjiv Goenka should have held discussions with the skipper KL Rahul behind closed doors after the team was steamrolled by Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) who won by 10 wickets and achieved the target in less than 10 overs.\n\nAfter the match, a video from the animated discussion has been doing the rounds on the internet in which franchise owner Sanjiv Goenka is seen talking to Lucknow skipper KL Rahul near the LSG dugout.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) destroyed the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), dominating them with the new ball and then chasing the target of 166 in 9.4 overs without losing a wicket in the IPL match played on Wednesday. It was the fastest 10-over score in T20.\n\nSpeaking about the video at an event in Delhi, Lee said the conversation should have happened behind the doors.\n\n\"It gets tough as a team owner, as a captain and a coach. You try to do the best you can. When yesterday, LSG made 160-odd and SRH blew them away without losing a wicket, people are going to ask you questions. But there is a time and place. There is a place behind closed doors that would have been a better option, rather than the whole world watching. On the other side, you look at the passion of owners and coaches for their team, they want them to do well.\"\n\nThough KL has helped the team win matches with his captaincy tactics, his strike rate has been under the scanner this season. In 12 matches, he has scored 460 runs at an average of 38.33 and a strike rate of just over 136, with three half-centuries. His best score is 82.\n\nAfter the match, Rahul said he was at a loss for words for the Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's blitzkrieg hitting.\n\n\"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills,\" Rahul said.\n\nThe loss was LSG's sixth in the IPL 2024, and because of the wide margin of defeat, it damaged their net run rate as well. They are currently ranked sixth after falling below Delhi Capitals.\n\nLSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand and LSG had a score of 165/4 in 20 overs.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters.\n\nSRH are at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. We kind of complement each other. He is very very enjoyable to be around. He is very very excited and thinks about the game,\" Head said at a post-match press conference.\n\nThe powerplay, a phase of the match the Sunrisers have dominated in the tournament so far, set the stage for this victory. They scored an incredible 107 runs during the powerplay overs, practically snuffing out any hopes of a comeback that Lucknow may have entertained and took their team to within a touching distance of the target in under 10 overs.\n\nThe persistent and ferocious assault by the SRH openers was simply too much for the LSG bowlers to handle.\n\nAfter posting a reasonable and fighting target of 167 on the board, the Sunrisers, riding on the exploits of the opening duo, cantered home in just 9.4 overs. The fireworks by the willow-wielders yet again reaffirmed the team's formidable batting lineup, which is arguably among the most feared this ongoing IPL season.\n\n\"Yeah, very happy with how we operate in power play and also glad to see how we scored runs outside of power play today. At time out we spoke about NRR (Net Run Rate) being important. Very pleased that checked out,\" he added.\n\nLSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got off to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. {"uri": "8117810968", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:22:09", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:22:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:21:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.crictracker.com/social-tracker-cricket/ipl-2024-top-10-memes-from-srh-vs-lsg-match-57/", "title": "IPL 2024: Funniest Memes from SRH vs LSG, Match 57", "body": "During the 57th match of the ongoing IPL 2024 season, held in Hyderabad on (Wednesday) May 8, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) showcased a dominant performance against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), securing a resounding victory by ten wickets with an impressive margin of 62 balls remaining.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG chose to bat first but encountered early setbacks as their openers, Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis, departed cheaply. Despite Skipper KL Rahul's efforts to stabilize the innings with a modest 29-run contribution, it was Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni who provided the real fireworks. Pooran remained unbeaten with a scorching 48 off 26 deliveries, while Badoni played an electrifying knock of 55 runs off just 30 balls. Despite their strong efforts, LSG managed to post a competitive total of 165/4 in their allotted 20 overs.\n\nSRH's bowling unit demonstrated discipline, led by Bhuvneshwar Kumar, who claimed two crucial wickets while conceding a mere 12 runs in his four overs. Pat Cummins also contributed with a wicket, albeit conceding 47 runs during his spell.\n\nIn pursuit of 166 runs, SRH openers Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head launched a relentless assault on the LSG bowlers. Travis Head played a remarkable innings, finishing unbeaten on 89 off just 30 balls, displaying exceptional hitting prowess with eight fours and eight sixes. Abhishek Sharma complemented him perfectly with an explosive knock of 75 runs off only 28 deliveries, smashing eight fours and six sixes. Together, they dismantled the LSG bowling attack, guiding SRH to victory without losing a single wicket.\n\nAfter the match, KL Rahul praised the extraordinary batting display by Sunrisers Hyderabad, expressing awe at their remarkable skill and ability to consistently find the middle of the bat. He acknowledged the relentless six-hitting prowess of the opposition and admitted the challenge they posed from the very start. Rahul admitted that being on the losing side raises questions about decision-making and acknowledged that his team fell short by 40-50 runs.\n\n\"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on tv. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. Once you are on the losing side, there are questions marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well,\" Rahul said during the post-match presentation.\n\nAlso Read: Watch: Pat Cummins celebrates birthday with father and SRH teammates, video goes viral\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad will face Gujarat Titans in their upcoming match at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on May 16th, while Lucknow Super Giants will The duo blazed through the powerplay, smashing 107 runs, with Head reaching a joint fastest half century off just 16 balls. Abhishek Sharma wasn't far behind, completing his half century in just 19 balls.\n\nChasing a target of 166, SRH's openers displayed remarkable synergy, with Head remaining unbeaten at 89* and Abhishek Sharma at 75*. The pair completed the chase in just 9.4 overs, setting a new record for the fastest 10 wicket victory in IPL history. Their partnership of 166 runs not only sealed the match but also etched their names in IPL record books.\n\nSRH's dominance with the bat was evident throughout the match. {"uri": "8117963118", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "19:30:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T19:30:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T19:29:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7019608020782471, "url": "https://pragativadi.com/srh-vs-lsg-ipl-2024-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-star-as-hyderabad-thrash-lucknow-by-10-wickets/", "title": "SRH vs LSG, IPL 2024: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma star as Hyderabad thrash Lucknow by 10 wickets", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) stormed through to a 10-wicket victory over the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting dominated the day and continued to show why the SRH batting is one of the most feared in the TATA Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024. A target of 166 was chased down in 9.4 overs - a fact that sums up SRH's batting performance of the day.\n\nSRH's pyrotechnics were on display in the powerplay - a phase they have generally dominated through the tournament. SRH scored 107 in the powerplay alone - which effectively won them the game. The LSG bowlers had no margin for error as the left-handed opening pair were intent on dominating the day.\n\nWhat makes their feat most mind-boggling is that they only made eight runs in the first over. The second over is when they unleashed their best with Abhishek stroking four fours off Yash Thakur. When K Gowtham came on to bowl the third - Head got into the act by picking up 22 - three sixes and a four. This forced KL Rahul to bring in Ravi Bishnoi in the fourth over - a move that did not deter SRH as the runs continued to flow easily. When Naveen-ul-Haq came on for the fifth over, Head maintained that tempo and raced away to a 16-ball half-century. That over too went for 23.\n\nThakur bowled the last over of the powerplay and Abhishek, matched Head shot for shot and took SRH past their 100. When the field spread, many would have felt that there would be some respite for LSG. That wasn't the case as Head slog-swept the first ball of the seventh over for a six over mid-wicket. Abhishek then got to his fifty by hitting a six over long-on.\n\nThe boundaries kept flowing from both ends. It didn't matter who came on to bowl, as Head and Abhishek were batting as if they had to get the target inside 10 overs. Victory was achieved when Abhishek smashed Thakur over cover for a huge six. Head remained unbeaten on 89 off 30 balls, and Abhishek finished on 75 not out off 28 balls. The SRH innings featured as many as 16 fours and 14 sixes. The LSG bowlers had a day to forget as their bowling figures indicated.\n\nEarlier, SRH's bowlers had done well to restrict LSG to 165 by jolting their top order with wickets at regular intervals. It was only due to a good partnership by Ayush Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Nicholas Pooran (48 not out of 26 balls) that LSG reached that total. The unbeaten 99-run stand dominated the last 10 overs of their innings. It was quite in contrast with the way LSG's innings panned out in the first 10.\n\nIn the initial overs, Bhuveshwar Kumar brought in all his experience to put pressure on the LSG batting. In his first three overs, he conceded only seven runs and bagged the first two wickets of Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis. It was evident with the score at the end of the powerplay - which was 27 for two. LSG had to rebuild with Krunal Pandya and KL Rahul.\n\nPandya decided to shift gears in the eighth over when he targeted Jaydev Unadkat and smashed two sixes. However, LSG were still scoring at less than a run-a-ball overall and the difficulties only compounded when Rahul fell for 29 - hitting one off Pat Cummins to the deep. In the 12th over, Pandya was run-out for 24. That is when Pooran and Badoni came together.\n\nWhile Pooran showed all his application and experience, Badoni was the one who brought out the aggression and helped pump life into the LSG innings. When T Natarajan was brought in for the 14th over, Badoni opened up and picked three fours. The 16-run over brought in much-needed impetus. What helped LSG was that the two batters managed to score over 10 runs in every over since the 14th - apart from Bhuvneshwar's last - which went for only five runs. Bhuvneshwar capped off a successful spell of two for 12 - outlandish figures considering what we saw later in the match.\n\nBadoni brought up his fifty in the penultimate over - getting there off only 28 balls. The last two overs of the LSG innings went for 34 - which included 19 off the last bowled by Cummins. This propelled LSG to 165. If one puts into perspective their effort in the first 10, the recovery was remarkable and would have given them hope going into the defence. MI's campaign under the leadership of newly appointed captain Hardik Pandya will end after the conclusion of the league stage.\n\nCurrently languishing at the bottom of the table, MI's dreams of securing a playoff berth have been shattered. {"uri": "8117846612", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:51:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:51:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:50:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7019608020782471, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/credit-goes-to-him-srh-batter-abhishek-hails-head-after-sealing-massive-win-over-lsg20240508231651/", "title": "\"Credit goes to him\": SRH batter Abhishek hails Head after sealing massive win over LSG", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 8 (ANI): Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) opener Abhishek Sharma gave all the credit to his opening partner Travis Head for helping their franchise seal a massive 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 on Wednesday.\n\nAbhishek played an unbeaten 78-run knock from just 28 balls at a strike rate of 267.86. He slammed 8 fours and 6 sixes while chasing the 166-run target given by LSG.\n\nSpeaking after the match, Abhishek heaped praise on Travis Head for taking the pressure off from the start of the run chase.\n\nThe 23-year-old revealed that the Sunrisers bowlers adviced the batters during the inning break and told them that the pitch was getting better for batting. He also thanked Yuvraj Singh, Brian Lara, and his father for helping him reach at this level.\n\n\"All the credit goes to him (Travis Head). The way he starts against all bowlers... he goes after them from the start and takes the pressure off. The bowlers told us (during the innings break) that it was getting better, but myself and Travis thought it was not doing much. I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,\" Abhishek said.\n\nSummarizing the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of just 29 runs.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89*) and Abhishek Sharma (75*) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG ballers, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is in the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points. His best score is 102.\n\nAbhishek is the 11th-highest run-getter with 401 runs in 12 matches at an average of 36.45 and a strike rate of 205.64, with two fifties. His best score is 75*.\n\nComing to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nHead took home the 'Player of the Match' award. {"uri": "8118297726", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "01:36:15", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T01:36:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T01:35:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6980392336845398, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/srh-vs-lsg-lost-for-words-kl-rahul-absolutely-shocked-after-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-smash-lsg/", "title": "SRH vs LSG: \"Lost for words\" - KL Rahul absolutely shocked after Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma smash LSG", "body": "KL Rahul-led Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) played an away encounter against the Pat Cummins-led Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) on Wednesday, May 8. The 57th match of the Indian Premier League 2024 (IPL 2024) was held at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad.\n\nLucknow Super Giants won the toss and chose to bat first in the match. They weren't able to make the most of the decision and were off to a poor start as they batted slow and lost wickets at regular intervals. However, good performances from Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran helped LSG score 165 runs.\n\nChasing the target, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma made a mockery of the Lucknow Super Giants bowling unit and played stupendous cricket. Head smashed 89 while Abhishek slammed 75 as SRH completed run-chase in 9.4 overs\n\nSpeaking after the match, KL Rahul said that he was lost for words as the blistering batting of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma left him awestruck. KL Rahul said:\n\n\"I'm lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on tv. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings.\"\n\nKL Rahul admitted that his bowlers found it hard to stop Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma as they kept going from ball one. KL Rahul further said that they were 40-50 runs short, but he acknowledged the fact that the SRH openers would have even chased a total of 240 with the kind of batting they did. KL Rahul said:\n\n\"Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. Once you are on the losing side, there are questions marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well.\"\n\nLucknow Super Giants haven't had the smoothest of campaigns in the Indian Premier League 2024. Before the match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, Lucknow Super Giants won 3 out of 5 matches they featured in. They registered wins against MI and CSK and lost against RR and KKR.\n\nAhead of the SRH clash, the KL Rahul-led side occupied the sixth position in the standings above Gujarat Titans, Mumbai Indians, Punjab Kings, and Royal Challengers Bengaluru. They had 12 points under their belt in 11 matches, LSG had won 6 and lost 5 games. On what seemed to be a slow surface, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma launched a relentless attack on LSG bowlers to register a 10-wicket win at home on Wednesday, creating a record of the highest total to be chased down within less than 10 overs.\n\n\"Maybe Travis and Abhishek did (on did he change the pitch). We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I am a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any input,\" Cummins said during the post-match presentation. He praised Head, also his Australian teammate. \"He has been like this for two years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional.\"\n\nOn Abhishek Sharma's hitting, Cummins said, \"Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just two fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them. I think the scores have gone up, and when the wickets are good, it is tough to come up with answers against batters when they get going. The boys have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal.\" Coming to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG. Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket. SRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nHead took home the 'Player of the Match' award. Marco Jansen bagging a wicket of Ishan Kishan hasn't made any big impression as he has the figures of 1 for 45, 0 for 44, and 0 for 40 in his three appearances this IPL.\n\nThey are a versatile side and there is no doubt about that but they need to fix their combination well as they return to home where they have a 3-1 win-loss record this season. {"uri": "8117814765", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:25:16", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:25:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:24:31Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/ipl-2024-lsg-skipper-kl-rahul-lost-for-words-after-10-wicket-defeat-against-srh20240508225416/", "title": "IPL 2024: LSG skipper KL Rahul \"lost for words\" after 10-wicket defeat against SRH", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 8 (ANI): After his side's massive 10-wicket defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday, Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) skipper KL Rahul expressed that he is \"lost for words\".\n\nWhile speaking after the match, Rahul said they have watched such kind of batting only on television. He also praised Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma'a batting and said it was \"unreal\".\n\n\"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills,\" Rahul said.\n\nHe added the SRH openers did not give any chance to the Lucknow-based franchise. He accepted it was hard to stop the opening duo of Abhishek and Head.\n\n\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. Once you are on the losing side, there are questions marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well,\" he added.\n\nRecapping the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of just 29 runs.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89*) and Abhishek Sharma (75*) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG ballers, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is in the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points. Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad hosted the clash on Wednesday, May 8. Courtesy of the victory, SRH improved their net-run rate and moved to third position in the points table.\n\nAfter opting to bat first, LSG managed to score 165/4 in 20 overs. They got off to a poor start and were reeling at 66/4 in 11.2 overs. Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) then played magnificent knocks to help the Super Giants to a respectable total. Bhuvneshwar Kumar stole the show with the ball, bowling a wonderful spell of 4-0-12-1.\n\nThere was no contest in the second innings as SRH openers bulldozed their way to 167/0 in just 9.4 overs. Travis Head (89*) and Abhishek Sharma (75*) competed between themselves in hitting boundaries as they smashed the LSG bowlers all around the park with absolute disdain.\n\nFans on social media enjoyed the lop-sided IPL 2024 match between SRH and LSG on Wednesday night. This is the first meeting between the two sides this season. LSG have won all three previous games against SRH.\n\nThe SRH vs LSG IPL 2024 match will be played in Hyderabad on May 8 from 7.30 pm IST. SRH are yet to win against LSG in the IPL and play their remaining three games at home.\n\nSRH came back to winning ways against RR as they won by one run but then lost to Mumbai Indians. Despite the loss, they have managed to cling on to the fourth spot on the points table.\n\nChasing has been their major problem this season something that the opposition teams have noticed. Batting first and piling up big totals remains their strength and they have been pretty good at doing that.\n\nSRH batters Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma have been key to them getting good starts just like Phil Salt and Sunil Narine for KKR. Their batters have given them the cushion of extra 20-30 runs to defend totals.\n\nThe template for success is set for them and they would like to make it count by playing at home. Their batting was a bit below par last game and back at home where they achieved a lot of success they would be gunning to win the remaining three games.\n\nSRH Squad\n\nPat Cummins (c), Abdul Samad, Abhishek Sharma, Aiden Markram, Marco Jansen, Rahul Tripathi, Washington Sundar, Glenn Phillips, Sanvir Singh, Heinrich Klaasen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mayank Agarwal, T. They have won some close games but have been outplayed in a few games, especially against KKR. The Knight Riders won the previous game by 8 wickets at home and in Lucknow piled up 235 with the bat and bowled out the opposition for just 137. The defeat has rung the alarm bells for LSG.\n\nLucknow Super Giants will play their remaining three games away from home and the challenge for them will be to take the pressure and find a way to win games.\n\nKL Rahul (c), Quinton de Kock, Nicholas Pooran, Ayush Badoni, Kyle Mayers, Marcus Stoinis, Deepak Hooda, Devdutt Padikkal, Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq, Krunal Pandya, Yudhvir Singh, Prerak Mankad, Yash Thakur, Amit Mishra, Shamar Joseph, Mayank Yadav, Mohsin Khan, K. Gowtham, Arshin Kulkarni, M. Siddharth, Ashton Turner, Matt Henry, Mohd. Arshad Khan\n\nRahul has been slow to start in the last few games. Stoinis has been in good form with the bat and started well against KKR. For SRH to win, they must dismiss him early.\n\nThe southpaw will come up against the SRH death overs specialist in the final overs. This contest might well dictate the result of the match. Pooran played for SRH in IPL 2022.\n\nThe SRH opener has been in red-hot form this season and will look to take on the LSG bowlers on a placid Hyderabad pitch. Naveen's change-ups and slower deliveries might work in his favor like it did against Phil Salt.\n\nThe two batters have been severe against spinners hitting 28 and 31 sixes respectively. Ravi Bishnoi will need to bowl to them with a big heart and look to dismiss them early.\n\nFor SRH, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharam will be key with the bat. Heinrich Klaasen is key in the middle-order. With the ball, they have relied on their seamers to get the job done and hence Cummins, Bhuvi, and Natarajan will be key.\n\nFor LSG, KL Rahul, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran will be key with the bat. It will be interesting to see whether they include either of de Kock or Mayers in the lineup. With the ball, Naveen, Bishnoi, and Krunal will be key.\n\nThe temperature will be around 27 to 30 degrees in the evening, and The humidity levels will be around 70 percent, There is a five percent chance of rain but the clouds might clear out by the evening.\n\nTalking about the pitch, Hyderabad has been a high-scoring venue with SRH themselves posting 277 against MI earlier this season. {"uri": "2024-05-349304294", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "16:58:40", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T16:58:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T16:46:31Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/socially/sports/cricket/sunrisers-hyderabad-defeat-lucknow-super-giants-by-10-wickets-in-ipl-2024-rampaging-travis-head-and-abhishek-sharma-power-srh-to-dominant-win-against-lsg-5950776.html", "title": "Sunrisers Hyderabad Defeat Lucknow Super Giants By 10 Wickets in IPL 2024: Rampaging Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma Power SRH to Dominant Win Against LSG", "body": "A score that seemed like competitive in the first innings, was blown away by Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma who scored brilliant half-centuries to take their team over winning line.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad return to winning ways as they completely demolish Lucknow Super Giants by ten wickets. After winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first and struggled to get going in the powerplay. LSG lost Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis early and KL Rahul got stuck before getting dismissed. A partnership between Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran took them to a competitive total of 165. But the score didn't look competitive at all when SRH came out to bat as the openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma demolished the LSG bowlers to race to the target in just 9.4 overs. We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I am a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any input,\" Cummins said during the post-match presentation.\n\nHe praised Head, also his Australian teammate. \"He has been like this for two years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional.\"\n\nOn Abhishek Sharma's hitting, Cummins said, \"Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just two fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them. I think the scores have gone up, and when the wickets are good, it is tough to come up with answers against batters when they get going. The boys have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal.\"\n\nComing to the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG is at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.\n\nHead took home the 'Player of the Match' award. {"uri": "2024-05-349377625", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:19:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:19:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:56:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.686274528503418, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/news-ipl-2024-qualification-scenarios-how-can-lsg-qualify-playoffs-10-wicket-loss-srh", "title": "IPL 2024 Qualification scenarios: How can LSG qualify for playoffs after their 10-wicket loss to SRH?", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) suffered a 10-wicket annihilation against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in match number 57 of IPL 2024 at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, May 8. Batting first after winning the toss, LSG put up a disappointing 165-4, which SRH chased down in a mere 9.4 overs.\n\nLucknow got off to a poor start, losing their first four wickets for 66 inside 12 overs. Ayush Badoni (55* off 30) and Nicholas Pooran (48* off 26) added an unbroken 99 for the fifth wicket to lift LSG to 165. Travis Head (89* off 30) and Abhishek Sharma (75* off 28), though, added 167* in 9.4 overs to stun Lucknow.\n\nFollowing the pounding against Sunrisers Hyderabad, the Super Giants have moved down to sixth position in the IPL 2024 points table. They have 12 points from as many matches at a net run rate of -0.769. The huge loss to SRH has made Lucknow's path to qualify for the playoffs a tough one now.\n\nThe Super Giants need to win both their remaining two league matches to finish with 16 points while boosting their net run rate significantly. To qualify for the IPL 2024 playoffs with 16 points, they also need other results to go their way.\n\nKolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals are on 16 points, while SRH, Chennai Super Kings and Delhi Capitals can also touch 16 points.\n\nLucknow Super Giants will have to hope that two of the three teams among SRH, CSK and DC don't reach 16 points. That way, they could sneak into the playoffs as the fourth team with 16 points.\n\nIn case of more than one team vying for the fourth place with 16 points, the Super Giants will need to ensure that they have the best run rate to finish fourth and book their spot in the playoffs. Their run rate, though, has taken a severe beating following their 10-wicket hammering against SRH.\n\nLSG's remaining matches in IPL 2024\n\nFollowing the loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad, the Super
