{"uri": "8119304381", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "14:24:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T14:24:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T14:23:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6823529601097107, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2933513-dont-think-anyone-plays-spin-better-abhishek-sharma-lauds-travis-over-runs-blitzkrieg-against-lsg", "title": "\"Don't think anyone plays spin better\": Abhishek Sharma lauds Travis over runs blitzkrieg against LSG | Sports-Games", "body": "On Wednesday, the Hyderabad-based franchise clinched a massive 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, where Head scored 89 runs from 30 balls. Abhishek played a 75-run knock from 28 balls\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) batter Abhishek Sharma heaped praise on his opening partner Travis Head for playing spin like no one else. On Wednesday, the Hyderabad-based franchise clinched a massive 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, where Head scored 89 runs from 30 balls. Abhishek played a 75-run knock from 28 balls.\n\nSpeaking on JioCinema, Abhishek recalled how Head played shots against LSG spinner Krishnappa Gowtham and said not all batters can do that. \"I don't think anyone plays better spin than Travis. The shots he hit off K Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is. He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of his over the last year...I have followed him. When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time,\" Abhishek said.\n\nThe 23-year-old opener talked about his performance and said he started this attacking approach from the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. \"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this. Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that. They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" he added.\n\nSummarizing the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of just 29 runs. In the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) turned things around with a 99-run stand helping put a score of 165/4 for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.In the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89*) and Abhishek Sharma (75*) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG ballers, helping SRH chase the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket. SRH are at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG are at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points. In response, SRH chased down the target in just 9.4 overs with 10 wickets in hand.\n\nAfter opting to bat first, none of the LSG batters, apart from Ayush Badoni (55 off 30) and Nicholas Pooran (48 off 26), showed any intent. Their skipper KL Rahul could only score 29 runs off 33 balls while Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis got out early. On the contrary, the SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma got off to a brilliant start as they amassed 107 runs in powerplay unlike LSG who couldn't even go past the 50-run mark.\n\nMatthew Hayden, former Australian player, blamed the LSG batters for their lack of intent during their innings. He said that the Super Giants required someone to show intent with the bat while highlighting that they didn't score enough runs in the powerplay. \"I have to call them out. This is not 5 runs per over wicket. Somebody needed to show intent. They had one of the slowest powerplays. That took the innings nowhere. When the opposition team has Travis Head, Heinrich Klaasen your intention should be to go at 10s and over. 160-170 will never be enough,\" Hayden said.\n\nAfter the match, LSG skipper KL Rahul was at loss of words and he also appreciated the SRH batters, Head and Abhishek, saying, \"Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings.\n\n\"It was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. "title": "SRH vs LSG Head To Head In IPL History: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants Records, Stats Ahead Of Match At Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium", "body": "SRH vs LSG Head-to-Head in IPL: The result of the match between SRH and LSG today becomes immensely crucial considering the heated race between multiple teams to make it to the playoffs.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants Head-to-Head IPL Records And Stats:\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad will be hosting Lucknow Super Giants in match 57 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday, May 8.\n\nBoth the teams are in desperate need of a win at the moment, having lost their respective previous matches.\n\nLSG lost their previous fixture in the tournament against Kolkata Knight Riders by a huge margin of 98 runs, that too in their own backyard.\n\nSRH, on the other hand, will be heading into the LSG clash on the back of a defeat against Mumbai Indians in their last match at the Wankhede Stadium.\n\nThe result of the match between SRH and LSG today becomes immensely crucial considering the heated race between multiple teams to make it to the playoffs.\n\nNotably, four teams currently have 12 points under their belt including LSG and SRH and will be aiming to make it to the final four with improved performances in their respective remaining matches.\n\nBoth teams have six wins and 12 points under their belt after 11 games but SRH are ahead in the points table, having placed fourth with a net run rate of -0.065.\n\nOn the other hand, LSG stand in the LSG in their much needed winning match against the Sunrisers Hyderabad could only post 165 runs after winning the toss and opting to bat first.\n\n('Rohit Sharma Won't Be At MI Next Year...': Wasim Akram Wants Star Batter With Gautam Gambhir At KKR)\n\nHere's how fans trolled KL Rahul for his struggling knock...\n\nA fine half-century from Ayush Badoni and his partnership with Nicholas Pooran helped Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) reach a modest total of 165/4 in their Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday. LSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg.\n\nIn the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. At the end of six overs, LSG was 27/2, with KL (19*) and Krunal (2*) unbeaten.\n\nIn the seventh over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, Krunal relieved some pressure by smashing him for two sixes and getting his team a total of 15 runs out of it.\n\nBy drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs. The 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership. Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket. {"uri": "8119302317", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "14:22:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T14:22:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T14:21:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6745098233222961, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/dont-think-anyone-plays-spin-better-abhishek-sharma-lauds-travis-over-runs-blitzkrieg-against-lsg20240509194620/", "title": "\"Don't think anyone plays spin better\": Abhishek Sharma lauds Travis over runs blitzkrieg against LSG", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 9 (ANI): Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) batter Abhishek Sharma heaped praise on his opening partner Travis Head for playing spin like no one else.\n\nOn Wednesday, the Hyderabad-based franchise clinched a massive 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, where Head scored 89 runs from 30 balls. Abhishek played a 75-run knock from 28 balls.\n\nSpeaking on JioCinema, Abhishek recalled how Head played shots against LSG spinner Krishnappa Gowtham and said not all batters can do that.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays better spin than Travis. The shots he hit off K Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is. He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of his over the last year...I have followed him. When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time,\" Abhishek said.\n\nThe 23-year-old opener talked about his performance and said he started this attacking approach from the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.\n\n\"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this. Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that. They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" he added.\n\nSummarizing the match, LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of just 29 runs.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) turned things around with a 99-run stand helping put a score of 165/4 for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89*) and Abhishek Sharma (75*) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG ballers, helping SRH chase the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH are at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. LSG are at the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points. {"uri": "8116611345", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "04:03:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T04:03:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T04:03:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6745098233222961, "url": "https://sportzwiki.com/cricket/srh-vs-lsg-dream11-prediction-match-preview-points-table-head-to-head-match-info-weather-pitch-report-fantasy-stats-and-match-prediction-for-match-57-in-ipl-2024/", "title": "SRH vs LSG Dream11 Prediction, Match Preview, Points Table, head to Head, Match info, Weather & Pitch report, Fantasy Stats and Match Prediction for Match 57 in IPL 2024", "body": "SRH vs LSG Dream11 Prediction: Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) will be taking on each other in the 53rd game of the ongoing Indian Premier League 2024 (IPL 2024). The match is scheduled to be played at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday (May 8).\n\nThis article will provide everything you need about the IPL 2024 match between SRH and LSG. You'll get the SRH vs LSG Dream11 prediction, match preview, points table update, head-to-head comparison, match details, weather and pitch report, fantasy cricket stats and our SRH vs LSG match prediction.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG are coming into this game after losing their last games and will be desperate for a win. Both the teams are still in contention for the playoffs and will be looking to bolster their chances of progressing ahead. While a defeat in the upcoming game will not end any of the two team's playoffs chances, a win will put them in the driver's seat to progress ahead.\n\nSRH are coming into this game after suffering a seven-wicket defeat against Mumbai Indians. Opener Abhishek Sharma and the middle-order once again failed to deliver although SRH still managed to finish on a competitive 173/8. However, Mumbai chased down the total inside 18 overs by losing three wickets thanks to Suryakumar Yadav's stunning century.\n\nThe defeat has further extended SRH's slump in form in recent times. They began their season by winning five of their first seven games. However, they have managed to win just one of their last four games and the win was a 1-run victory over Rajasthan Royals. SRH cannot afford more slip ups and will be eyeing a victory against LSG.\n\nLSG suffered a heavy 98-run defeat against Kolkata Knight Riders in their last game. LSG have struggled for consistency this season and will be desperate for a win over SRH to bolster their chances of making it to the playoffs for the third time in a row.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG have six wins and five losses so far. However, SRH are ahead of LSG due to their better net run-rate. While SRH are at the fourth spot, LSG are at the sixth spot in the IPL 2024 points table.\n\nTravis Head, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Agarwal, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klaasen(w), Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Marco Jansen, Pat Cummins(c), Bhuvneshwar Kumar, T Natarajan, Sanvir Singh, Mayank Markande, Glenn Phillips, Jaydev Unadkat, Umran Malik, Aiden Markram, Rahul Tripathi, Washington Sundar, Anmolpreet Singh, Upendra Yadav, Jhatavedh Subramanyan, Vijayakanth Viyaskanth, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Akash Maharaj Singh\n\nKL Rahul(w/c), Arshin Kulkarni, Marcus Stoinis, Deepak Hooda, Nicholas Pooran, Ayush Badoni, Ashton Turner, Krunal Pandya, Yudhvir Singh Charak, Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq, Yash Thakur, Mohsin Khan, Manimaran Siddharth, Krishnappa Gowtham, Devdutt Padikkal, Amit Mishra, Kyle Mayers, Quinton de Kock, Matt Henry, Prerak Mankad, Arshad Khan, Shamar Joseph\n\nHere are the playing XI of SRH vs LSG for the 57th match of IPL 2024:\n\nAbhishek Sharma, Travis Head, Mayank Agarwal, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klaasen(w), Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Marco Jansen, Pat Cummins(c), Bhuvneshwar Kumar, T Natarajan\n\nSRH impact players:\n\nMayank Markande, Glenn Phillips, Sanvir Singh, Jaydev Unadkat, Umran Malik\n\nKL Rahul(w/c), Marcus Stoinis, Deepak Hooda, Nicholas Pooran, Ashton Turner, Ayush Badoni, Krunal Pandya, Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq, Mohsin Khan, Yash Thakur\n\nLSG impact players:\n\nArshin Kulkarni, Manimaran Siddharth, Krishnappa Gowtham, Yudhvir Singh, Devdutt Padikkal\n\nLSG will start the game as slight favourites and are expected to beat SRH. {"uri": "8117813184", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:23:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:23:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:23:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6745098233222961, "url": "https://www.news18.com/cricket/ipl-2024-srh-rewrite-history-books-notch-biggest-total-ever-within-first-10-overs-in-tantalizing-10-wicket-win-over-lsg-8882825.html", "title": "IPL 2024: SRH Rewrite History Books, Notch Biggest Total Ever Within First 10 Overs in Tantalizing 10-Wicket Win Over LSG - News18", "body": "SRH's 167 runs scored in 9.4 overs, with the help of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, broke records galore, as the hosts sealed an utterly dominant 10-wicket win over LSG\n\nThere's firepower, and then there is Sunrisers Hyderabad. The trailblazing SRH showcased to the entire world why they are to be the most feared batting line-up in the entire IPL, as they chased down 166 runs in less than 10 overs, to clinch an utterly dominating 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants.\n\nSRH's chase of 166 in 9.4 overs, or 58 balls, would in fact become a historic landmark, as the 167 scored by SRH would become the highest total ever registered after the first 10 overs of the IPL.\n\nTheir 58-ball win would help them register the biggest win with most balls to spare in IPL history.\n\nLSG won the toss and elected to bat first, a decision that skipper KL Rahul may just regret right now.\n\nAfter a horror show of a start, it was the Badoni-Pooran duo who played through the rough period of LSG with attacking intent to muster up a 99-run partnership within 9 overs, as Badoni and Pooran ended their innings with scores of 55* and 48* respectively to power LSG to a total of 165 runs.\n\nLSG stepped onto the pitch in Hyderabad for the second innings, hoping to defend their total. But, little did they know about the hell that SRH openers Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head would rain down on them.\n\nK Gowtham started with the new ball and got off to a good start, conceding just 8 runs. But, that would turn out to be the only instance in the entire chase in which any LSG bowlers would concede anything less than 14 runs.\n\nAfter Abhishek Sharma's onslaught of Yash Thakur, which would see the opener find 4 fours in a row, Head would go on to rain havoc on Gowtham in his second over, blitzing the unsuspecting spinner for a whopping 22 runs.\n\nHead would lace his strokes with venom as he would run rampage in the over that would see the Aussie pummel the spinner for 3 sixes and 2 fours.\n\nIn a move of desperation, LSG brought in Ravi Bishnoi early, and after a massive six from Abhishek Sharma, negligence would leas to the likes of Yash Thakur dropping a catch to dismiss Abhishek, a mistake the visitors would go on to resent.\n\nHead was nowhere near done with his onslaught though, as the Aussie would go on to slash Naveen Ul-Haq for the same 22 runs as he did Gowtham earlier, and in the process, reach his fifty in just 16 balls, and surpass 500 runs for SRH in this IPL season.\n\nYash Thakur would finally be brought in to finish off the powerplay on some glimpse of hope, but it would all turn out to be disaster for the pacer again, who would get ravaged by Abhishek Sharma for 20 runs off the over, as SRH would end up putting on 107-0 in the powerplay.\n\nTheir 107-run stand would go on to become the second-highest powerplay total scored in the history of the IPL, succeeded only by a 125-run stand put up by the Sunrisers themselves this season in their encounter against Delhi Capitals earlier in the season.\n\nThere would be no slowing down the opening duo though, who would continue to pile on the misery every next over.\n\nThe only real competition that ensued was between Head and Abhishek as to who would steal the limelight. And before you knew it, Abhishek reached his fifty as well in a mere 19 balls, 3 balls more than Head tonight.\n\nKL Rahul and co. was merely rendered spectators as the duo dealt only in fours and sixes throughout, wreaking havoc upon all bowlers thrown their way.\n\nAnd before you knew it all, Abhishek Sharma would end it in style, smashing a six over extra covers from a delivery off Yash Thakur to seal the deal and create history.\n\nWith their win, SRH leap all the way up to third place in the IPL table, whilst LSG are pushed down to sixth place, below Delhi Capitals.", "source": {"uri": "8117816649", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:26:25", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:26:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:26:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6745098233222961, "url": "https://www.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/130374/head-abhishek-trounce-lsg-with-another-blistering-hitting-show", "title": "Head, Abhishek trounce LSG with another blistering hitting show", "body": "Led by Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's blazing knocks, Sunrisers Hyderabad handed Lucknow Super Giants a thumping defeat in a one-sided contest in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The duo helped the side chase down 166 with 62 balls to spare, and significantly propelled their Net Run Rate, moving to the third spot on the points table. 30 of the 58 balls the duo faced were hit for boundaries as they secured their team a 10-wicket win.\n\nThe difference\n\n80 runs separated the two teams in the powerplay. SRH smashed eight sixes in this period, twice of what LSG managed in their entire innings. If with the ball courtesy of Bhuvneshwar Kumar's efforts, SRH gained momentum in the contest, with the bat, they completely killed the chase in this phase.\n\n- LSG KKR Score 27/2 107/0 Run-Rate 4.60 17.83 4s/6s 0/1 13/8\n\nLucknow Super Giants\n\nPowerplay: LSG top-order stuck in grapple-hold\n\nLSG: 27/2 (RR:4.50, 0x4s, 1x6s)\n\nLed by Bhuvneshwar Kumar's fine spell upfront, well aided by Shahbaz Ahmed, SRH managed to restrict LSG to their lowest-ever powerplay score. The batters struggled to find timing and never had the rhythm to get going, losing two crucial wickets - Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis - in this period.\n\nMiddle overs: LSG stutter but fight back\n\nLSG: 75/2 (RR: 8.22, 6x4s, 3x6s)\n\nKrunal Pandya's assault on Jaydev Unadkat, which included two sixes down the ground, allowed LSG to get some much-needed momentum in their innings. However, he didn't find ample support from the other end. Rahul holed out to T Natarajan at long leg and soon after Krunal himself was run out while attempting a quick single. Unlike Bhuvneshwar, however, the other bowlers weren't as threatening. Cummins rotated his resources well and LSG couldn't find the flourish they were looking for.\n\nDeath overs: Badoni, Pooran guide LSG to respectability\n\nLSG: 63/0 (RR: 12.60, 10x4s, 0x6s)\n\nBadoni and Pooran stepped on the accelerator in the death overs and countered SRH's plans of using the slower balls on the hard lengths by attacking the shorter part of the boundary. They couldn't send any of those shots over the rope, including the last one which was superbly defended by Nitish Reddy at sweeper cover. Nonetheless, Badoni used some unconventional strokes and powered along to his fastest IPL half-century and in the company of Pooran, extended their partnership to 99 runs helping the side to a respectable total.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad\n\nPowerplay: Head, Abhishek blow LSG away\n\nSRH: 107/0 (RR: 17.83, 13x4s, 8x6s)\n\nIn the first eight balls of the run-chase, SRH were moving along at run-a-ball, far slower than their standards, and then Abhishek Sharma cut loose. Yash Thakur lost his line, and as the attack continued from both ends - as Travis Head and Abhishek have done for most of this season - LSG ran out of plans. K Gowtham, who bowled an effective first over, was taken to the cleaners in his second, butchered for three sixes and a boundary. The duo exploded and hammered 99 runs in the next 28 balls, which killed the contest. Head, who led the assault, powered along to his joint-fastest half-century, reaching the mark in only 16 balls - his fourth fifty within the powerplay this season, most by any batter ever in IPL.\n\nMiddle: The onslaught continues\n\nLSG: 60/0 in 3.4 overs (RR: 17.65, 3x4s, 6x6s)\n\nThe middle overs started with a six by Travis Head and the chase ended with a six by Abhishek Sharma. The two southpaw continued their relentless attack in the never-ending six-fest as SRH managed to post the highest-ever score within the first 10 overs in the IPL (playing two balls less). Badoni's part-time offbreaks were smashed for 19, Ravi Bishnoi was taken apart for 17, Naveen ul Haq bowled a few effective slower balls but was still carted away for 14. The chase was done and dusted in 58 balls.\n\nWith that win, SRH not only gave their NRR a boost but also knocked out Mumbai Indians from the qualification race.\n\nBrief Scores: Lucknow Super Giants 165/4 in 20 overs (Ayush Badoni 55*, Nicholas Pooran 48*; Bhuvneshwar Kumar 2-12) lost to Sunrisers Hyderabad 167 for no loss in 9.4 overs (Travis Head 89*, Abhishek Sharma 75*) by 10 wickets", {"uri": "2024-05-349401128", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:47:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:47:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:21:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6745098233222961, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/srh-vs-lsg-highlights-ipl-2024-3-moments-generated-buzz-among-fans-match-57", "title": "SRH vs LSG highlights, IPL 2024: 3 moments that generated buzz among fans in Match 57", "body": "The SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) decimated the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 10 wickets in Match 57 of IPL 2024 on Wednesday, May 8. The Rajiv Gandhi Stadium in Hyderabad was a witness to his exhilarating contest.\n\nThe KL Rahul-led side opted to bat first, which didn't augur well for them. Bhuvneshwar Kumar got rid of Quinton de Kock (2) and KL Rahul (3) early. Although KL Rahul (29) and Krunal Pandya (24) started on a fine note, they couldn't convert their starts.\n\nNevertheless, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) were impactful with their knocks to steer LSG to a modest total of 165.\n\nIn response, SRH openers, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma blew away the visitors, continuing their blistering form to dominate every bowler. The ground seemed to be too small for both southpaws, as they finished the chase in less than 10 overs. It is now the most runs scored by an IPL team in the first 10 overs of an innings.\n\nOn that note, let's take a look at the three best moments from the SRH-LSG game:\n\n#1 Bhuvneshwar Kumar's double-strike cripple LSG\n\nHaving garnered only 13 runs in the first two overs, Lucknow Super Giants opener, Quinton de Kock tried to up the ante in the third over. However, De Kock could only send Bhuvneshwar Kumar's half-tracker to the throat of the square leg area.\n\nIn his next over, Bhuvneshwar pitched a short ball to Marcus Stoinis, but the Australian all-rounder failed to make a good connection. Sanvir Singh plucked a stunning catch to send Stoinis back into the dugout. With this double-wicket strike, LSG were reduced to 21/2 in the fifth over.\n\nWith these wickets, KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya played it safe and could only finish on 57 runs in 10 overs.\n\n#2 Nicholas Pooran-Ayush Badoni stage a fightback\n\nAfter the LSG top-order couldn't be potent enough with their performances, they needed a crucial partnership to steer them to a defendable total. The duo of Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran just did that, as they assessed the conditions well and found odd boundaries to keep the team in good stead.\n\nThe duo stitched together an unbeaten 99-run stand, with 65 coming in the last five overs. In the last over bowled by Pat Cummins, Badoni hit a single four, while Pooran slammed three boundaries to provide a perfect flourish to the LSG side.\n\n#3 Unstoppable Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma make a mockery of the opposition\n\nThe most explosive opening pair in IPL 2024, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma proved their mettle once again, as they provided a tantalizing start to the home team.\n\nIt was the second over of the innings, where it all started, as Sharma hit four boundaries and got the ball rolling for the SRH side. The following over witnessed Travis Head smacked three sixes and a four to make his intentions clear.\n\nThe fifth over of the innings bowled by Naveen-ul-Haq proved to be an expensive affair, as Head took 23 runs from it while completing the half-century off 16 balls. Meanwhile, Sharma continued his onslaught to reach his fifty off 19 balls.\n\nTaking advantage of the hapless bowling unit, Head (89* off 30) and Sharma (75* off 28) sealed the chase in just 9.4 overs. {"uri": "8118272682", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "01:09:21", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T01:09:21Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T01:08:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6705882549285889, "url": "https://www.news18.com/cricket/lsg-owner-sanjiv-goenkas-scathing-showdown-kl-rahul-left-helpless-after-10-wicket-drubbing-to-srh-8883283.html", "title": "LSG Owner Sanjiv Goenka's Scathing Showdown: KL Rahul Left 'Helpless' After 10-wicket Drubbing to SRH - News18", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka looked animated as he spoke to KL Rahul, who stood helpless after losing to Sunrisers Hyderabad by 10 wickets.\n\nAfter Lucknow Super Giants' bowling was shredded to pieces by Sunrisers Hyderabad's Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka was seen speaking animatedly to his Indian Premier League (IPL) side's skipper KL Rahul and head coach Justin Langer. SRH's opening duo made a mockery of LSG's total of 165/4, chasing down the target in under 10 overs.\n\nIPL 2024: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants - HIGHLIGHTS\n\nAnd Goenka in his animated chat with Rahul looked in an irate mood, as the Indian international stood helpless. As the video surfaced online, social media was abuzz with some saying it was wrong on Goenka's part to have such a conversation after the loss at the ground, when the cameras were on them. The commentators also hinted at the same, saying these conversations should happen close doors. All in all, the video does not make for a good viewing, and the social media users were quick to point out that what Goenka did was not the right thing.\n\nAfter the loss, KL Rahul said they LSG completely outplayed by the incredible power-hitting of SRH's openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, terming it \"unreal batting.\"\n\nHead and Sharma added another chapter to their remorseless domination over bowlers while carving lightning fast unbeaten fifties to power SRH to a convincing 10-wicket win over LSG in a crucial IPL match.\n\nChasing a modest 166, Head (89 not out, 30 balls, 8x4s, 8x6s) and Sharma (75 not out, 28 balls, 8x4s, 6x6s) toyed with LSG bowlers, finding boundaries and sixes at will to canter home in just 9.4 overs.\n\n\"I am at lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills.\n\n\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. It was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" he said.\n\nALSO READ | Am Lost for Words! {"uri": "8117496693", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "13:49:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T13:49:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T13:49:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6666666865348816, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/srh-vs-lsg-revealed-who-are-the-impact-players-nominated-by-srh-and-lsg-for-match-57-of-ipl-2024/", "title": "SRH vs LSG: Revealed - Who are the impact players nominated by SRH and LSG for match 57 of IPL 2024", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) are hosting Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in the 57th game of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024. The match, which will be crucial in the context of the playoffs qualification, is being played at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday (8th May).\n\nThis will be the first time that Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) will be squaring off with Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in IPL 2024. The two teams had played each other just three times in the history of the league and going into the game, the KL Rahul-led side will be high on confidence because they have won all previous three games against Orange Army.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG have played magnificent brands of cricket and both are very much in contention for the playoffs. The Hyderabad-based franchise has revolutionised the batting in the league while Lucknow has been consistent as always in the league.\n\nCurrently, SRH is at No.4 on the points table with 6 wins and 5 defeats from the 11 games. They have 12 points under their belt. On the other hand, LSG is 6th on the points table with the same number of wins and defeats in 11 games. But what separates them is their NRR.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG will be entering the game on the back of defeats. While the Pat Cummins-led side suffered a thrashing 7-wicket loss against Mumbai Indians at Wankhede Stadium, the KL Rahul-led side were hammered by 98 runs by Kolkata Knight Riders at their home ground.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG will be desperate for the win in the match. A win there for both teams will strengthen their position in the points table. However, a loss might hamper their chances, especially with the kind of competition that has been there in the league.\n\nLucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul won the toss and opted to bat first in the game against SRH. The skipper admitted that it's an important game for both teams and claimed that they will be focused on one thing at a time. Speaking at the toss, he stated:\n\n\"We will bat first. That plus a couple of games that have been played here. It is hard to complete forget how important this game for both the sides, but we have played enough cricket. We will focus one thing at a time, bat first and put up the runs on the board. Playing at home becomes a difference, but we play so much cricket that we know how the conditions will be. Quinton comes in, Mohsin misses out and there are a few other changes.\"\n\nPat Cummins on the other hand also expressed his desire to bat first in the game against LSG. He also spoke about the importance of the game and stated:\n\n\"Thank You (for the birthday wishes). My body feels 31. We would have batted as well. But we have won both ways here and hence not too upset. Hard to know (a good score) as it has been pretty high scoring. It is pretty tough (to qualify for the playoffs) and you have to keep winning till the end, we have not nailed it in the last couple of games and it is time to change that. We have a couple of changes - Sanvir comes in for Agarwal and Viyaskanth makes his debut and replaces Marco.\"\n\nSRH: Glenn Phillips, Umran Malik, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Agarwal, Washington {"uri": "8117832988", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:39:11", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:39:11Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:38:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6627451181411743, "url": "https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/story/ipl-2024-srh-vs-lsg-kl-rahul-reaction-unreal-batting-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-2536853-2024-05-08", "title": "'Unreal': KL Rahul lost for words after Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma annihilate LSG", "body": "LSG's playoffs hopes took a massive hit after their 10-wicket defeat\n\nLucknow captain KL Rahul echoed the sentiments of millions of cricket fans who watched SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma make a mockery of a 166-run target in their IPL 2024 match on Wednesday. Rahul, who was watching the beyond-believable show of big-hitting from behind the stumps, said he was lost of words as SRH scripted a new T20 record for chasing the most number of runs in the first 10 overs of a match. SunRisers, thanks to Head's 30-ball 89 and Abhishek's 28-ball 75, chased down the target in just 58 deliveries.\n\nSRH vs LSG: Highlights\n\n\"I am lost for words. We have watched that batting on TV, but that was unreal,\" KL Rahul said after finishing on the losing side. SRH moved to the 3rd spot in the IPL 2024 points table with a huge boost in Net Run Rate after their record-breaking chase against LSG at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium.\n\n\"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skill, they (Head and Abhishek) have worked very hard on their six-hitting. They didn't give a chance to see what the wicket was playing like, it didn't change much, but that mindset and freedom to tee off from ball one... the only way to stop them was wickets in the powerplay and we didn't do that,\" Rahul said.\n\nTravis Head and Abhishek Sharma hit 14 sixes and 16 boundaries as they helped SRH script a new IPL record for the fastest successful chase -- winning with 62 balls to spare.\n\nSunRisers posted 107 for 0 in the first 6 overs while LSG had managed just 27 for 2 after a criminally slow approach from KL Rahul. The difference of 80 between the two teams in the powerplay is the highest in IPL history.\n\nIPL 2024 Full Coverage | IPL 2024 Points Table and Standings | 2024 IPL Full Schedule\n\nBarring the first over in which Head and Abhishek assessed the conditions, none of the other 8 overs went for less than 15 runs as there was no hiding place for the LSG bowlers. Krishnappa Gowtham, who gave 29 runs in 2 overs, was the most economical LSG bowler on Wednesday.\n\nSunRisers, who have 14 points in 12 matches, are well-placed now to reach the playoffs. On the other hand, LSG's Net Run Rate took a huge hit after their 10-wicket loss.\n\nKL Rahul's men need to win their last two matches and hope other results go their way if they are to qualify for the playoffs. This win took Sunrisers to the third spot in the points table, thus boosting their chances for the IPL 2024 playoffs. Even cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar was amazed by their performance in the SRH vs LSG game.\n\n'A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300!' wrote Sachin Tendulkar on Twitter.\n\nHead reached his fifty in just 16 balls, while Abhishek hit his half-century in 19 balls, leading Sunrisers Hyderabad to a dominant win, and handing Lucknow one of the biggest defeats in IPL history. Head remained unbeaten with 89 runs off 30 balls, while Abhishek contributed 75 runs off 28 balls. Together, they pummeled the LSG bowlers with a combined 13 sixes and 16 fours, demonstrating their powerful hitting ability.\n\nBy scoring 167 runs in just 9.4 overs, SRH set a new record for the highest total in the first 10 overs of an IPL match. Additionally, their victory with 62 balls to spare is a new IPL record for the most deliveries left while chasing a target of 100 or more.\n\nEarlier in the match, Lucknow posted 165/4, thanks to a solid partnership between Pooran and Badoni. Despite their efforts, the incredible batting display by Head and Abhishek overshadowed their performance. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs.\n\nThe 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket. {"uri": "8118260846", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "00:52:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T00:52:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T00:51:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6549019813537598, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/lsg-owner-sanjeev-goenka-expresses-anger-at-kl-rahul-publicly-after-srhs-10-wicket-mauling-visuals-send-shockwaves-101715193192690.html", "title": "LSG owner Sanjeev Goenka expresses anger at KL Rahul publicly after SRH's 10-wicket mauling, visuals send shockwaves", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants suffered a crushing defeat against Pat Cummins and Co. on Wednesday, which put them in a tricky spot in the playoffs race. It was a dismal performance from LSG bowlers and their top-order in batting as Sunrisers Hyderabad crushed them at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad.\n\nLSG skipper KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first, but the decision backfired for them as they lost Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis early in the powerplay, which put pressure on Rahul, and he went into his shell once again. The LSG captain failed to rise under the pressure and scored 29 runs off 33 balls. He looked sluggish throughout the innings as LSG scored just one boundary in the powerplay and hit 27 runs. Meanwhile, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) helped them post a fighting total of 165/4 on the scoreboard.\n\nHowever, SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma made a mockery of it and chased it down in just 9.4 overs. Head smashed 89*, and fellow left-hander Abhishek, who hit 75*, tore into the opposition attack to romp home with 10.2 overs to spare at their home in Uppal.\n\nAfter the match, LSG owner Sanjeev Goenka was seen having an animated chat with skipper Rahul on the ground. It didn't look a pleasant sight as Goenka looked miffed with the team's performances, and many suggested he should have waited to get to the dressing room or a meeting room to have that conversation instead of doing it in a public place.\n\nHead and Abhishek showed no mercy and smashed the LSG bowlers all around the park to chase down the 166-run target in just 9.4 overs to script several records as LSG players had an embarrassing night.\n\n\"I'm lost for words. We've watched that batting on TV but that was unreal,\" Lucknow skipper KL Rahul said of the bludgeoning by the Hyderabad openers.\n\n\"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting.\"\n\nHowever, it will be crucial for LSG to get over the humiliating defeat quickly as they are still in the playoffs race and have to win their remaining two matches to make a case for themselves.", "source": {"uri": "hindustantimes.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Hindustan Times"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucknow_Super_Giants", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Lucknow Super Giants"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_(cricket)", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Captain (cricket)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Powerplay_(cricket)", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Powerplay (cricket)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunrisers_Hyderabad", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Sunrisers Hyderabad"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pat_Cummins", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Pat Cummins"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcus_Stoinis", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Marcus Stoinis"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travis_Head", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Travis Head"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K._L._Rahul", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "K. SRH are in third place. read more\n\nMumbai Indians were on Wednesday knocked out of the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL) after Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) thumped Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 10 wickets in Hyderabad. MI, who currently have eight points from 12 games and are in ninth place, can only get to 12 points if they win their last two matches. That won't be enough as the win on Wednesday took SRH's points tally to 14 from 12 matches. SRH are in third place.\n\nMumbai Indians had appointed Hardik Pandya as skipper ahead of IPL 2024. He had replaced Rohit Sharma, who had led MI to five IPL titles. MI, however, endured a forgettable start to their campaign, losing their first three matches before clinching wins against Delhi Capitals (DC) and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). However, the Mark Boucher-coached side continued to be inconsistent, losing four matches in a row that hurt their chances big time.\n\nOn Monday, however, MI had revived their slim hopes with a seven-wicket win over SRH, courtesy an unbeaten century from Suryakumar Yadav as they chased 174.\n\nMI next take on Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Saturday before rounding off their campaign against Lucknow Super Giants at home on 17 May.\n\nGujarat Titans are in 10th place with eight games as well, albeit having played a game less than MI.\n\nComing to the SRH vs LSG game, the Pat Cummins-led side were set a target of 166. Openers Abhishek Sharma (75*) and Travis Head (89*) employed their merciless batting approach yet again as SRH chased down the total in only 9.4 overs.\n\nEarlier, LSG had won the toss and opted to bat. It was a rather slow start from Lucknow Super Giants as they were restricted to 27/2 in the powerplay. Bhuvneshwar Kumar had removed Quinton de Kock in the third over and he struck once again a couple of overs later to see off Marcus Stoinis, who was caught by Sanvir Singh at mid-on.\n\nKL Rahul then attempted to revive the visitors and all he could do was forging a 36-run stand with Krunal Pandya before being dismissed for 29 by Pat Cummins in the 10th over.\n\nLSG seemed to be in trouble at 66/4 in the 12th over when Pandya was run-out by Cummins at the non-striker's end, but what followed was a valiant fightback from Nicholas Pooran (48*) and Ayush Badoni (55*) who forged a 99-run stand for the fifth wicket. LSG were restricted to 165/4 from 20 overs.\n\nFor Head and Abhishek, it was all about aggression from the word go. SRH reached 107/0 in the powerplay phase, which was the second-highest powerplay score of this season after their score of 125/0 against Delhi Capitals earlier this season. {"uri": "2024-05-349745025", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:29:38", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:29:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T03:43:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6549019813537598, "url": "https://weeklyvoice.com/ipl-2024-kl-rahul-lost-for-words-after-watching-head-sharma-batting-carnage/", "title": "IPL 2024: KL Rahul 'lost for words' after watching Head-Sharma batting carnage", "body": "Hyderabad, May 9 (VOICE) Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) skipper was in awe after watching unreal batting from Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma as the duo chased down the target of 166 in just 9.4 overs at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday.\n\nHead 89 off 30 and Abhishek Sharma 75 off 28 joined hands together yet again as SRH thrashed Lucknow by 10 wickets in an epic run chase which didn't last even an hour. In the process, SRH scripted a new T20 record for chasing the most number of runs in the first 10 overs of a match.\n\n\"I am lost for words. We have watched that batting on TV, but that was unreal,\" KL Rahul said after the match. \"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skill, they (Head and Abhishek) have worked very hard on their six-hitting. They didn't give a chance to see what the wicket was playing like, it didn't change much, but that mindset and freedom to tee off from ball one... the only way to stop them was wickets in the powerplay and we didn't do that,\" Rahul added.\n\nHead smashed a half-century in just 16 balls after an astonishing display of batting. One of his incredible shots was a back-foot off-drive against Ravi Bishnoi for a huge maximum over long-off. Then there was a swat down the wicket straight of mid-off to Naveen-ul-Haq. On the other hand, Sharma reached his fifty in 19 balls with a straight six off Ayush Badoni.\n\nThe stunning win boosted SRH's Net Run Rate (NRR) from -0.065 to 0.41 with an early finish. {"uri": "8118362564", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "02:56:43", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T02:56:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T02:56:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/abhishek-sharma-an-exciting-talent-for-indian-cricket-explosive-sunrisers-batter-travis-head20240509082558/", "title": "Abhishek Sharma an exciting talent for Indian cricket: Explosive Sunrisers batter Travis Head", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 9 (ANI): After partnering with uncapped southpaw Abhishek Sharma to flatten the Lucknow bowling attack on the way to a lopsided win at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, explosive Sunrisers Hyderabad batter Travis Head was all praise for his opening partner, saying that the 23-year-old batter an \"exciting talent for Indian cricket\".\n\nHead and Abhishek smashed the LSG bowlers to a pulp, coasting to a facile 10-wicket win and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in the City of the Nizams on Wednesday.\n\nAt the post-match press conference, Head opened up about his record-breaking partnership with Abhishek, who struck a whirlwind 75 off just 28 balls.\n\nHead lauded his opening partner with whom he stitched their third 100-plus opening stand of the season.\n\n\"Abhishek Sharma is an exciting talent for Indian cricket, kind of exceptional. We kind of complement each other. He is very very enjoyable to be around. He is very very excited and thinks about the game,\" Head said at a post-match press conference.\n\nThe powerplay, a phase of the match the Sunrisers have dominated in the tournament so far, set the stage for this victory. They scored an incredible 107 runs during the powerplay overs, practically snuffing out any hopes of a comeback that Lucknow may have entertained and took their team to within a touching distance of the target in under 10 overs.\n\nThe persistent and ferocious assault by the SRH openers was simply too much for the LSG bowlers to handle.\n\nAfter posting a reasonable and fighting target of 167 on the board, the Sunrisers, riding on the exploits of the opening duo, cantered home in just 9.4 overs. The fireworks by the willow-wielders yet again reaffirmed the team's formidable batting lineup, which is arguably among the most feared this ongoing IPL season.\n\n\"Yeah, very happy with how we operate in power play and also glad to see how we scored runs outside of power play today. At time out we spoke about NRR (Net Run Rate) being important. Very pleased that checked out,\" he added.\n\nLSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got off to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nIn the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. SRH have now lost five games in IPL 2024 are sitting in the fourth spot in the points table.\n\nThe Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 edition will see Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) taking on Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in match 57. SRH will be there on their home ground after facing defeat in their last game against the Mumbai Indians (MI). SRH while batting first didn't show much of their batting dominance as MI bowlers came up with a show and restricted SRH to a total of 173 runs at the loss of eight wickets. Pat Cummins Shares Story of 'How He Lost The Top of His Middle Finger' With Hardik Pandya, Suryakumar Yadav After MI vs SRH IPL 2024 Mach (Watch Video).\n\nSRH's bowling attack did well in the start but MI's Suryakumar Yadav was too hot to handle for them, this helped MI defeat SRH by seven wickets. SRH have now lost five games in IPL 2024 are sitting in the fourth spot in the points table. LSG on the other hand got dominated and lost their last match against the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).\n\nBoth the batting and bowling lineups of LSG got decimated by KKR. LSG has also lost five matches in the IPL 2024 season and will look for a desperate win over the Sunrisers. LSG players are not looking in form to take a win over SRH but will be looking forward to giving their all to set a place for themselves in the final four. Visuals of Sanjiv Goenka and KL Rahul chatting along the boundary rope at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, minutes after LSG's 10-wicket defeat, went viral on social media.\n\nSRH vs LSG: Highlights | Scorecard\n\nThe disappointment in the Lucknow camp was evident as owner Sanjiv Goenka, captain KL Rahul and the rest of his teammates looked gutted following the loss, which hampered the team's chances of reaching the IPL 2024 playoffs. LSG had headed to Hyderabad with high hopes of extending their perfect record against former champions SunRisers. However, SRH were on top of their game, limiting LSG to 165 and then chasing down the total in just 9.4 overs to set a new T20 record.\n\nLSG slipped to the sixth spot in the points table and their Net Run Rate took a huge hit after the one-sided game in Hyderabad. Lucknow have 12 points in as many games, 2 fewer than third-placed SunRisers.\n\nKL Rahul paid the price for being timid on the field. While he won the toss and opted to bat, lack of intent in the powerplay cost the visiting team. LSG managed just 27 runs and lost 2 wickets at the end of the powerplay while SunRisers, thanks to Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head's ruthless knocks, reached 107 at the end of their powerplay. The 80-run difference between the two teams' totals in the powerplayis also the highest in IPL history.\n\nIPL 2024 Full Coverage | IPL 2024 Points Table and Standings | 2024 IPL Full Schedule\n\nKL Rahul was criticised by a section of fans and pundits. The LSG captain played an uncharacteristically slow knock -- 29 off 33 balls. Thanks to Ayush Badoni's fifty and Nicholas Pooran's 4quick-fire 48, LSG were able to post 165 and give their bowlers something to work with.\n\nHowever, SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma were in the mood to hit some big ones. Head hit 8 sixes and as many boundaries for his 30-ball 89 while young Abhishek smashed 6 sixes and 8 boundaries for his 28-ball 75. The duo added 167 runs for the opening partnership and steered SRH past the finish line in record time.\n\nKL Rahul echoed the emotions of millions of cricket fans who watched SunRisers make a mockery of the 166-run target, acknowledging the incredible big-hitting show from Head and Sharma.\n\n\"I am lost for words,\" he said while talking to the broadcasters after the one-sided contest.\n\n\"We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings,\" he added.\n\nLSG will look to bounce back and return to winning ways when they take on Delhi at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on May 14. They will end the league stages with a trip to Mumbai on May 17. This feat was accomplished during the electrifying match between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Hyderabad. The historic 1000th six was struck by LSG's Krunal Pandya off Jaydev Unadkat's delivery in the eighth over of the encounter.\n\nThis season's IPL has been characterised by explosive batting displays, with teams consistently posting scores exceeding 200 and even breaching the 250-run mark. Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (47*) combined for 99 runs off 52 balls to make this possible. The LSG top-order did not get started at all. They were 57/3 when KL Rahul (29 off 33 balls) holed out in fine leg off Pat Cummins' bowling with the penultimate delivery of the tenth over.\n\nAround that time, Hayden \"called out\" the lack of intent among LSG batters.\n\n\"I have to call them out. This is not a 5 runs per over wicket. Somebody needed to show intent. They had one of the slowest powerplays. That took the innings nowhere. When the opposition team has Travis Head, Heinrich Klaasen, your intention should be to go at 10s and over. 160-170 will never be enough,\" Hayden said on commentary.\n\nThe way LSG batted, many believed the pitch was extremely slow and it was difficult to bat on. IPL 2024, SRH vs LSG: Head-Abhishek's unbeaten opening stand helps Hyderabad win by 10 wickets\n\nHaving needed to chase a target of 166 runs in the IPL 2024 match against Lucknow Super Giants, Sunrisers Hyderabad opening batsmen Tarvis Head and Abhishek Sharma created havoc at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. The opening duo single-handedly pulled the match for Hyderabad.\n\nADVERTISEMENT\n\nBatting first in the IPL 2024 match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni were the standout performers for Lucknow Super Giants. Facing 30 balls, Badoni scored an unbeaten 55 runs including 9 fours. Pooran on the other hand, smashed unbeaten 48 runs off 26 balls. His knock was laced with 6 fours and 1 six.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad lead pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar claimed two wickets by conceding just 12 runs in his four overs. Skipper Pat Cummins leaked 47 runs and registered one wicket in his four-over spell. T. In a completely one-sided encounter, SRH held LSG to 165-4 after being asked to bowl first. Travis Head (89* off 30) and Abhishek Sharma (75* off 28) then featured in a sensational stand of 167* as Hyderabad gunned down the total in 9.4 overs.\n\nThe first over of SRH's chase bowled by Krishnappa Gowtham went for eight runs, but what followed was absolute carnage. Abhishek took on Yash Thakur in the second over and clubbed four fours. Head then went after Gowtham and clobbered three sixes and a four.\n\nThe four and sixes just kept flowing as Head raced to 50 in 16 balls. He got there in the fifth over bowled by Naveen-ul-Haq, which cost Lucknow Super Giants 23 runs. Head ended up striking eight fours and eight sixes, while Abhishek clubbed eight fours and six maximums.\n\nFittingly, the winning runs came via a six as Abhishek launched a slot ball from Thakur over extra cover.\n\n(Click here to download the Cric Rocket app and get the latest scores and live updates on IPL 2024)\n\nBadoni, Pooran lift LSG to 165-4\n\nBatting first after winning the toss, LSG recovered from 66-4 to post 165-4 courtesy of an unbroken fifth wicket stand of 99 between Ayush Badoni (55* off 30) and Nicholas Pooran (48* off 26).\n\nQuinton de Kock (2) fell to Bhuvneshwar Kumar attempting the pull. He was caught at deep backward square leg by Nitish Kumar Reddy, who pulled off a brilliant rebound catch near the ropes. Marcus Stoinis (3) fell to another stunning piece of work in the field. He miscued a pull off Bhuvneshwar and Sanvir Singh took a well-judged catch, diving forward at mid-on.\n\nKrunal Pandya launched Jaydev Unadkat for consecutive sixes in the eighth over, the second of which was the 1000th six in IPL 2024. LSG, however, suffered a major setback as skipper KL Rahul (29 off 33) was dismissed at exactly the halfway stage of the innings. He clipped a good length ball from Pat Cummins to deep backward square leg.\n\nKrunal (24 off 21), who was looking good out in the middle, was run out by a brilliant direct hit from Cummins, attempting at risky single. At 66-4 in the 12th over, Lucknow were in deep trouble. However, Badoni and Pooran featured in a brilliant rearguard stand. Badoni struck nine fours in his knock, while Pooran hit six fours and a six.\n\nThe duo combined to hammer T Natarajan for 15 runs in the 19th over and followed it up with 19 runs in the last over bowled by Cummins - Pooran striking three fours in the last four balls.\n\nSRH vs LSG: Who won Player of the Match in yesterday's IPL 2024 match?\n\nBhuvneshwar was outstanding with the ball for SRH, registering figures of 2-12 in his four overs. {"uri": "8118515550", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:28:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:28:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:28:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6470588445663452, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/dc-vs-lsg-after-sanjeev-goenka-episode-kl-rahul-slammed-on-air-for-this-reason/", "title": "DC vs LSG: After Sanjeev Goenka episode, KL Rahul slammed on air for this reason", "body": "Former Australian opener Matthew Hayden criticized the Lucknow Super Giants' batters for their lack of aggressive intent during a recent match against the SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH). Hayden stated that the Lucknow Super Giants' batters should have aimed for a high score while batting first.\n\nThe Super Giants scored 165/4 after winning the toss at the Rajiv Gandhi Stadium on Wednesday, May 8. Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (47*) added an unbeaten 99 runs off 52 balls for the fifth wicket. Sunrisers Hyderabad chased down the target with 10 wickets in hand in just 9.1 overs.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar made early breakthroughs by dismissing Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis inside the powerplay. The visiting team managed to score just 27 runs for the loss of two wickets in the first six overs. Skipper KL Rahul failed to accelerate as he was dismissed for 29 runs off 33 balls.\n\nDuring the match, Matthew Hayden, who was on commentary, criticized the Lucknow Super Giants' top order due to their sluggish run-scoring rate in the batting power play. Hayden emphasized the need for more aggressive intent, stating that their slow powerplay hindered the team's progress.\n\n\"I have to call them out. This is not a 5 runs per over wicket. Somebody needed to show intent. They had one of the slowest powerplays. That took the innings nowhere. When the opposition team has Travis Head, Heinrich Klaasen, your intention should be to go at 10s and over. 160-170 will never be enough,\" Hayden said in commentary.\n\nTravis Head and Abhishek Sharma added a 166-run stand in just 9.4 overs, setting a new record for the highest score by any team in 10 overs in IPL history. Head scored an unbeaten 89 off just 30 balls, including eight fours and six sixes. Abhishek scored 75* off 28 balls, featuring eight fours and six sixes.\n\nSRH moved to the third position in the standings with 14 points from 12 games. LSG is in the sixth spot with 12 points from an equal number of matches. The Pat Cummins-led team enhanced their playoff prospects, while LSG must win their remaining two matches to stay in contention for a playoff spot.\n\nIn a post-match interview, KL Rahul stated that he was at a loss for words after the opposition's batting performance. Rahul highlighted that the SRH openers showed an aggressive approach right from the start without giving a chance.\n\n\"I am lost for words. We have watched that batting on TV, but that was unreal. They didn't give a chance to see what the wicket was playing like, it didn't change much, but that mindset and freedom to tee off from ball one... the only way to stop them was wickets in the powerplay and we didn't do that,\" Rahul said.", "source": {"uri": "cricketaddictor.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "CricketAddictor"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8117811041", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:21:52", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:21:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:21:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6470588445663452, "url": "https://www.crictracker.com/cricket-news/ipl-2024-sunrisers-hyderabad-vs-lucknow-super-giants-57th-match-who-said-what/", "title": "SRH vs LSG: IPL 2024, Match 57 - Reactions and Quotes", "body": "The strike rate is overrated. Well, that's what KL Rahul said a couple of years back. He probably has changed his take on that after looking at Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma up close at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, in Hyderabad. The opening duo of Sunrisers Hyderabad defined modern-day T20 cricket and smashed the ball all across the park to pick up a massive victory over Lucknow Super Giants at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. The visitors had no clue with the bat and looked amateur with the ball, as SRH won the game by 10 wickets.\n\nBatting first, Lucknow lost two early wickets of Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis and following this, skipper KL Rahul played one of the slowest knocks in IPL history. Even though the pitch was a batter paradise, Rahul made 29 runs off 33 balls. Being a skipper, he should have led by example but the opener never looked comfortable and that put pressure on LSG.\n\nHowever, Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni took control of the situation and bailed LSG out of trouble. Badoni made 55* runs off 30 balls, while Pooran smashed 48* runs off 26 balls as LSG put 165 runs on the board in the first innings.\n\nEven though it never looked enough but SRH made it look ridiculously small. Head and Abhishek smashed 107 runs in the powerplay and even after that, they didn't stop and chased the total down in just 9.4 overs. Head hit 89* runs off 30 balls while Sharma smashed 75* runs off 28 deliveries as SRH picked up a massive win.\n\n1. KL Rahul - The Villain\n\nVillian may seem to be a harsh word but eventually, it turned out to be the bad guy. Being an opener, on that kind of pitch, Rahul should have played better cricket but the opener looked clueless. Having a strike rate of 87.88 is extremely poor and no team can afford that from their opener. Even in the second innings, when SRH were hitting boundaries for fun, he handed the ball to Ayush Badoni, which made little sense at that time. Overall, it was a tough day for KL Rahul.\n\n2. Pooran, Badoni rescued LSG\n\nPooran and Badoni's partnership of 99 runs rescued Lucknow. The other batters were extremely poor and just when it looked like LSG would not post a defendable total, Pooran and Badoni played some good cricket to put a respectable total on the board. Even though it wasn't enough in the end but it surely saved LSG from a humiliating defeat.\n\n3. Freak show of ridiculousness\n\nTravis Head and Abhishek Sharma changed T20 cricket. It is now safe to say that. The openers once again smacked boundaries for fun and broke many records in the process. They looked flawless which later KL Rahul appreciated as well and if the duo keeps up with the momentum, they can very well challenge for the title.\n\nAm lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on tv. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. Once you are on the losing side, there are questions marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well.\n\n(On did he change the pitch) Maybe Travis and Abhishek did. We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs. He's been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional. Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them. I think the scores have gone up, and when the wickets are good, it is tough to come up with answers against batters when they get going. {"uri": "8115746491", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "14:29:41", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T14:29:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T14:28:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6431372761726379, "url": "https://www.cricbuzz.com/live-cricket-scores/91641/srh-vs-lsg-57th-match-indian-premier-league-2024", "title": "Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants, 57th Match, May 08, Indian Premier League 2024", "body": "Preview:\n\nIt's that time of the season where every sub-plot in a game is scrutinized, because every result will have a significant impact not just on the teams involved in that game but also on the tournament in general. As we head into the final leg of IPL 2024, Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals are the only teams who look to be sitting with any degree of comfort. The other two spots are still up for grabs, with Chennai Super Kings, Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants among the frontrunners to claim them.\n\nWednesday's clash between SRH and LSG in Hyderabad is potentially a straight shootout as the winner shall gain a significant edge in the playoffs race, particularly with CSK boasting of a vastly superior net run rate at this point. All three teams have six wins and five losses apiece from their 11 games, and there isn't a lot to choose between the net run rates of SRH and LSG. All this points towards a potential high-voltage clash that could have a lot riding on it. Not surprisingly, both sides have endured a similar graph in terms of performances.\n\nSRH started the season with a bang, winning five of their first seven games and seemed to have gotten a head start to the playoffs race. Their refreshing high-intent approach with the bat blew teams away, leading to record-breaking totals and made them a side that nobody wanted to bowl at. However, the home side have just one win from their last four games, and that also was a very narrow one-run win against Rajasthan Royals at home. While Travis Head continues to motor along, the form of his opening partner Abhishek Sharma and middle-order enforcer Heinrich Klaasen appears to have dwindled.\n\nSRH were also forced to drop the out-of-form Aiden Markram for all-rounder Marco Jansen but that is another move which hasn't worked. The batting has tapered off a bit, particularly on relatively testing surfaces and Pat Cummins' men need to step it up before things go out of hand. While the batting has stagnated a bit, the bowling unit has certainly warmed up to the task led by Cummins himself with great support from Bhuvneshwar Kumar and T Natarajan. If SRH can rediscover their batting mojo, they could be hard to stop, especially at Hyderabad.\n\nLucknow Super Giants also began the season well, notching up three victories in their first four games but have struggled for consistency thereafter with alternate wins and losses. KL Rahul's side haven't had a winless drought as such but they have also suffered from lack of winning momentum which is crucial in the T20 format. The skipper himself hasn't really fired on a regular basis and while he is in the Orange Cap race once again, the opening batter hasn't had the impact that one would expect of him. Injuries have forced changes in LSG's bowling combinations as well with rookie speedgun Mayank Yadav lasting barely lasting three games.\n\nMohsin Khan also suffered an injury early on but has come back towards the latter half of the season. The problem for LSG has been the lack of sync in performances between the batting and bowling departments. When one part of their game has clicked, the other hasn't and their most recent clash against KKR saw them being blown away across all facets of the game. They do have a strong all-round side with all bases covered, so it should be about translating the squad potential into consistent on-field performances.\n\nIn such a high-stakes encounter, small margins may well decide the outcome of the game. There are several possible sub-plots in this fixture but how LSG's wily bowling fares against SRH's batting will be the main event.\n\nWhen: Wednesday, May 8 at 19:30 IST\n\nWhere: Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad\n\nWhat to expect: Surfaces at this venue have been extremely good for batting in recent times, starting from the ODI World Cup late last year to the ongoing IPL season. Average score batting first this season has been a shade above 212 with the 200-run mark breached thrice in the four games.\n\nHead to head: SRH 0-3 LSG. The visitors chased down 183 to win last year's fixture at this venue.\n\nTeam watch:\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad\n\nInjuries and availability: SRH don't have any concerns with respect to fitness and availability.\n\nTactics and matchups:\n\nPat Cummins has been outstanding in the middle overs this season. The SRH captain may have only picked six wickets during this phase (overs 7-15) but has an exceptional economy rate of 7.39 across 18 overs bowled - a tremendous stat considering the high-scoring season that this year has been. Cummins' role will be pivotal against LSG's enforcers in Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran and Deepak Hooda. SRH will be tempted to bring in Glenn Phillips who has been due to get a game for some time now. Marco Jansen will be the one to make way in such a scenario with Jaydev Unadkat expected to slot back in. There could also be a temptation to unleash the x-factor of Umran Malik.\n\nProbable XI: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Agarwal, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klaasen(wk), Glenn Phillips, Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Pat Cummins, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jaydev Unadkat/Umran Malik. The left-arm seamer has also been potent with the new ball with five wickets in the PowerPlay and an economy of just 8.14. So, LSG will hope he can tie down SRH's dynamic left-left opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma. Travis Head's exceptional performance earned him the well-deserved \"Player of the Match\" title.\n\nAlso Read: 'What the hell just happened': Cricket world shocked by SRH chase\n\nEven Zomato couldn't hold back from expressing their fear after Travis Head's incredible knock vs LSG\n\nZomato tweeted their worry over Travis Head's incredible performance, saying that if he keeps playing this well, they would see a drop in orders during the World Cup. Their hilarious acknowledgement of Head's extraordinary cricketing ability and its possible effect on their business can be seen in their tweet.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad defeated Lucknow Super Giants handily in the 57th match of the IPL 2024, which was held at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. The margin of victory was 10 wickets. The Lucknow Super Giants, who chose to bat first, suffered early setbacks in the powerplay. Lucknow Super Giants gained vital momentum after Ayush Badoni's outstanding innings of 55 not out from 30 deliveries, despite the early setback. Together with Badoni, Nicholas Pooran struck an outstanding 48 runs without giving up from only 26 deliveries, forming a strong combination that let the Super Giants reach a respectable total of 165 runs in just 52 deliveries. Bhuvneshwar Kumar led Sunrisers Hyderabad's bowling attack with stats of 2 wickets for 12 runs in his allotted four overs. His efforts were crucial in limiting Lucknow Super Giants to a meagre score.\n\nAlso Read: 'I'm not surprised': Walsh expected Rohit, Dravid to make this decision\n\nAs a reaction, Sunrisers Hyderabad launched an aggressive opening attack from the onset, with openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma making quick work of the opposition. Sunrisers Hyderabad led by a commanding lead at the midway point thanks to Head's scorching 89 not out from 30 balls and Sharma's explosive 75 not out from 28 balls. With a remarkable partnership of 167 runs from just 58 deliveries, the two greatly increased Sunrisers' net run rate. The bowling unit of the Lucknow Super Giants struggled to stop the assault, with every bowler giving up runs at an economy rate higher than 14.\n\nSeveral noteworthy statistics and milestones emerged from this gripping encounter. Lucknow Super Giants registered the third lowest score in the powerplay in IPL 2024 (27/2), while Travis Head equaled the record for the fastest fifty by an SRH player (16 balls). Sunrisers Hyderabad notched the second-highest runs in the powerplay in IPL history (107/0), and achieved the highest runs in the powerplay while chasing in IPL (107/0). The match witnessed the highest difference in Powerplay totals in IPL history (80 runs), and Travis Head recorded the joint most IPL fifties in less than 20 balls (3 times). Additionally, Sunrisers Hyderabad secured the biggest win in terms of balls to spare in IPL matches with 100+ targets (62 balls), and amassed the highest total in the first 10 overs in IPL history (167/0 in 9.4 overs).
