{"uri": "8115195840", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "09:00:07", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T09:00:07Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T08:58:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6313725709915161, "url": "https://sportzwiki.com/cricket/ipl-2024-srh-vs-lsg-playing-11-match-57/", "title": "IPL 2024: SRH vs LSG Playing 11- Match 57", "body": "The Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) are coming into the SRH vs LSG clash against the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Hyderabad on the back of their huge defeat against the Mumbai Indians. The same goes with the Super Giants, and a loss in this game for any of these teams will push them away from the playoff spot.\n\nThe Sunrisers lacked skill in the game against the Mumbai Indians. Since the fall of their second wicket, they fell like a pack of cards, losing their four wickets for just 28 runs in the middle order. The lower order looked a little weak, quite surprisingly at this stage of the tournament. The form of Marco Jansen is another concern for them here.\n\nBefore the SRH vs LSG encounter, Lucknow lost to Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), and that too by a 98-run margin damaged their net run rate quite heavily. Even in a 235-run chase, they started like a tortoise, and when wickets fell regularly, they lacked the sense of steadying the ship.\n\nThe Hyderabad side missed some firepower in the top order in the last IPL. Both Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma have offered them that, as well as Heinrich Klassen in the lower order. However, they would be little concerned about the form of their prime bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar.\n\nAlso Read: 'How Do You Fit Him In?'- Josh Hazlewood On Jake Fraser-McGurk T20 World Cup Omission\n\nHead and Sharma will continue to do the damage at the start of the innings. The former is fourth fourth-highest run-getter of the IPL 2024 with 444 runs at a strike rate of 189.74, while Abhishek has managed 326 runs at a strike rate of close to 200. Coming at number four or five, Heinrich Klassen too has shown his muscle for his 339 runs at a strike rate of 186.26.\n\nIn the bowling department, Thangarasu Natarajan has led the attack for his 15 wickets as the third highest-wicket taker of the season at an economy of just nine, especially bowling in the death overs coming into the SRH vs LSG clash. Pat Cummins too have offered them the gel of picking up wickets at the crucial juncture, with 13 scalps in 11 innings at an economy of 9.02. Bhuvneshwar Kumar, however, has struggled for his nine wickets so far in the tournament, at an economy of 9.73.\n\nMarco Jansen, in whatever little games he has played, looked to be losing his radar quite a bit, before the SRH vs LSG face-off. Wides and no ball have become his friends, which may push the team management to go with Fazalhaq Farooqi. The Afghanistan left-arm pacer has notched up six wickets in seven games of the IPL with an economy of 8.96.\n\nSRH's line-up vs LSG: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Agarwal, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klassen (wk.), Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Sanvir Singh/ / Washington Sundar, Pat Cummins (c), Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Marco Jansen/ Fazalhaq Farooqi (Impact Sub: T Natarajan)\n\nOne of the biggest struggles for the Lucknow team has been the off form of Quinton de Kock, who has managed 236 runs in this IPL in nine innings at a strike rate of 136.42 with three fifties. KL Rahul sits at number five in the most run-scoring list with 431 runs at a strike rate of 141.31.\n\nAlso Read: 'They Used MS Dhoni's Own Medicine Against Him'- Navjot Singh Sidhu On Master Stroke\n\nMarcus Stoinis has developed his numbers in the second half of the tournament. Naveen-ul-Haq has done a decent job for his 10 wickets at an economy of 8.53. {"uri": "8115348998", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "10:28:52", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T10:28:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T10:28:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6313725709915161, "url": "https://www.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/130359/srh-welcome-home-comforts-in-crucial-shootout-against-lsg", "title": "SRH welcome home comforts in crucial shootout against LSG", "body": "It's that time of the season where every sub-plot in a game is scrutinized, because every result will have a significant impact not just on the teams involved in that game but also on the tournament in general. As we head into the final leg of IPL 2024, Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals are the only teams who look to be sitting with any degree of comfort. The other two spots are still up for grabs, with Chennai Super Kings, Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants among the frontrunners to claim them.\n\nWednesday's clash between SRH and LSG in Hyderabad is potentially a straight shootout as the winner shall gain a significant edge in the playoffs race, particularly with CSK boasting of a vastly superior net run rate at this point. All three teams have six wins and five losses apiece from their 11 games, and there isn't a lot to choose between the net run rates of SRH and LSG. All this points towards a potential high-voltage clash that could have a lot riding on it. Not surprisingly, both sides have endured a similar graph in terms of performances.\n\nSRH started the season with a bang, winning five of their first seven games and seemed to have gotten a head start to the playoffs race. Their refreshing high-intent approach with the bat blew teams away, leading to record-breaking totals and made them a side that nobody wanted to bowl at. However, the home side have just one win from their last four games, and that also was a very narrow one-run win against Rajasthan Royals at home. While Travis Head continues to motor along, the form of his opening partner Abhishek Sharma and middle-order enforcer Heinrich Klaasen appears to have dwindled.\n\nSRH were also forced to drop the out-of-form Aiden Markram for all-rounder Marco Jansen but that is another move which hasn't worked. The batting has tapered off a bit, particularly on relatively testing surfaces and Pat Cummins' men need to step it up before things go out of hand. While the batting has stagnated a bit, the bowling unit has certainly warmed up to the task led by Cummins himself with great support from Bhuvneshwar Kumar and T Natarajan. If SRH can rediscover their batting mojo, they could be hard to stop, especially at Hyderabad.\n\nLucknow Super Giants also began the season well, notching up three victories in their first four games but have struggled for consistency thereafter with alternate wins and losses. KL Rahul's side haven't had a winless drought as such but they have also suffered from lack of winning momentum which is crucial in the T20 format. The skipper himself hasn't really fired on a regular basis and while he is in the Orange Cap race once again, the opening batter hasn't had the impact that one would expect of him. Injuries have forced changes in LSG's bowling combinations as well with rookie speedgun Mayank Yadav lasting barely lasting three games.\n\nMohsin Khan also suffered an injury early on but has come back towards the latter half of the season. The problem for LSG has been the lack of sync in performances between the batting and bowling departments. When one part of their game has clicked, the other hasn't and their most recent clash against KKR saw them being blown away across all facets of the game. They do have a strong all-round side with all bases covered, so it should be about translating the squad potential into consistent on-field performances.\n\nIn such a high-stakes encounter, small margins may well decide the outcome of the game. There are several possible sub-plots in this fixture but how LSG's wily bowling fares against SRH's batting will be the main event.\n\nWhen: Wednesday, May 8 at 19:30 IST\n\nWhere: Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad\n\nWhat to expect: Surfaces at this venue have been extremely good for batting in recent times, starting from the ODI World Cup late last year to the ongoing IPL season. Average score batting first this season has been a shade above 212 with the 200-run mark breached thrice in the four games.\n\nHead to head:SRH 0-3 LSG. The visitors chased down 183 to win last year's fixture at this venue.\n\nTeam watch:\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad\n\nInjuries and availability:SRH don't have any concerns with respect to fitness and availability.\n\nTactics and matchups:\n\nPat Cummins has been outstanding in the middle overs this season. The SRH captain may have only picked six wickets during this phase (overs 7-15) but has an exceptional economy rate of 7.39 across 18 overs bowled - a tremendous stat considering the high-scoring season that this year has been. Cummins' role will be pivotal against LSG's enforcers in Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran and Deepak Hooda. SRH will be tempted to bring in Glenn Phillips who has been due to get a game for some time now. Marco Jansen will be the one to make way in such a scenario with Jaydev Unadkat expected to slot back in. There could also be a temptation to unleash the x-factor of Umran Malik.\n\nProbable XI:Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Agarwal, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klaasen(wk), Glenn Phillips, Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Pat Cummins, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jaydev Unadkat/Umran Malik. [Impact sub: T Natarajan]\n\nLucknow Super Giants\n\nInjuries/Availability: Apart from Mayank Yadav who is unlikely to play a part in the season finale, LSG have no concerns with injuries.\n\nTactics and matchups:\n\nMohsin Khan has been devastating against left-hand batters with seven wickets from 54 deliveries at an economy of 8.14. The left-arm seamer has also been potent with the new ball with five wickets in the PowerPlay and an economy of just 8.14. So, LSG will hope he can tie down SRH's dynamic left-left opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma. LSG will ponder about bringing back Quinton de Kock into their line-up, which could see Ashton Turner sitting out.\n\nProbable XI:KL Rahul(c), Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran, Deepak Hooda, Ayush Badoni, Krunal Pandya, Ravi Bishnoi, Mohsin Khan, Naveen-ul-Haq, Yash Thakur. [Impact player - Arshin Kulkarni]\n\nDid you know?\n\n- Nitish Reddy has been an under-rated middle overs enforcer for SRH, striking at 164.4 during this phase (overs 7-15) with eight fours and 11 sixes.\n\n- Marcus Stoinis has demolished pace this season, averaging 105 against them at an impressive strike rate of 161.54 with 23 fours and eight sixes.\n\nWhat they said:\n\n\"It's pretty clear for us, if you want to get to the top four, you got to win all the games. That will give us a little bit of freedom to go out there and be a little bit more fearless, little bit brave to take on the game.\" - KL Rahul wants LSG to show more intent\n\n\"We like playing at home, we'll wait and see what's ahead of us. {"uri": "8118560033", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "06:07:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T06:07:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T06:07:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6313725709915161, "url": "https://www.crictracker.com/cricket-news/dont-think-we-could-have-ever-expected-chasing-it-like-that-travis-head-9229/", "title": "Don't think we could have ever expected chasing it like that: Travis Head", "body": "In an exciting contest at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma displayed batting dominance to decimate Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in just 9.4 overs. SRH openers took their side to 167/0, becoming the first team in IPL history to chase down a target with the most balls to spare, 62 to be precise.\n\nThe Lucknow-based franchise had posted a total of 165/4 after being put in to bat first, thanks to knocks from Ayush Badoni (55 off 30) and Nicholas Pooran (48 off 26). However, little did they know the storm coming their way in the chase.\n\nHead (89* off 30) and Abhishek (75* off 28) took the LSG bowling attack to the cleaners from the very first ball. They put up a 100-run opening stand under the powerplay itself. The onslaught left the LSG camp shell-shocked.\n\nAlso read: LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka seen bickering with KL Rahul post SRH drubbing\n\nHead, awarded the Player of the Match, admitted they couldn't have expected to chase it down so dominantly.\n\n\"I don't think we could have ever expected chasing it like that. It looked like a tough wicket in the first innings, it looked like it was holding and a slow pitch. I guess, knowing that as a batter, you know that the powerplay is important. Trying to maximize that and we played beautifully, we were able to get ahead of the rate, which is nice,\" Head said at the post-match press conference.\n\nThis was SRH's third-century opening stand of the season, making them the only team with multiple 100+ partnerships. Head was full of praise for his aggressive opening partner, Abhishek. \"Nice to get a go, nice to be performing, and the partnership with Abhi has been fantastic. He's such an exciting talent for Indian cricket, he's exceptional,\" he added.\n\nAfter last night's win, SRH inch closer in the playoffs race, and with 14 points find themselves at the third position, below Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals.\n\nThe difference between the two teams' powerplay scores was the defining factor, according to LSG consultant Adam Voges.\n\n\"I think we're all in awe of what we've just seen. Sometimes you have to tip your hat and say well played to the opposition. (They) might have mis-hit one or two balls in the nine and bit overs that we bowled at them. Incredible batting, incredible hitting, clearly we didn't have an answer for,\" said Voges as quoted by Cricbuzz.\n\nAlso read: Pat Cummins passes witty remark after SRH demolish LSG in 9.4 overs\n\n\"What do you say, 2 for 20 odd as opposed to 100 for none, and that's the game in itself. {"uri": "8117688767", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "15:54:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T15:54:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T15:53:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6274510025978088, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/ipl-2024-badoni-fifty-guides-lsg-to-modest-1654-against-srh20240508212029/", "title": "IPL 2024: Badoni fifty guides LSG to modest 165/4 against SRH", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 8 (ANI): A fine half-century from Ayush Badoni and his partnership with Nicholas Pooran helped Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) reach a modest total of 165/4 in their Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nLSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg.\n\nIn the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. At the end of six overs, LSG was 27/2, with KL (19*) and Krunal (2*) unbeaten.\n\nIn the seventh over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, Krunal relieved some pressure by smashing him for two sixes and getting his team a total of 15 runs out of it.\n\nBy drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs.\n\nLSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs.\n\nThe 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over.\n\nA boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten.\n\nLSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket. Of these, three (CSK, LSG and SRH) could get up to 18 points. However, only two can realistically make it to that 18-point mark.\n\nWhy, you may ask? Well, it is because LSG and SRH are on a collision course, and will clash on Wednesday, with only one of them getting up to 14, and retaining hopes of possibly ending the league campaign with 18 points.\n\nThis game, thus, already feels important. It will not be all doom and gloom for the team that loses, but given how much a shot in the arm this result and two points could be, neither would really want to lose this game. For the winner, the incentive and the reward is obvious - a step closer to the top four.\n\nSRH return home having been chastened away to Mumbai. Batting first, they could only muster 172 and then watched in disbelief as Suryakumar Yadav took the game away from them. As pitches have gotten tired, their batters have not hit the heights they did earlier in the season.\n\nThat particular downturn is embodied by Abhishek Sharma, who was so good in the first half but has huffed and puffed since. Travis Head, luckily for SRH, has been going strong, alongside the likes of Heinrich Klaasen and Nitish Kumar Reddy. SRH might also be tempted to include an extra overseas batter, especially at home. In that case, one of Aiden Markram or Glenn Phillips could get a look-in.\n\nBowling wise, they were brilliant for the first few overs against Mumbai. Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Pat Cummins got the ball to move. Once the movement disappeared, though, they were left scurrying for answers. A win has usually been followed by a defeat and vice versa. Now, though, they have to keep on winning.\n\nFor that, they will hope their captain KL Rahul fires at the top of the order. The stakes are high, and both teams know the pitfalls of another defeat. Both teams have 12 points in 11 matches and are in the race for the playoffs.\n\nHost SRH lost their last game against the Mumbai Indians (MI) by seven wickets. Batting first, SRH posted 173 runs, with Travis Head (48) scoring the most. Hyderabad got off to a good start as they picked up three wickets for 31 runs. However, after that, it was all about Suryakumar Yadav who scored a brilliant century.\n\nThe Indian batter remained unbeaten on 102 and guided MI to an easy victory. SRH will be hoping for better performances from their players when they face LSG and take two important points for a place in the playoffs.\n\nOn the other hand, LSG lost their last game to the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) by 98 runs. Chasing 236 runs, no batter got going for LSG, as their highest scorer was Marcus Stoinis with 36 runs.\n\nIf we look at the head-to-head record, both teams have faced each other three times, with LSG coming on top on all occasions. In these three matches, we have seen some good performances, and in this article, we will look at the top three knocks in SRH-LSG matches in the IPL.\n\nTop 3 knocks in SRH-LSG IPL matches\n\n#3 Nicholas Pooran went berserk to win it for LSG (44* off 13 balls)\n\nSRH won the toss and chose to bat first in the 58th match of the IPL 2023, held in Hyderabad. Thanks to decent innings from Heinrich Klassen (47) and Abdul Samad (37*), SRH posted 182 runs in 20 overs.\n\nIn reply, LSG lost Kyle Mayers early. Prerak Mankad and Marcus Stoinis then stitched together a good 73-run partnership before the latter got out on 40 runs. Nicholas Pooran came to bat when LSG needed 56 off 27 balls.\n\nThe West Indian batter hit three sixes on his first three balls. Pooran went on to score 44 runs off just 13 balls with the aid of three fours and four sixes. Meanwhile, Mankad remained unbeaten on 64 runs as the duo guided LSG to a win.\n\n#2 Prerak Mankad played a sensible knock to take LSG home (64* off 45 balls)\n\nIt was in the same match that Pooran went berserk. However, in the initial stages, it was Prerak Mankad who formed good partnerships with other batters. His knock was studded with seven fours and two sixes. {"uri": "8118453163", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:31:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:31:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T04:29:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6274510025978088, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2932742-abhishek-sharma-an-exciting-talent-for-indian-cricket-explosive-sunrisers-batter-travis-head", "title": "Abhishek Sharma an exciting talent for Indian cricket: Explosive Sunrisers batter Travis Head | Sports-Games", "body": "Head and Abhishek smashed the LSG bowlers to a pulp, coasting to a facile 10-wicket win and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in the City of the Nizams on Wednesday.\n\nAfter partnering with uncapped southpaw Abhishek Sharma to flatten the Lucknow bowling attack on the way to a lopsided win at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, explosive Sunrisers Hyderabad batter Travis Head was all praise for his opening partner, saying that the 23-year-old batter an \"exciting talent for Indian cricket\". Head and Abhishek smashed the LSG bowlers to a pulp, coasting to a facile 10-wicket win and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in the City of the Nizams on Wednesday.\n\nAt the post-match press conference, Head opened up about his record-breaking partnership with Abhishek, who struck a whirlwind 75 off just 28 balls. Head lauded his opening partner with whom he stitched their third 100-plus opening stand of the season.\n\n\"Abhishek Sharma is an exciting talent for Indian cricket, kind of exceptional. We kind of complement each other. He is very very enjoyable to be around. He is very very excited and thinks about the game,\" Head said at a post-match press conference. The powerplay, a phase of the match the Sunrisers have dominated in the tournament so far, set the stage for this victory. They scored an incredible 107 runs during the powerplay overs, practically snuffing out any hopes of a comeback that Lucknow may have entertained and took their team to within a touching distance of the target in under 10 overs.\n\nThe persistent and ferocious assault by the SRH openers was simply too much for the LSG bowlers to handle. After posting a reasonable and fighting target of 167 on the board, the Sunrisers, riding on the exploits of the opening duo, cantered home in just 9.4 overs. The fireworks by the willow-wielders yet again reaffirmed the team's formidable batting lineup, which is arguably among the most feared this ongoing IPL season.\n\n\"Yeah, very happy with how we operate in power play and also glad to see how we scored runs outside of power play today. At time out we spoke about NRR (Net Run Rate) being important. Very pleased that checked out,\" he added. LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got off to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six.\n\nIn the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG. In the run-chase of 166 runs, openers Travis Head (89* in 30 balls, with eight fours and eight sixes) and Abhishek Sharma (75* in 28 balls, with eight fours and six sixes) launched what seemed like a never-ending assault on LSG batters, helping SRH chase down the total in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket.\n\nSRH is at number three in the table with seven wins, five losses and 14 points. {"uri": "8118563918", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "06:10:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T06:10:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T06:09:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6274510025978088, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/dc-vs-lsg-sanjiv-goenka-gets-thumped-down-by-former-csk-legend-for-manhandling-kl-rahul/", "title": "DC vs LSG: Sanjiv Goenka gets thumped down by former CSK legend for manhandling KL Rahul", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) suffered a major blow to their quest for the IPL 2024 playoffs after their humiliating 10-wicket loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, May 8.\n\nOpting to bat first, the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) managed to post a modest total of 165/4 on the board against the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH). But then the LSG's bowling attack brutally failed, as the SRH's dangerous opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma hammered them cruelly.\n\nThe SRH duo wasted no time in their onslaught, with Head (89 runs off 30 balls) reaching his half-century in just 16 balls, and his opening partner Abhishek (75 runs off 28 balls) closely following him by achieving the same feat in just 19 deliveries to chase down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs.\n\nHowever, this embarrassing defeat was not enough for the Lucknow camp, as the post-match drama escalated at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium with cameras capturing LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka engaging in a heated exchange with captain KL Rahul after the match.\n\nHowever, it is still unknown what was being said between the two during the intense conversation, but the LSG owner, Goenka, looked too angry while talking to the skipper, Rahul. While Mr. Goenka was animated while expressing his emotions, Rahul maintained his composure and calmly heard him out while replying to some of the owner's suggestions.\n\nAs all this happened on Live TV, this unexpected controversy quickly garnered attention and criticism online, with many commentators slamming Goenka for expressing his anger at the skipper Rahul in front of the media and the whole world.\n\nSpeaking on the live controversy, one commentator opined on the Jio Cinema: \"You always feel these conversations should be happening behind closed doors. There are so many cameras around the stadium and they miss nothing. You know KL Rahul is now gonna go to press conferences and other things and potentially explain what's been discussed here.\"\n\nOn the other hand, former New Zealand cricketer and commentator Scott Styris hailed Rahul for his professionalism and his ability to handle the situation with maturity. Styris said: \"He has done well to keep his cool here. I think you are bang on.\"\n\nMeanwhile, Rahul said at the post-match press conference: \"I am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills (on Head and Abhishek). They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. LSG needs to defend 166 runs to get their seventh win of the tournament.\n\nAfter winning the toss, LSG opted to bat first. Pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar made them regret this decision by striking twice in the powerplay. First, in the third over, he removed an out-of-form Quinton de Kock for just two runs in five balls with Nitish Kumar Reddy taking a catch at deep backward square leg. In the fifth over, Sanvir took a fine diving catch near mid-on, removing the in-form Marcus Stoinis for just three and giving Bhuvneshwar his second wicket. LSG was 21/2 in 4.2 overs.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul and Krunal Pandya joined forces, getting their team through the remainder of the powerplay. At the end of six overs, LSG was 27/2, with KL (19*) and Krunal (2*) unbeaten. In the seventh over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, Krunal relieved some pressure by smashing him for two sixes and getting his team a total of 15 runs out of it.\n\nBy drilling Cummins for a four towards mid-off, KL brought LSG to the 50-run mark in 9.1 overs. However, at the end of the over, he was dismissed by the SRH captain for a sluggish 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. T Natrajan took the catch. LSG was 57/3 in 10 overs. LSG's situation became worse, with Cummins running out Krunal for 24 in 21 balls, with two sixes. LSG was 66/4 in 11.2 overs.\n\nThe 14th over bowled by Natrajan proved to be an expensive over for SRH, with Ayush Badoni hitting him for four boundaries and taking a total of 17 runs from the over. A boundary from Badoni helped Lucknow reach the 100-run mark in 15 overs. At that point, LSG was 102/4, with Badoni (23*) and Nicholas Pooran (18*) unbeaten.\n\nBadoni continued to pierce through the gaps, mainly targeting Natrajan. He brought up his fourth IPL fifty in 28 balls, with eight fours. At the end of 19 overs, LSG was 146/4, with Badoni (50*) and Pooran (34*) unbeaten. LSG ended their innings at 165/4 in their 20 overs, with Pooran-Badoni getting 19 runs in the final over. Badoni was unbeaten at 55 in 30 balls, with nine fours while Pooran scored 48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six. Both had a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the pick of the bowlers for SRH. Cummins (1/47) also got a wicket. Positioned fifth on the points table with six wins in 11 matches, LSG is determined to secure victory and climb above SRH in the standings. Currently, both teams are tied at 12 points, with SRH occupying the fourth spot.\n\nAt this pivotal juncture in the IPL 2024 season, every aspect of a match is under intense scrutiny, given the profound impact each result holds, not only for the participating teams but for the tournament as a whole. As we approach the final stretch, Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals seem to be in a relatively comfortable position, while the race for the remaining two playoff berths remains fiercely contested. Chennai Super Kings, Sunrisers Hyderabad, and Lucknow Super Giants are among the top contenders vying for these coveted spots.\n\nThe upcoming clash between SRH and LSG in Hyderabad on Wednesday looms as a crucial showdown, potentially offering the victor a decisive advantage in the playoff race, especially considering CSK's significantly superior net run rate. With all three teams having secured six wins and suffered five losses in their 11 games, and with minimal disparity in the net run rates of SRH and LSG, the stage is set for a high-stakes encounter. Unsurprisingly, both sides have experienced similar fluctuations in their performances throughout the season.\n\nSRH kicked off the season with an impressive display, securing victory in five of their initial seven matches, establishing themselves as frontrunners in the playoffs race. Their dynamic batting approach proved to be a force to be reckoned with, as they set new records with their aggressive intent, making them a formidable opponent for any team. However, their recent form tells a different story, with just one win in their last four games, narrowly clinching a victory against Rajasthan Royals at home by a mere run.\n\nWhile Travis Head continues to impress, the performances of his opening counterpart Abhishek Sharma and middle-order mainstay Heinrich Klaasen have faltered. The decision to replace the out-of-form Aiden Markram with all-rounder Marco Jansen has yet to yield the desired results, further adding to their batting woes. Particularly on challenging pitches, their batting prowess seems to have diminished, necessitating a resurgence before matters escalate. On the brighter side, the bowling department has shown promise, spearheaded by the leadership of Pat Cummins, ably supported by Bhuvneshwar Kumar and T Natarajan. If SRH can reignite their batting prowess, especially on their home ground in Hyderabad, they could pose a formidable challenge for their opponents.\n\nLucknow Super Giants also had a promising start to the season, securing three victories in their first four matches. However, they have struggled to maintain consistency since then, alternating between wins and losses. KL Rahul's team hasn't experienced a prolonged winless streak, but they have lacked the essential winning momentum crucial in T20 cricket. While Rahul himself is in contention for the Orange Cap once again, his performances haven't been as impactful as expected, particularly as an opening batsman.\n\nInjuries have disrupted LSG's bowling combinations, with rookie speedster Mayank Yadav lasting only three games before succumbing to injury. Although Mohsin Khan suffered an injury early on, he has made a comeback in the latter half of the season. The main challenge for LSG lies in synchronizing performances between their batting and bowling units. Often, when one aspect of their game excels, the other falters, as evidenced in their recent defeat against KKR where they struggled in all facets of the game. Despite possessing a well-rounded squad, LSG must translate their potential into consistent on-field performances.\n\nIn a match of such high stakes, the outcome may hinge on small margins. While there are various intriguing subplots, the pivotal battle between LSG's crafty bowling and SRH's batting lineup is likely to take center stage.\n\nThe Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad offers a batting paradise for teams. With a surface conducive to stroke play, runs flow freely, setting the stage for potentially high-scoring encounters. Given the favorable conditions, the team winning the toss is likely to choose to bat first, aiming to set a formidable total.\n\nConsistently, surfaces at this venue have favored batsmen, evident from the recent ODI World Cup late last year to the ongoing IPL season. The average score batting first this season has exceeded 212, with the 200-run milestone surpassed thrice in four games, highlighting the pitch's propensity for producing high-scoring contests.\n\nSRH has no concerns regarding fitness or availability, ensuring they can field their best possible lineup for the upcoming match.\n\nPat Cummins has showcased his prowess in the middle overs throughout this season, despite only securing six wickets in the crucial phase spanning overs 7-15. What's truly remarkable is his exceptional economy rate of 7.39 across 18 overs bowled, a standout statistic considering the high-scoring nature of this year's IPL. His role becomes even more pivotal as Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) gear up to face formidable enforcers in Lucknow Super Giants' (LSG) lineup, including Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran, and Deepak Hooda.\n\nIn light of their recent performances, SRH might be inclined to introduce Glenn Phillips into the playing XI, a move long overdue for the talented batsman. Should Phillips be given the nod, it's likely that Marco Jansen would make way, potentially making room for Jaydev Unadkat's return to the side. Additionally, there's a tantalizing prospect of unleashing the x-factor of Umran Malik, adding an extra dimension to SRH's bowling arsenal.\n\nExcept for Mayank Yadav, who is unlikely to participate in the season finale, Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) have no injury concerns heading into the crucial match.\n\nMohsin Khan has emerged as a formidable force against left-handed batters, claiming seven wickets from just 54 deliveries at an impressive economy rate of 8.14. Additionally, his effectiveness with the new ball is evident, having snared five wickets in the PowerPlay while maintaining an economy rate of just 8.14. Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) will rely on his prowess to contain Sunrisers Hyderabad's (SRH) dynamic left-left opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma.\n\nConsidering Khan's proficiency, LSG may contemplate reintroducing Quinton de Kock into their lineup. This strategic move could potentially see Ashton Turner being omitted from the playing XI as LSG seeks to bolster their batting prowess.\n\nIn the upcoming game against Lucknow Super Giants, all eyes will be on Sunrisers Hyderabad's Travis Head, who has emerged as a standout performer with the bat. Having amassed 444 runs in his last 10 matches, Head ranks among the highest run-scorers of the tournament. His stellar performance will be instrumental for Sunrisers Hyderabad against LSG, given his consistent contributions throughout the season. Notably, Head has already notched up three half-centuries and one century in this edition of the IPL, further highlighting his batting prowess and significance in the upcoming clash.\n\nIn the upcoming game against Sunrisers Hyderabad, all eyes will be on Lucknow Super Giants' Naveen-ul-Haq, who has been in stellar form with the ball. The Afghan pacer has been a key contributor for his side, claiming 10 wickets in his last seven matches. Known for picking crucial wickets at crucial moments, Naveen-ul-Haq's presence will be crucial for LSG's bowling attack against SRH. With a confidence-boosting performance in the previous game, where he picked up three wickets against Kolkata Knight Riders, Naveen-ul-Haq will be eager to replicate his success in the upcoming {"uri": "8117894458", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:29:58", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:29:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:29:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6196078658103943, "url": "https://www.khaleejtimes.com/sports/head-abhishek-blitzkrieg-helps-hyderabad-demolish-lucknow-by-ten-wickets", "title": "Head, Abhishek blitzkrieg helps Hyderabad demolish Lucknow by ten wickets", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad's Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head celebrate the big win over Lucknow Super Giants. - AFP\n\nOpeners Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smoked half-centuries as Sunrisers Hyderabad crushed Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets on Wednesday to boost their play-off hopes in the IPL.\n\nChasing a modest 166 for victory, Head, who smashed 89, and fellow left-hander Abhishek, who hit 75, tore into the opposition attack to romp home with 10.2 overs to spare at their home in Uppal.\n\n\"Lot of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs,\" said Head, the Player of the Match. \"Abhi and I have had a few partnerships like this.\n\n\"(The key as to) just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay.\n\n\"It is important to go 360 in the modern game. The last 12 months, that's how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that's what I've been told to do here as well,\" Head added.\n\n\"The crowd was exceptional tonight, that's what we needed after losing the last two. I haven't got many things over him, so that's good to know that I have more runs than David Warner did in his first SRH season.\"\n\nLucknow skipper KL Rahul said he was lost for words' after the clobbering his team got at the hands of an explosive Head and Abhishek.\n\n\"I'm lost for words. We've watched that batting on TV but that was unreal,\" said Rahul. \"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting.\"\n\nAustralia's Head attacked with a flurry of fours and sixes as he reached his fifty in 16 balls and went past 500 runs this season.\n\nHead is now third in the batting chart behind Virat Kohli (542) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (541) with his fourth half-century -- he also has a ton -- in this edition.\n\nAbhishek joined the charge as he got to his fifty in 19 balls after the pair took Hyderabad to 107 in the first six overs of powerplay, when only two fielders are allowed outside the inner circle.\n\nHyderabad, who won the IPL in 2016 under David Warner, registered their seventh win in 12 matches to hand a perfect gift to birthday boy and captain Pat Cummins, who turned 31 on Wednesday.\n\nAbhishek hit the winning six as Hyderabad moved to third in the 10-team table with 14 points. Lucknow stay sixth after the bruising loss.\n\nTop four teams will make the play-offs with the final on May 26 in Chennai.\n\nSeam bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar set up victory with impressive bowling figures of 2-12 in his four overs to restrict Lucknow to 165-4 after they elected to bat first.\n\nLucknow lost regular wickets until Nicholas Pooran, who hit 48, and Ayush Badoni, who smashed 55, put on an unbeaten stand of 99 in 52 balls to boost the team total.\n\nBut the score proved too little against a team which posted record totals of 277 and 287 in this high-scoring edition of the T20 {"uri": "2024-05-349387569", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:31:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:31:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:46:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6196078658103943, "url": "https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/ipl-2024-srh-vs-lsg-award-winners-man-of-the-match-presentation-ceremony-match-57-280879.html", "title": "IPL 2024: SRH vs LSG Award Winners, Man of The Match, Post-Match Presentation, Scorecard & Records", "body": "SRH vs LSG, IPL 2024 Match 57: Sunrisers Hyderabad did an unbelievable feat of chasing down a target of 167 runs by the 10th over as they defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets at the Uppal Stadium in Hyderabad.\n\nMyKhel brings to you the list of award winners, including the player of the match, best striker of the match among others as the likes of Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma and Bhuvneshwar Kumar shone in the one-sided affair.\n\nSRH vs LSG, IPL 2024 Match 57 Award Winners\n\nSRH vs LSG, IPL 2024 Match 57: Who Said What\n\nTravis Head | Man of the Match: \"Lot of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay.\n\n\"(On his spin hitting) It is something I have been working on, it will be a big part in the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game. (On fearless cricket) The last 12 months, that's how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that's what I've been told to do here as well. Nothing much that I have to change.\n\n\"(On Abhishek Sharma) I know how hard he works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out the last couple of game.\n\n\"(On NRR) We didn't think about it till the Timeout, but after that the boys came out and told us to score quickly. The crowd was exceptional tonight, that's what we needed after losing the last two.\n\n\"(On David Warner) I haven't got many things over him, so that's good to know that I have more runs than David Warner did in his first SRH season. We start again whenever we come out here for the next game.\"\n\nPat Cummins: \"(On did he change the pitch) Maybe Travis and Abhishek did. We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs.\n\n\"(On Travis Head) He's been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional. (On Abhishek Sharma) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them.\n\n\"(On where the game is headed) I think the scores have gone up, and when the wickets are good, it is tough to come up with answers against batters when they get going. The boys have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal.\"\n\nAbhishek Sharma: \"I would never think of coming to such a tournament and playing at such a strike rate, but thanks to the team management. The message was clear from them and I backed myself. All the credit goes to him (Head).\n\n\"The way he starts against all bowlers.. he goes after them from the start and takes the pressure off. The bowlers told us (during the innings break) that it was getting better, but myself and Travis thought it was not doing much. I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach.\"\n\nKL Rahul: \"I am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on tv. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills.\n\n\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. Once you are on the losing side, there are questions marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short.\n\n\"When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well.\"\n\nBowling: Bhuvneshwar Kumar 4-0-12-2, Pat Cummins 4-0-47- 1, Shahbaz Ahmed 2-0-9-0, Vijayakanth Viyaskanth 4-0-27-0, Jaydev {"uri": "2024-05-348522516", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "05:32:14", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T05:32:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T05:13:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6196078658103943, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/srh-vs-lsg-match-prediction-who-will-win-today-s-ipl-2024-match", "title": "SRH vs LSG Match Prediction: Who will win today's IPL 2024 match?", "body": "There isn't much to separate the SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) and the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) ahead of Match 57 of the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL). They come into the contest, to be played at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday, May 8, with similar recent form and aspirations.\n\nHyderabad have won only two of their last five matches, and that figure could've been even worse if not for Rovman Powell missing a full toss off the last ball from Bhuvneshwar Kumar. In their most recent game, they were comprehensively outdone by a Suryakumar Yadav masterclass despite threatening to curtail the chase early.\n\nLucknow, meanwhile, have fared slightly better of late, with three wins in their last five. They too are on the back of a defeat, though, with the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) making a mockery of their bowling at the Ekana Stadium.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG have 12 points from 11 matches, making this a vital context in the top-four race. The Super Giants' net run rate took a big hit in their last game, so they find themselves two spots below the SunRisers, who are fourth. They don't have any more wiggle room.\n\nCan SRH make the most of the beginning of their home run to round off the league stage? Or will LSG move into third place with a win?\n\nIPL 2024, SRH vs LSG Win Probability: Hyderabad bank on home venue to secure two points\n\nSRH's red-hot batting unit has cooled off after a bright start. Abhishek Sharma and Heinrich Klaasen have produced barely any returns over the last few matches, with the former yet to record a half-century in IPL 2024. Travis Head hasn't been his fluent best, either.\n\nHowever, a return to the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium could bring the best out of SRH's power-hitters. LSG haven't been too penetrative in the powerplay, and if Head and Abhishek set a platform, the middle order could do its job in the middle overs.\n\nRavi Bishnoi has experienced a slight upturn in form, but it's hard to see the Lucknow spin attack being able to contain Hyderabad's batters. And with their pace attack not inspiring much confidence either, the visitors could be in for a long night.\n\nThe SunRisers also have the bowlers to make the most of the conditions in Hyderabad. While they'd ideally like more options in the spin department, their pacers have used cutters and slower balls effectively so far. Pat Cummins has led the way in that regard, and the same can be expected this time around as well.\n\nLSG are an unpredictable team that generally find a way to get things done, and SRH's form hasn't been too convincing of late. {"uri": "8118472566", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:50:16", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:50:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T04:49:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.615686297416687, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/firstcricket/sports-news/srh-vs-lsg-records-stats-ipl-2024-13768851.html", "title": "SRH shatter records in rapid run-chase against LSG", "body": "Abhishek Sharma (L) and Travis Head (R) took Sunrisers Hyderabad to a comfortable victory against Sunrisers Hyderabad in IPL 2024. AP\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad chased down a below-par 166 run target against Lucknow Super Giants on Wednesday in IPL 2024. Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma were at the forefront of the quickfire chase at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad.\n\nNeeding 166 to win, SRH cruised past the finish line in just 9.4 overs and with 10 wickets to spare. In the process, they became the first team to chase down 150-plus total in less than 10 overs in the history of T20 cricket.\n\nA look at the numbers from the blitz:\n\n62 balls remaining: SRH won with 10.2 overs remaining - the biggest such margin in chases of 150-plus runs in T20s. The previous biggest win was when Brisbane Heat successfully chased down 157 against Melbourne Stars with 60 balls to spare in the 2018-19 BBL.\n\n167: SRH's total is the highest by any team by the end of the tenth over in men's T20s. The previous highest was Worcestershire's 162 against Northamptonshire in 2018.\n\n107: SRH were on 107 at the end of the powerplay. It is the second highest in men's T20s. The highest also belongs to SRH, when they smashed 125/0 against Delhi Capitals last month.\n\n146: SRH have now accounted for 146 of 1000-plus sixes in the ongoing IPL season, the most maximums by a team in any T20 tournament. The previous highest was 145 sixes by Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2018.\n\n80: The difference in powerplay scores reveals the difference in the two sides. Batting first, LSG were 27/2 after six overs. SRH, meanwhile, were 107/0. It's the largest difference in powerplay scores in IPL history\n\n27 - LSG's 27/2 in the powerplay was their lowest total in first six overs in IPL history\n\n3 - Travis Head has now scored three IPL fifties while needing fewer than 20 balls. Delhi Capitals' Jake Fraser-McGurk is the only other batter with three sub-20-ball fifties. Head has two 16-ball fifties, the joint fastest for Sunrisers in the IPL\n\n17.27 - SRH's run rate in the 167 runs total was staggeringly more than 17 per over. It is the highest for a 150-plus partnership in the IPL, and the second highest in all T20s\n\n2 - SRH have won two IPL matches now by 10 wickets when chasing a 150-plus target. The first came against Mumbai Indians in 2020\n\n30 - Overall, SRH struck 30 boundaries from the 58 balls they faced. It included 16 fours and 14 sixes -the most in the first ten overs of a men's T20 match. LSG, meanwhile, hit 16 fours and four sixes for a combined 20 boundaries in their entire innings. Head and Abhishek had more than that in the powerplay alone", "source": {"uri": "firstpost.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Firstpost"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8118343484", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "02:34:08", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T02:34:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T02:33:35Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.615686297416687, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/hardik-pandya-led-mumbai-indians-become-the-first-team-to-be-eliminated-from-ipl-2024/", "title": "Hardik Pandya-led Mumbai Indians become the first team to be eliminated from IPL 2024", "body": "Mumbai Indians, on Wednesday (May 8), became the first team to get knocked out of the playoffs race in the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL 2024). The five-time champions' fate was sealed following Lucknow Super Giants' defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad.\n\nSRH thrashed LSG by ten wickets to move to the third spot in the IPL 2024 points table. After suffering a seven wicket loss in their previous game against Mumbai Indians, SRH bounced back in style to blow LSG away. Batting first, LSG recovered from 66 for 4 in the 12th over to post a competitive total of 165 for 4 in 20 overs. Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) rescued LSG after their dismal start.\n\nHowever, SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma made a mockery of the target as they hit blazing half-centuries to take their team home in just 9.4 overs. Head smashed 89 runs of just 30 balls with the help of eight fours and as many sixes. On the other hand, Sharma remained unbeaten on 75 off 28 balls with the help of eight fours and six sixes.\n\nThe win was SRH's seventh of the season in 12 games and took them to the third spot in the points table. The Pat Cummins-led side has all but sealed its place in the playoffs. On the other hand, LSG are at the sixth spot with six wins and as many losses and now face a herculean task to qualify for the next stage.\n\nSRH's win against LSG confirmed Mumbai Indians' fate in IPL 2024. They will exit the competition at the league stage. With four wins from 12 games, Hardik Pandya-led Mumbai Indians are currently languishing at the ninth spot in the points table.\n\nEven if they win their remaining two games, they will finish with 12 points. Three teams - Kolkata Knight Riders, Rajasthan Royals and Sunrisers Hyderabad - already have 14 points. With Delhi Capitals and LSG set to face on May 14, one of them would also get 14 points. It means Mumbai Indians will not be able to make it to the top four.\n\nThe victory for SRH has also made the forthcoming game between Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru a do-or-die clash. The losing team will be knocked out of IPL 2024. {"uri": "2024-05-349969625", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "08:45:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T08:45:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T08:35:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.615686297416687, "url": "https://www.republicworld.com/sports/cricket/ipl/i-think-that-matters-a-lot-abhishek-sharma-shares-the-secret-to-his-top-notch-performances", "title": "'I think that matters a lot': Abhishek Sharma shares the secret to his top-notch performances", "body": "Abhishek Sharma breaks sunil narine big record in ipl | Image:ipl/bcci\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants: In a thrilling match, Sunrisers Hyderabad clinched a resounding victory over Lucknow Super Giants. SRH's dominant performance restricted LSG to 165/4 in 20 overs, with impressive bowling from Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Shahbaz Ahmed. However, the real spectacle unfolded during SRH's innings, as they chased down the target without losing a single wicket. Travis Head's outstanding unbeaten 89 off 30 deliveries and Abhishek Sharma's explosive 75 off 28 powered SRH to a stunning victory, with 62 balls to spare. Travis Head's exceptional performance earned him the well-deserved \"Player of the Match\" title.\n\nAbhishek Sharma reveals the support he gets from SRH that helps him to perform at his best\n\nThe unwavering support from skipper Pat Cummins and the entire think-tank played a big role in his success in the on-going IPL, reckoned Sunrisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma.\n\nThe 23-year-old Punjab left-hander fired from all cylinders for Hyderabad this season, making 401 runs from 12 matches and those runs have come at an awesome strike-rate of 205.\n\n\"Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that,\" Abhishek said on JioCinema Match Centre Live after their record 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants here on Wednesday.\n\n\"They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" said Abhishek, who has hit 35 sixes so far, highest by any batter this season.\n\nThe SRH openers Abhishek (75 not out off 28 balls) and Travis Head (89 not out off 30 balls) scaled down 166 in just 9.4 overs, rewriting the record for the quickest chase of 150-plus in T20 cricket.\n\nSRH's total of 167 was also the highest by any team by the end of the tenth over in men's T20s.\n\n\"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy,\" said Abhishek who played a key role in Punjab winning the domestic T20 title last season.\n\nAbhishek (485 runs from 10 matches) was the second highest run-getter behind Riyan Parag (510) of Assam in last season's SMAT.\n\n\"I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this,\" he added.\n\n'Big fan of Head' With Head at his explosive best, SRH have smashed many batting records this season including the highest ever IPL total of 287/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.\n\nAbhishek hailed the way Head played spin.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays spin better than Travis. The shots he hit off (Krishnappa) Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is.\n\n\"He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of him over the last year that I have followed him.\n\n\"When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time,\" he added.\n\nAbhishek then touched upon his strategy against the LSG bowlers, especially pacers.\n\n\"They were bowling cutters in the middle. I thought the cutters could slow down on their way, but Travis and I had planned to play it the way you would hit a spinner with the spin.\n\n\"So, if it's an off-cutter, we look to hit towards long-off covers. If it's a leg cutter, obviously we look at mid-wicket or mid-on,\" he added.\n\n(With PTI inputs)", "source": {"uri": "republicworld.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Republic World"}, "authors": The KL Rahul-led side was left clueless and they suffered a 10-wicket thrashing.\n\nLucknow Super Giants won the toss and opted to bat first. It seemed that they would post a big total on the board. Quinton de Kock (2) and Marcus Stoinis (3) perished early and the team came under pressure.\n\nSkipper KL Rahul (29) struggled with his timing whereas Krunal Pandya (24) played a vital hand with the bat. However, after that, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48) brought their team back in the game.\n\nThe duo added unbeaten 99 runs and bailed Lucknow Super Giants out of trouble. {"uri": "2024-05-349619532", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "00:36:36", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T00:36:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T00:00:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6117647290229797, "url": "https://www.insidesport.in/cricket/drs-may-9-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-shatter-records-bhuvneshwar-kumar-rolls-back-the-years-and-ayush-badoni-50-goes-in-vain/", "title": "DRS, May 9: Head-Abhishek shatter records, Bhuvi rolls back the years & Badoni's 50 goes in vain", "body": "Welcome to our special segment, DRS or the Daily Review System. InsideSport will provide you with the top stories of IPL from a day before that you might have missed in the hustle and bustle of your busy life.\n\nThe Sunrisers Hyderabad chased down a target of 166 in just 9.4 overs! Yes, you read that correctly. Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head scored almost 3 runs per ball to take their side home. The two southpaws have made it a habit in the IPL 2024 to destroy the bowling line-ups and dreams of opposition fans as they pile on the pain.\n\nOn what seemed like a tough pitch when the Lucknow Super Giants were playing, the Pat Cummins-led side handed their skipper a perfect birthday gift by ending the match in just 58 balls. Apart from an early flight home, they also got a massive boost in the points table as they climbed to 3rd spot.\n\nAll not well in LSG camp?\n\nAfter the thrashing, KL Rahul admitted that they were outplayed and gave Head and Abhishek their flowers. However, it seemed like LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka wasn't too pleased with his skipper or the team. He was seen having a long animated chat with Rahul after the match, and it looked like he was giving the wicketkeeper opener an earful.\n\nHead & Abhishek make records fall like flies\n\nThe dynamic duo's 167-run stand saw them break multiple records. Due to their fireworks, SRH became the first team to chase a 100+ target in under 10 overs and broke their own record for most runs scored in the first 10 overs of an IPL match (previously 158). Travis Head broke his own record for the highest strike rate after playing 30 balls (296.66), and Head now also holds the record for the highest strike in the IPL for anyone who's scored more than 500 runs.\n\nMumbai Indians knocked out of IPL 2024\n\nThe Lucknow Super Giants weren't the only team to lose today. Hardik Pandya's Mumbai Indians suffered a heavier loss as they are the first team to be officially out of the IPL 2024. Sunrisers Hyderabad's massive victory means that MI are no longer in the reckoning, and Hardik's first stint as Mumbai's captain comes to an early end.\n\nBhuvi's back!\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar was at his best today. In a match where all of LSG's bowlers went at over 14.5 runs per over, Bhuvi ended up with the figures of 4-0-12-2. Apart from him, only Pat Cummins managed to get a wicket for SRH, and he went for 47 runs in his quota of four overs. He gave away just 7 runs for 2 wickets in the powerplay and then returned at the end of the 18th over and stopped Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni from teeing off.\n\nUnhappy Samson fined\n\nSanju Samson has paid for his indiscretion. After arguing with the on-field umpire following his controversial dismissal, the Rajasthan Royals skipper has been handed a 30% match fee fine. Samson was involved in a controversial incident against the Delhi Capitals, and for showing his dissent, he's been punished by the BCCI.\n\nBadoni, LSG's only shining light?\n\nAyush Badoni's performance might be the only good thing to happen for LSG against Sunrisers Hyderabad. The 24-year-old was their highest run-scorer and lone half-centurion in a match where their batters and bowlers both failed. The duo is having an incredible season for their franchise and their style of attacking right from ball one and taking their team to totals of 250 or more is something that could cause a paradigm shift in T20 cricket in the near future.\n\nAbhishek's fearless hitting at the top led to speculations that he could be one of the surprise entries to India's T20 World Cup squad. However, the 23-year-old all-rounder did not make it to the squad.\n\nHesson however, backs this youngster to be a part of India's plans following the tournament, because of his ability to attack spin in the powerplay and an improved game against pace.\n\n\"Oh, look, I think so (whether Abhishek will play for India following T20 WC). I mean, I think his ability to take on spin in the power play. And he has improved greatly against pace. He is a high-quality player. He is a boundary hitter. He is a six-hitter and no doubt post-World Cup, and he will start to make some changes, whether it be Yashasvi Jaiswal, himself or Shubman Gill. To be fair, there are a few. There is plenty of names, but he will definitely be one that will have plenty of people talking about,\" said Hesson on JioCinema.\n\nAbhishek is the 11th-highest run-getter with 401 runs in 12 matches at an average of 36.45 and a strike rate of 205.64, with two fifties. His best score is 75*.\n\nComing to yesterday's match between SRH and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. A win in the upcoming match will be important for both teams for their chances in the season.\n\nBoth teams lost their last match and made things difficult for themselves. SRH lost the match to MI by 7 wickets and LSG lost to KKR by a huge margin of 98 runs at home. SRH has not been as impressive as a bowling unit. They have often depended on the batters to win matches for them. LSG would like to take advantage of it. On the other hand, the visiting side has been struggling with inconsistent batters. While their bowling is good, batting has been a big concern.\n\nBoth teams have some of the best players in the world. LSG has some good names like KL Rahul, Nicholas Pooran, Marcus Stoinis, Krunal Pandya, Ravi Bishnoi, and others. SRH has some good players in their lineup. The key for them would be to make the most of the home conditions and perform to the expectations of the fans. A big challenge for SRH would be to prove themselves a capable unit to win the match with their bowling. That promises to be a good match between the two sides.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad are likely to continue with the same opening order. Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head are arguably the greatest opening combination this season. The two Southpaws have taken the tournament by storm with their brilliant batting performances. Both of them have been highly aggressive and helped SRH to gain early momentum in almost every game. It has allowed other batters coming after them to bat the way they want. However, there is a shortcoming in their approach.\n\nAlso Check: IPL 2024 Orange Cap\n\nWhile the duo has been brilliant while setting a total, they have not been that good while chasing. Barring the game against CSK where they were chasing 166, neither Head nor Abhishek have been that brilliant with the bat while chasing over 200 runs. If the duo can provide good starts to the side while chasing totals, SRH looks to be a different side. Come the game against RR, the duo would be hoping to make an impact even while chasing the totals.\n\nIn the middle order, SRH have some of the best batters in the world along with an emerging one. Number 3 has been a problematic spot for SRH. They have tried various players in the position like Aiden Markram, Abhishek Sharma, Rahul Tripathi, Mayank Agarwal, and Anmolpreet Singh. But none of them clicked. SRH needs to find ways to accommodate someone who can be consistent with the bat at the position. Heinrich Klaasen is likely to bat at number 4.\n\nThe batting positions depend on the match situation. Klaasen is one of the best IPL batters in the last couple of seasons. Even as a wicketkeeper, he has been doing a good job. The key for him would be to back his natural approach of going aggressive from his end. Blocking the ball doesn't help him or his team. Abdul Samad has been good for SRH. He is one of the designated finishers for the Orange Army. His form with the bat has come like a breath of fresh air for SRH.\n\nSRH have some of the most talented all-rounders in their lineup. Nitish Kumar Reddy will be the middle-order batter in the side. The young batter won the match for the home side with his batting while saving them from a collapse. In the last few matches, he has also been handy as a bowler. If required, he can deliver his full quota of overs. They have another talented all-rounder like Shahbaz Ahmed who has been good as a finisher and decent as a spinner.\n\nShahbaz needs to bowl better. He can deliver economical spells like he did against RCB. However, he needs to bowl those spells on a consistent basis. With the bat, he can finish the games well and anchor the innings in case of collapses. SRH has some good overseas players who can be handy with their all-round skills. They have Glenn Phillips and Marco Jansen in the squad who can contribute both with the bat and with the ball. Jansen has had a bad season and needs to step up.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad have a decent bowling lineup on paper. With the new ball, Bhuvneshwar Kumar has the ability to swing both ways. However, the heat wave has meant a lack of swing at many venues, especially in Hyderabad. Hence, he has been a bit ineffective with the new ball. To bowl alongside him is the pace duo of Jaydev Unadkat and T Natarajan. While the former relies mostly on slower ones and bouncers (with a change of pace), the latter has been very good with the ball.\n\nAlso Check: IPL 2024 Purple Cap\n\nUnadkat will be on the main side, while Natarajan might be used as the impact substitute. His death bowling has been good which has bound the team together. In the middle overs, SRH is reliant on the pace-spin duo of Pat Cummins and Mayank Markande. The SRH skipper has been their best bowler this season bowling well in almost every match. He can control the flow of runs and take wickets. In addition to it, Cummins is a handy batter too. Markande needs to be consistent as a bowler for the 2016 champions. {"uri": "2024-05-348866960", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "10:42:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T10:42:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T10:25:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6039215922355652, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/ipl-2024-3-landmarks-reached-tonight-s-srh-vs-lsg-clash", "title": "IPL 2024: 3 landmarks that could be reached in tonight's SRH vs LSG clash", "body": "Tonight's (May 8) IPL match features the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) taking on the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Rajiv Gandhi Stadium. This is the first time these two teams will face each other in the group stage of IPL 2024.\n\nThe two teams are currently tied on points (12) but separated by a whisker-thin Net Run Rate, as they find themselves embroiled in a fierce battle for a coveted playoff spot.\n\nSRH will be smarting from their recent loss to Mumbai Indians. However, they'll draw confidence from their dominant home record, having lost just one match at Hyderabad this season.\n\nLSG, on the other hand, will be looking to bounce back from a crushing defeat against Kolkata. Their batting lineup is packed with explosive firepower - KL Rahul and Marcus Stoinis in top-order, and the big-hitting Nicholas Pooran in the middle order. However, their bowling attack might find the Hyderabad wicket, known for its batting paradise reputation.\n\nAhead of tonight's big clash, let us take a look at three milestones that could be breached in the SRH vs LSG IPL 2024 match.\n\n#3 Quinton de Kock could become the first-ever South African to complete 1000 fours in T20s\n\nQuinton de Kock will have extra motivation when LSG take on his former team, SRH. The explosive left-hander sits on the cusp of a historic T20 milestone. He needs just six boundaries to become the first South African cricketer to notch up 1000 fours in the shortest format.\n\nThis achievement would be a testament to de Kock's consistent ability to find the boundary rope. Having amassed 994 fours in his 336 T20 matches, de Kock boasts an impressive strike rate of over 137.\n\n#2 Abhishek Sharma will play his 100th T20 match\n\nAbhishek Sharma has wreaked havoc with his blazing form this season. The talented youngster has been a revelation for SRH, having mustered 326 runs at an amazing strike rate of 195.21.\n\nThe match against LSG will mark Abhishek Sharma's 100th appearance in the shortest format of the game. Having made his T20 debut as a 17-year-old for Delhi Capitals back in 2018, Abhishek has featured across 99 T20 games thus far.\n\nIn this period, he has scored 2,513 runs and has taken 30 wickets as well.\n\n#1 KL Rahul could complete 400 fours in IPL\n\nKL Rahul, the Lucknow Super Giants captain, enters tonight's match against SRH on the cusp of a personal milestone. The Indian wicket-keeper batter sits just five fours away from joining an elite club of players with 400 fours in IPL history.\n\nAchieving this feat against SRH would make him only the 11th player to do so, a testament to his consistent and elegant strokeplay throughout the years.\n\nIn the 120 innings Rahul has played, he has hammered 4594 runs with the help of 395 fours and 183 sixes.", {"uri": "8117848598", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:52:20", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:52:20Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:51:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6039215922355652, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2932508-rahul-lauds-head-abhisheks-unreal-batting-after-lsgs-victory", "title": "Rahul lauds Head, Abhishek's \"unreal\" batting after LSG's victory | Sports-Games", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul on Wednesday said they were completely outplayed by the incredible power-hitting of Sunrisers Hyderabads openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, terming it unreal batting. Head and Sharma added another chapter to their remorseless domination over bowlers while carving lightning fast unbeaten fifties to power SRH to a convincing 10-wicket win over LSG in a crucial IPL match.\n\nLucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul on Wednesday said they were completely outplayed by the incredible power-hitting of Sunrisers Hyderabad's openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, terming it ''unreal batting.'' Head and Sharma added another chapter to their remorseless domination over bowlers while carving lightning fast unbeaten fifties to power SRH to a convincing 10-wicket win over LSG in a crucial IPL match. Chasing a modest 166, Head (89 not out, 30 balls, 8x4s, 8x6s) and Sharma (75 not out, 28 balls, 8x4s, 6x6s) toyed with LSG bowlers, finding boundaries and sixes at will to canter home in just 9.4 overs. ''I am at lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. ''They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. It was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,'' he said. This was after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch. Rahul blamed the defeat on their poor display with the bat in powerplay, from which they scored just 27 runs for the loss of two wickets. ''Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum. ''Ayush (Badoni) and Nicky (Nicholas Pooran) batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well,'' he admitted.\n\nSRH skipper Pat Cummins said that it was an ''unreal'' batting display from Head and Sharma. ''The boys (Head and Sharma) have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal,'' he said. ''We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs.'' Cummins was effusive in his praise for both Head and Sharma. ''He's (Head) been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional. ''(Abhishek) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them,'' he said. Head, who was adjudged player-of-the-match for his pyrotechnics, said he was really enjoying batting with Sharma as they compliment each other well. ''Lots of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay,'' he said.\n\n''I know how hard he (Abhishek Sharma) works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out in the last couple of games.'' Abhishek thanks Lara, Yuvraj ===================== After his hurricane fifty, Abhishek thanked two left-handers, who had thrilled the audience during their playing days, for his success in the on-going IPL -- Yuvraj Singh and Brian Lara. ''I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,'' he said. Abhishek also thanked the SRH team management for the trust shown in him. ''I would never think of coming to such a tournament and playing at such a strike rate, but thanks to the team management. ''The message was clear from them and I backed myself.'' There was a special mention of his opening partner -- Head. ''All the credit goes to him (Head). LSG posted a competitive total of 165 runs for 4 wickets in their allotted 20 overs while batting first.\n\nHowever, SRH responded with an emphatic chase, reaching the target of 167 runs in just 9.4 overs without losing a single wicket. Nevertheless, the reaction of SRH's owner, Kavya Maran, to a shot played by LSG batter Ayush Badoni against Pat Cummins has been grabbing significant attention.\n\nIn a crucial moment during the last over of LSG's innings, SRH captain Cummins assumed responsibility for the bowling attack. On the first delivery of Cummins' over, Badoni, the talented right-handed batter, showcased his batting prowess by executing a masterful reverse-lap shot. With precision and skill, Badoni directed a low full toss delivery to the boundary through the backward point region, demonstrating his exceptional ability under pressure.\n\nKavya's response to Badoni's reverse lap shot for a boundary was marked by disappointment, as evidenced by her baring her teeth in frustration and then slowly leaning her head back. This candid moment was quickly captured by the cameraman and has since garnered significant attention on social media platforms.\n\nMeanwhile, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma were the chief architect of victory of SRH. Chasing a target exceeding 160, Sunrisers achieved the daunting task with exceptional speed, reaching 166 runs without the loss of any wickets in just 9.4 overs. Head played a stellar innings, remaining unbeaten with 89 runs off 30 deliveries, smashing eight fours and eight sixes. Similarly, Abhishek showcased his batting prowess with an unbeaten 75 runs off 28 balls, comprising eight fours and six sixes.\n\nFollowing this triumph over LSG, SRH have surged to the third position in the standings, accumulating 14 points from 12 matches.
