{"uri": "2024-05-349333201", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:28:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:28:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:28:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6000000238418579, "url": "https://sports.ndtv.com/ipl-2024/ipl-2024-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-star-in-sunrisers-hyderabads-10-wicket-win-over-lucknow-super-giants-5620044", "title": "IPL 2024: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma Star In SunRisers Hyderabad's 10-Wicket Win Over Lucknow Super Giants", "body": "The remorseless domination of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, who carved lightning fast fifties, helped Sunrisers Hyderabad mount the fastest chase of a 160-plus target en route their convincing 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL match on Wednesday. Chasing a modest target of 166, Head (89 not out, 30 balls, 8x4, 8x6) and Sharma (75 not out, 28 balls, 8x4, 6x6) toyed with LSG bowlers, finding boundaries and sixes at will to canter home in just 9.4 overs. The win propelled SRH to the third position in the standings with 14 points from 12 games, while LSG are struggling at the sixth spot with 12 points from the same number of matches.\n\nThe result also meant that five-time champions Mumbai Indians, currently ninth with eight points from 12 matches, are out of the play-off race.\n\nThe dance of destruction by Head and Sharma even left the legendary Sachin Tendulkar gushing.\n\n\"A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300,\" Tendulkar wrote in his X account.\n\nThe Head and Sharma show came after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before losing the plot a bit.\n\nAyush Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Nicholas Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch.\n\nBut the Head and Sharma took any hint of competition out of the match once they bludgeoned 107 runs in the Power Play.\n\nIt was an awesome hitting display from the Indo-Australian pair as they didn't spare a single LSG bowler, clobbering them to all parts of the ground.\n\nLSG's decision to start with Krishnappa Gowtham also backfired badly as both Head and Sharma, who are really good against spin, dismantled the off-spinner.\n\nSuch was the brutal assault that the likes Yash Dayal, Ravi Bishnoi and Naveen-ul-Haq were also taken to the cleaners, raining sixes and fours.\n\nEarlier, LSG were struggling at 27 for 2 at the end of the powerplay after opting to bat.\n\nThe visitors lost Quinton de Kock, who replaced an injured Mohsin Khan, early, caught brilliantly by Nitish Kumar Reddy at deep backward square-leg off Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) in the third over.\n\nBhuvneshwar struck again in the fifth over, dismissing the dangerous Marcus Stoinis but the credit for the dismissal should go to young Sanvir Singh, who took a stunning diving catch just inches from the ground at mid-on.\n\nThe pitch also didn't help LSG's cause as the ball was coming on to the bat a bit slow, as their batters found it difficult to find the timing.\n\nWhile skipper KL Rahul (29) held one end up, Krunal Pandya (24) took it on himself to up the ante.\n\nKrunal pummelled Jaydev Unadkat for a six over long-on and then hit the bowler straight over his head for another maximum to accumulate 15 runs in the eighth over.\n\nRahul hit the first boundary of LSG innings in the 10th over, slamming SRH skipper Pat Cummins over mid-off.\n\nBut Rahul never looked at his usual best as he struggled to get his timing and finally departed in search of quick runs, caught by T Natarajan at deep backward square leg in the final delivery of the same over.\n\nSRH were brilliant on the field as Cummins' direct throw from mid-on sent Krunal packing soon when the batter went for a quick single.\n\nBadoni pressed the feet on the accelerator soon with three boundaries of left-arm pacer Natarajan's 14th over which yielded 17 runs.\n\nThe Lucknow side finally got going as Pooran and Badoni struck a six and a four to accumulate 12 runs off the 15th over bowled by leg-spinner Vijayakanth Viyaskanth.\n\nThey showed intent from the word go and didn't hesitate to play their strokes when the opportunity was presented to them.\n\nIt was brilliant batting from Badoni as he swept and cut Natarajan for two consecutive boundaries in the 17th over.\n\nBadoni displayed some cheeky shots as the right-hander notched up his fifty in 28 balls.", "source": {"uri": "sports.ndtv.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NDTVSports.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": SRH's dominating win at home has given them a big lead in the playoffs race and once again it was their openers who played a crucial role in securing a vital win in IPL 2024.\n\nRead: Head, Sharma defy odds on slow Hyderabad track as SRH trounce LSG\n\nThe duo of Head and Sharma smashed 107 in the powerplay to register the record for the second-highest score in the first six overs of an IPL match and the record for most runs is also held by Sunrisers - when the openers smashed 125/0 against Delhi Capitals earlier this season.\n\nAlso read | SRH shatter records in rapid run-chase against LSG\n\nOf course, it takes the next level of coordination and trust among a batting duo to be able to produce such record-breaking performances on a trot and Abhishek Sharma spoke exclusively to JioCinema on Match Centre Live about his relationship with Head, his approach while batting, and how he tackled the LSG bowlers.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays better spin than Travis. The shots he hit off K Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is. He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of him over the last year that I have followed him. When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time.\"\n\nAlso Read | Rahul gets public rebuking from LSG team owner Goenka\n\nOn his fearless approach, Sharma said, \"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this. Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that. They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot.\"\n\nSharma also discussed how he tackled the LSG bowlers: \"They were bowling cutters in the middle. I thought the cutters could slow down on their way, but Travis and I had planned to play it the way you would hit a spinner with the spin. So, if it's an off-cutter, we look to hit towards long-off covers. Inspired by his performance, SRH registered a thumping 10-wicket win against the LSG side at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad.\n\nThe Super Giants captain won the toss and opted to bat first in the contest. Their batters struggled to score freely in the first half of the innings. Impactful knocks from Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) in the second phase took them to a competitive total of 165.\n\nHowever, it proved to be too low for SRH in the run chase. Travis Head continued his excellent form in the tournament and went on a carnage, setting the stage for a comprehensive win for his side inside the powerplay. Abhishek Sharma (75*) complemented him perfectly with an aggressive knock of his own as the duo scored more than 100 runs in the first six overs yet again.\n\nThey continued in the same vein even after the powerplay to win the game for SRH in just 9.4 overs. Travis Head was the protagonist for the home team with a splendid knock of 89 (30), which comprised eight sixes and as many fours.\n\nFans took note of Head's majestic performance against LSG in the chase and expressed their reactions on X. Here are some of the top reactions:\n\n\"It took 20 years to forget Ricky Ponting's assault and the way Travis Head played in recent times,it will take 40 years to forget. He's just ridiculous, What a Striker of the ball,\" another fan wrote.\n\n\"I'm convinced Travis Head is just warming up for the T20 World Cup,\" a fan wrote.\n\n\"I was trying to get into position early and react to the ball\"- Travis Head\n\nAt the post-match presentation, Travis Head received the Player of the Match award for his sensational knock in the chase. He reflected on the win and said:\n\n\"It was a lot of fun. Abhi and I have forged along some good partnerships and it was great fun again batting with him. I was trying to get into position early and react to the ball. Got ahead of the rate in the first few overs and I felt we could maximise the powerplay. The last twelve months, the Australian team wanted me to bat like this and here it was the same thing.\"\n\nOn Abhishek Sharma's knock and their thought process during the chase, Head continued by saying:\n\n\"Yeah beautiful for him to get a good score today. He works very hard and nice to see him get some runs today. We complement each other so well. We didn't think about the net run rate till the time out when the guys told us about that. I want to take this pitch everywhere. Chasing has been a bit tough for us and hopefully we keep on the good work in the remaining games.\"\n\nSRH will be back in action on May 16 in IPL 2024 when they face the Gujarat Titans (GT) at the For those who are unaware, Sanjiv Goenka owns IPL franchise Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) which is led by KL Rahul. In a match against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) on May 8, LSG faced a humiliating defeat at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi Stadium. Kavya Maran's SRH chased down the target set by LSG with 10 wickets in hand and 62 balls to spare. After the defeat, LSG owned Sanjiv Goenka was spotted having a heated chat with captain KL Rahul. Although the words of the discussion aren't audible, one can clearly feel the heat from the gestures. The video is now doing rounds on the internet.\n\nAfter winning the toss and electing to bat, LSG managed a below-par total of 164 runs. Captain Rahul's innings of 29 off 33 balls lacked momentum. However, Ayush Badoni (55 off 30) and Nicholas Pooran (48 off 26) rescued the Lucknow-based team with a strong 99-run partnership, providing a solid finish.\n\nIn response, Travis Head (89 off 30) and Abhishek Sharma (75 off 28) wreaked havoc on the Hyderabad-based team, chasing down the target in less than 10 overs with 62 balls to spare. SRH set numerous records while inflicting one of the most embarrassing defeats in IPL history on LSG.\n\nLSG now find themselves in sixth place on the table with only 12 points from 12 matches. They likely need victories in both remaining games to qualify, given their significantly impacted net run rate (NRR).\n\nSince their establishment, LSG have made the playoffs in both previous seasons, though they were eliminated in the eliminator in 2022 and 2023. {"uri": "8118418973", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "03:57:03", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T03:57:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T03:56:37Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5960784554481506, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/firstcricket/sports-news/kl-rahul-sanjiv-goenka-srh-vs-lsg-video-13768838.html", "title": "KL Rahul gets public rebuking from team owner Sanjiv Goenka after LSG thrashed by SRH - watch video", "body": "LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka and captain KL Rahul had an animated conversation after they were convincingly beaten by SRH in IPL 2024. Image: X\n\nLucknow Super Giants suffered a crushing 10-wicket defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium in the Indian Premier League (IPL) on Wednesday. Batting first, LSG crawled to 165/4 in 20 overs. Hosts SRH romped home with 10 wickets and 10.2 overs to spare as Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma obliterated the bowlers.\n\nKL Rahul won the toss and decided to bat. LSG's struggles with the willow were visible early as they got their first boundary only in the 10th over albeit hitting a couple of sixes before it.\n\nKL Rahul himself struggled to unleash the shackles with a laboured 29 runs from 33 balls. It was only Nicholas Pooran (48 off 26 balls) and Ayush Badoni (55 runs in 30 balls) that gave the visitors some sense of respectability with the total - still well below par.\n\nIn the chase, Head and Abhishek had no trouble whatsoever. The Aussie struck 89 runs from 30 balls and Abhishek powered 75 runs from 28 balls with SRH getting the job done with utter ease.\n\nBeyond the massive defeat, video footage of LSG team owner Sanjiv Goenka with captain KL Rahul might not go down well with the squad. In the viral social media video, Goenka can be seen publicly and quite animatedly reprimanding the wicketkeeper-batter.\n\nIn the post-match presentation, KL Rahul was at a loss to describe SRH's comfortable chase.\n\n\"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills,\" KL Rahul said after the match.\n\n\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" he added.\n\nKL Rahul said SRH would have chased 240 runs also considering how well they were striking the ball.\n\n\"Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum,\" KL said.\n\n\"Ayush and Nicky batted well to get us to 166. I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this. Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that. They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. {"uri": "8117867744", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:07:35", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:07:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:07:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5921568870544434, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/srh-vs-lsg-srh-create-history-as-they-chase-down-highest-total-inside-10-overs-in-t20-history/", "title": "SRH vs LSG: SRH create history as they chase down highest total inside 10 overs in T20 history", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad, on Wednesday (May 8), created history as they thrashed Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad.\n\nBatting first, LSG posted 165/4 in the allotted 20 overs. The Lucknow-based outfit was off to a disastrous start and was reeling at 66 for 4 in the 12th over. Even the 150-run mark was looking tough at that stage. However, an unbeaten 99-run stand between Ayush Badoni (55) and Nicholas Pooran (48) helped them post a competitive total.\n\nThe score, however, turned out to be too low in the hand as SRH chased it down with utmost ease. The Hyderabad-based outfit chased down 166 runs in less than 10 overs without losing any wickets. Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma scored whirlwind half-centuries as SRH crossed the finishing line in just 9.4 overs.\n\nHead smashed 89 runs off just 30 balls with the help of eight fours and as many sixes. On the other hand, Sharma scored 75 off 28 balls with the help of eight fours and six sixes.\n\nBy chasing down the total in just 9.4 overs, SRH have created history. They now hold the record for chasing down the highest total inside 10 overs in men's T20. The previous record was held by Brisbane Heat who had chased down 157 in 10 overs against Melbourne Stars in the Big Bash League in 2019.\n\nSRH now also hold the record for scoring most runs inside 10 overs in the IPL. The previous record was also held by them for scoring 158 against Delhi Capitals earlier this season.\n\nHighest total after first 10 overs in IPL:\n\nSRH have also broken Delhi Capitals' record of winning an IPL game with the most balls to spare while chasing a 100-plus target.\n\nWinning with most balls to spare in IPL (100+ targets):\n\nMeanwhile, the win has taken SRH to the third spot in the points table. They now have seven wins and five losses in IPL 2024 and look set to make it to the playoffs. {"uri": "2024-05-349362395", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:01:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:01:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:01:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5921568870544434, "url": "https://www.espn.com/cricket/series/8048/report/1426295/sunrisers-hyderabad-vs-lucknow-super-giants-57th-match-indian-premier-league-2024", "title": "Recent Match Report - Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants, Indian Premier League 2024, 57th Match | ESPN.in", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad 167 for 0 (Head 89*, Abhishek 75*) beat Lucknow Super Giants 165 for 4 (Badoni 55*, Pooran 48*, Bhuvneshwar 2-12) by ten wickets\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad obliterated Lucknow Super Giants, first stifling them with the new ball and then sensationally chasing down 166 in just 9.4 overs - the highest 10-over score in any T20. The massive win lifted them to No. 3 on the points table with 14 points in 12 matches, and also gave them a much-needed net-run-rate boost. The chase was so brutal that LSG didn't even bother with their Impact Player.\n\nA lot will rightly be spoken of the explosive batting of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, who got to their fifties in 16 and 19 balls respectively, putting on a hundred between them inside the powerplay for the second time this IPL, both times the highest powerplay scores in all T20 cricket.\n\nHowever, it was with the ball that SRH set up the win. Bhuvneshwar Kumar led the way with figures of 4-0-12-2, conceding only singles, completely shutting down the LSG top order, which scored just 66 in the first 11.2 overs. That the top order had not been enterprising enough was underscored by the unbroken 99-run stand off 52 balls between Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran, which eventually proved to be hopelessly inadequate.\n\nMumbai Indians were collateral damage on the night, knocked out of contention for the playoffs by this result, the first team at IPL 2024 to be officially out.\n\nBhuvneshwar gets stuck in\n\nA word about the fear surrounding the SRH batters first. It was that fear which, in part, prompted LSG to bat first. And then they ran into Bhuvneshwar, who was unerring in his length and drew movement off the pitch. Quinton de Kock - 66 off 66 off Bhuvneshwar in T20 cricket overall - managed just 1 off 4 off him, those four balls inclusive of a near-dismissal and his wicket, caught superbly by Nitish Reddy at deep-square leg.\n\nIt was a sensational catch made to look easy as Reddy took it over his head, threw it back in the field of play, stepped out and came back to complete the catch, but Sanvir Singh soon outdid him with a low catch diving forward at mid-on to send back Marcus Stoinis. Bhuvneshwar ended the powerplay with 3-0-7-2. Add Shahbaz Ahmed's 2-0-9-0 to that, and LSG had had their worst powerplay of the year: 27 for 2.\n\nIPL debutant, the Sri Lanka legspinner V Viyaskanth, kept the lid on after the powerplay only for Krunal Pandya to inject some momentum into the innings by hitting Jaydev Unadkat for successive sixes, the tournament's 999th and 1000th. The first one was an extraordinary straight hook to a head-high slower bouncer over long-on. Little did we know the shot would become a mere footnote by the time the night was done.\n\nBadoni, Pooran rescue LSG\n\nKL Rahul, 29 off 33, perished trying to hit the pace of Pat Cummins, and Krunal was run out by the SRH captain and birthday boy as he tried to steal a single when the boundaries were not coming. It had taken 9.1 overs for the first four of the innings, but Badoni and Pooran found the boundary regularly. Badoni led the charge by moving around in the crease and manipulating the field, getting to a fifty in 28 balls. Pooran joined in towards the end, using the pace of T Natarajan and Cummins. Only five teams can reach 18 points in IPL 2024 including leaders Kolkata Knight Riders, Rajasthan Royals and Chennai Super Kings.\n\nBut whoever loses on Wednesday will no longer be able to touch 18 points, giving a clear advantage to the winner of the match at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Both teams have lost their previous fixtures and will be desperate to return with two points as the race for the playoffs heats up.\n\nSRH currently occupy fourth place in the standings with 12 points from 11 games, including six wins and five defeats. They lost to the Mumbai Indians (MI) by seven wickets in their last outing.\n\nLSG, on the other hand, suffered a thumping 98-run loss to the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at home. They have slipped to sixth position with 12 points from 11 games, including six victories and five defeats.\n\nA win here will be imperative for both teams tonight as IPL 2024 enters the business end. The southpaw has struck three fifties and one century so far in IPL 2024.\n\nHead has looked good in the last two matches despite the results not going his side's way. The Aussie cricketer will look to keep up the good work and steer Hyderabad to victory on Wednesday night.\n\n#2 KL Rahul - LSG\n\nThe LSG skipper has struggled for consistency this season. {"uri": "8118747999", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "08:18:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T08:18:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T08:18:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5921568870544434, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/t20-world-cup-2024-rohit-sharma-ajit-agarkar-under-immense-pressure-as-yuvraj-singh-pushes-for-abhishek-sharmas-case/", "title": "T20 World Cup 2024: Rohit Sharma Ajit Agarkar under immense pressure as Yuvraj Singh pushes for Abhishek Sharma's case", "body": "Thanks To Yuvraj Singh, Brian Lara As Well And My Father - Abhishek Sharma\n\nLegendary all-rounder Yuvraj Singh praised Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head following the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) win over the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). Yuvraj Singh made a bold prediction about Abhishek Sharma's future, following his impressive performances in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, May 8. The Pat Cummins-led team moved to the third position with 14 points from 12 games, while LSG remained in the sixth spot with 12 points.\n\nTravis Head scored an unbeaten 89 runs off 30 balls, including eight fours and six sixes. Abhishek added 75 runs off 28 balls, featuring eight fours and six maximums. The batting duo added a 167-run partnership to chase down the Lucknow Super Giants' total of 165 in just 9.4 overs at their home ground.\n\nAbhishek Sharma credited Travis Head for his aggressive batting style, stating that he often sets the tone for their partnerships. The 23-year-old batter also expressed gratitude to Yuvraj Singh, Brian Lara, and his father for their unwavering support in his cricketing journey.\n\n\"All the credit goes to him (Travis Head). The way he starts against all bowlers... he goes after them from the start and takes the pressure off. The bowlers told us (during the innings break) that it was getting better, but myself and Travis thought it was not doing much. I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,\" Abhishek said.\n\nYuvraj Singh responded to Abhishek Sharma's gratitude and encouraged the young batter to maintain consistency and patience. Yuvraj stated that an opportunity for Sharma in international cricket is forthcoming.\n\n\"Well played @IamAbhiSharma4. Be consistent, be patient! Your time is around the corner! @travishead34 what planet are you batting on, my friend? Unreal!!! #SRHvsLSG #IPL2024,\" Yuvraj wrote on X (formerly known as Twitter).\n\nAbhishek Sharma has scored 401 runs in 12 matches with an average of 36.45 and a strike rate of 205.64, featuring two half-centuries. His opening partner, Travis Head, is third in the list of highest run-scorers. Head has scored 533 runs in 11 matches with an average of 53.3 and a strike rate of 201.8.\n\nLucknow Super Giants managed only 57 runs for the loss of three wickets in the initial 10 overs after winning the toss. Skipper KL Rahul scored just 29 runs off 33 balls, including a four and a six. However, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) rescued the Lucknow team with a 99-run partnership.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar was the top bowler for the Hyderabad team. {"uri": "8118337346", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "02:25:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T02:25:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T02:25:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5882353186607361, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/sachin-tendulkar-awestruck-by-travis-head-abhishek-sharmas-beyond-belief-blitzkrieg-vs-lsg-had-they-batted-first-101715220455674.html", "title": "Sachin Tendulkar awestruck by Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma's beyond-belief blitzkrieg vs LSG: 'Had they batted first...'", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad were utterly dominant as they sealed a one-sided victory against Lucknow Super Giants in their IPL 2024 fixture, on Wednesday. Openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma remained unbeaten as SRH cruised to 167/0 in 9.4 overs, in their chase of 166 runs.\n\nAbhishek, who slotted in as his side's Impact Player, smacked an unbeaten knock of 75 runs off 28 balls, packed with eight fours and six sixes. Meanwhile, Head clattered an unbeaten knock of 89 off 30 deliveries, slamming eight fours and eight sixes in the process.\n\nTheir batting display was simply sensational and also received plaudits from all corners. Meanwhile, India legend Sachin Tendulkar took to X, formerly known as Twitter, and called it 'an understatement'.\n\nHe wrote, \"A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300!\"\n\nInitially, a two-wicket haul from Bhuvneshwar Kumar saw SRH restrict LSG to 165/4 in 20 overs. Meanwhile, Ayush Badoni (55*) and Nicholas Pooran (48*) remained unbeaten for LSG. The result also meant that MI have been eliminated from the playoffs race.\n\nSRH won with 62 balls to spare, which also became the best win in IPL with most balls to spare in 100-plus targets. SRH's win is followed by DC's win vs Punjab Kings in 2022, where 57 balls were left to spare in a chase of 117 runs.\n\nOn Wednesday, Head and Abhishek faced the second-fewest balls in IPL history to get to their 100-run partnership, coming up against 34 deliveries. They are also on top of the leaderboard in this statistic, facing only 30 balls against DC this year. After the win, SRH climbed to third position in the standings with 14 points. Meanwhile, LSG remained in sixth with 12 points.\n\nLauding Head, Abhishek said, \"All the credit goes to him (Head). The way he starts against all bowlers.. he goes after them from the start and takes the pressure off. The bowlers told us (during the innings break) that it was getting better, but myself and Travis thought it was not doing much.\"\n\nMeanwhile, the Aussie opener praised Abhishek. He said, \"I know how hard he works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out the last couple of game.\"", "source": {"uri": "hindustantimes.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Hindustan Times"}, "authors": [], "concepts": Avesh Khan", "body": "SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) will clash with the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Match 57 of Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024. The Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad will host this contest.\n\nSRH are currently fourth in the points table with six wins in 11 league matches. In their last outing, the SunRisers posted a modest score of 173 against Mumbai Indians (MI), with Travis Head scoring 48 off 30. Their bowling unit then failed to defend their score, as MI sealed the chase in the 18th over.\n\nLSG, on the other hand, are sixth in the standings with the same number of wins as their opponents but have an inferior net run rate. Their last outing was against Kolkata Knight Riders, who smashed 235 runs at a slow surface like Lucknow. The LSG batting unit couldn't handle the pressure, bundling out for 137.\n\nIt will be a crucial game for both teams as the side winning will have one foot in the IPL 2024 playoffs. On that note, let's take a look at the three best bowling performances in SRH-LSG matches in the cash-rich league.\n\n#3 Jason Holder - 3/34, IPL 2022\n\nThe Caribbean all-rounder did well in his only season with the Lucknow Super Giants in 2022.\n\nBatting first in Match 12, the Super Giants posted 169 on the board, with KL Rahul (68) and Deepak Hooda (51) emerging as the top contributors. For the SunRisers Hyderabad, Washington Sundar, Romario Shepherd and T. Natarajan picked up two wickets each.\n\nThe LSG bowling unit did well to take consistent wickets and keep SRH under pressure. With 16 needed off the last over, Jason Holder was handed the opportunity to defend it for Lucknow.\n\nOn the first delivery, Holder pitched it a good length area. Sundar tried to clear the fence but the long-on fielder Rahul came running to take a fine catch.\n\nThe fourth ball saw Holder delivering a slower delivery and Bhuvneshwar Kumar's top edge was caught by the keeper Quinton de Kock.\n\nOn the last ball, Shepherd could only hold out at the point region, and Holder managed to secure a 12-run victory for the LSG side. He finished with figures of 3/34 off four overs.\n\n#2 Krunal Pandya - 3/18, IPL 2023\n\nIn the 10th match of IPL 2023, LSG met SRH at the Ekana Stadium. The decision to bat first backfired SRH, as Krunal Pandya's impressive spell put them under pressure.\n\nIn the third over, Pandya came into the attack and got Mayank Agarwal caught at silly mid-off through a soft dismissal.\n\nThe eighth over saw Pandya trapping Anmolpreet Singh, who was steering the visitors at a comfortable rate. On the next delivery, the left-arm spinner breached through the defense of Aiden Markram to dismiss him for a golden duck. Pandya finished with figures of 3/18 off four overs, as SRH scored 121/8 in 20 overs.\n\nKL Rahul (35) and Krunal Pandya (34) were impressive with the bat to help LSG complete the chase in 16 overs.\n\n#1 Avesh Khan - 4/24, IPL 2022\n\nThe right-arm pacer returned with terrific figures of 4/24 in the same game, where Jason Holder secured a final-over victory for the LSG team.\n\nChasing 170, SRH were certainly under a bit of pressure and needed a few boundaries to get going. In the fourth over, Kane Williamson tried to be innovative by playing a scoop against Avesh's widish delivery but only ended up playing on Andrew Tye's throat in the short fine leg area.\n\nThen, Abhishek Sharma tried to be ambitious by trying to play a big shot in the seventh over but was caught near the point region.\n\nWith 27 needed off 16, Avesh dismissed Nicholas Pooran, who played a big shot straight into the hands of the long-off fielder. The next delivery saw the pacer inducing an edge of Abdul Samad and dismissing him for a golden duck. Head continued his fine run in IPL 2024 as he has seemingly carried his form from international cricket to the ongoing campaign. Head won the Player of the Match award for his blazing knock of 89 runs against LSG at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on May 8, Wednesday.\n\nSRH thumped LSG by 10 wickets to lift themselves to the 3rd spot in the points table as the race to the playoffs intensified. Head, while speaking at the post-match presentation, talked about taking full advantage of the powerplay and him working on his ability to play spin. The batter emphasised that working on his spin-hitting ability would be crucial for him as he would travel to the USA and West Indies for the T20 World Cup with the Australian team. IPL 2024, SRH vs LSG: Match report | highlights\n\n\"Lot of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay. (On his spin hitting) It is something I have been working on, it will be a big part in the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game,\" Head said. IPL 2024 Full Coverage | IPL 2024 Points Table and Standings | 2024 IPL Full Schedule\n\nLSG's plan to introduce spin early on in the innings backfired as Head took down Krishnappa Gowtham in the 3rd over of the chase for 22 runs. He slammed Ravi Bishnoi for massive fours and sixes as the entire LSG bowling attack looked hapless.\n\nHead talked about his fearless approach for his national team as well as the franchise side. With Pat Cummins being at the helm of affairs in the Test and ODI sides for Australia and at SRH, Head has found clarity in the role and has delivered it to perfection.\n\n\"The last 12 months, that's how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that's what I've been told to do here as well,\" Head said.\n\nThe Australian opener scored 327 runs in the ODI World Cup 2023 for Australia at an average of 54.83. This also included a delightful knock of 137 runs in the final against India on November 19, 2023. Head continued his domination on the Indian tracks as he has slammed 533 runs in 11 matches at an average of 53.30 in the IPL 2024.\n\nHead opened up on his record-breaking partnership with Abhishek Sharma, who also scored a 28-ball 75 against LSG. He was happy after accumulating more runs than David Warner in his first season for SRH.\n\n\"Nothing much that I have to change. (On Abhishek Sharma) I know how hard he works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out the last couple of games. (On NRR) We didn't think about it till the Timeout, but after that the boys came out and told us to score quickly.\" Head said.\n\n\"The crowd was exceptional tonight, that's what we needed after losing the last two. I haven't got many things over him, so that's good to know that I have more runs than David Warner did in his first SRH season. {"uri": "8118586992", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "06:29:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T06:29:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T06:27:37Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5843137502670288, "url": "https://guyanachronicle.com/2024/05/09/head-abhishek-trounce-lsg-with-another-blistering-hitting-show/", "title": "Head, Abhishek trounce LSG with another blistering hitting show - Guyana Chronicle", "body": "LED by Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's blazing knocks, Sunrisers Hyderabad handed Lucknow Super Giants a thumping defeat in a one-sided contest in Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nThe duo helped their side chase down 166 with 62 balls to spare, and significantly propelled their Net Run Rate, moving to the third spot on the points table. 30 of the 58 balls the duo faced were hit for boundaries as they secured their team a 10-wicket win.\n\n80 runs separated the two teams in the powerplay. SRH smashed eight sixes in this period, twice of what LSG managed in their entire innings. If with the ball courtesy of Bhuvneshwar Kumar's efforts, SRH gained momentum in the contest, with the bat, they completely killed the chase in this phase.\n\nLed by Bhuvneshwar Kumar's fine spell upfront, well aided by Shahbaz Ahmed, SRH managed to restrict LSG to their lowest-ever powerplay score. The batters struggled to find timing and never had the rhythm to get going, losing two crucial wickets - Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis - in this period.\n\nKrunal Pandya's assault on Jaydev Unadkat, which included two sixes down the ground, allowed LSG to get some much-needed momentum in their innings. However, he didn't find ample support from the other end. Rahul holed out to T Natarajan at long leg and soon after Krunal himself was run out while attempting a quick single.\n\nBadoni and Pooran stepped on the accelerator in the death overs and countered SRH's plans of using the slower balls on the hard lengths by attacking the shorter part of the boundary. They couldn't send any of those shots over the rope, including the last one which was superbly defended by Nitish Reddy at sweeper cover.\n\nIn the first eight balls of the run-chase, SRH were moving along at run-a-ball, far slower than their standards, and then Abhishek Sharma cut loose. Yash Thakur lost his line, and as the attack continued from both ends - as Travis Head and Abhishek have done for most of this season - LSG ran out of plans. K Gowtham, who bowled an effective first over, was taken to the cleaners in his second, butchered for three sixes and a boundary.\n\nThe duo exploded and hammered 99 runs in the next 28 balls, which killed the contest. Head, who led the assault, powered along to his joint-fastest half-century, reaching the mark in only 16 balls - his fourth fifty within the powerplay this season, most by any batter ever in IPL.\n\nThe middle overs started with a six by Travis Head and the chase ended with a six by Abhishek Sharma. The two southpaws continued their relentless attack in the never-ending six-fest as SRH managed to post the highest-ever score within the first 10 overs in the IPL (playing two balls less). Badoni's part-time off-breaks were smashed for 19, Ravi Bishnoi was taken apart for 17, Naveen ul Haq bowled a few effective slower balls but was still carted away for 14. The chase was done and dusted in 58 balls.\n\nWith that win, SRH not only gave their NRR a boost but also knocked out Mumbai Indians from the qualification race. {"uri": "8117082685", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "09:39:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T09:39:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T09:39:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5843137502670288, "url": "https://news.abplive.com/sports/ipl/how-ipl-2024-playoff-race-will-be-affected-if-srh-vs-lsg-match-is-washed-out-due-to-rain-1685997", "title": "How IPL 2024 Playoff Race Will Be Affected If SRH vs LSG Match Is Washed Out Due To Rain", "body": "IPL 2024 Playoff Race: As summer showers sweep across parts of India, there's a possibility that tonight's IPL 2024 match between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium could be affected. According to the latest weather reports for Hyderabad on Wednesday (May 8), rain is forecasted, potentially marking the first rain-affected match of IPL 2024.\n\nIf the IPL 2024 match between SRH and LSG is abandoned due to rain, both teams will earn a point each and rise above in the top four of the IPL 2024 points table.\n\nNevertheless, the abandoned match means both teams will have one less opportunity to strengthen their position in the race for IPL 2024 playoffs.\n\nAlso on ABP Live | IPL 2024 Playoffs Qualification Scenarios Of All 10 Teams: Battle For 3rd And 4th Spot Intensifies\n\nIn the IPL 2024 Points Table, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) holds the fourth position in IPL 2024 Points Table with 12 points, whereas Lucknow Super Giants sits in sixth place with the same number of points.\n\nWhich teams will benefit if SRH vs LSG IPL 2024 match gets washed out due to rain?\n\nWith KKR and RR firmly occupying the top two spots in IPL 2024 points table, the race for the third and fourth positions is set to intensify among the remaining teams.\n\nIf tonight's SRH vs LSG match is abandoned due to rain, both SRH and LSG stand to gain a point each, potentially pushing them ahead of CSK, who currently have 12 points. This scenario could see SRH and LSG entering the top four in the standings, intensifying the playoff race among the six remaining contenders: CSK, LSG, SRH, DC, RCB, and PBKS.\n\nCSK could swiftly re-enter the playoff race by winning their next match against GT on May 10, potentially displacing LSG from the top four.\n\nIf tonight's SRH vs LSG match is washed out, SRH stands to benefit the most, especially considering their slightly better net run rate compared to LSG and DC. However, a potential washout could make it challenging for RCB and PBKS to secure playoff berths.\n\nBoth SRH and LSG are likely hoping for an uninterrupted game or, at the very least, a five-over-per-side match. Teams generally aim for at least 16 points to secure a spot in IPL playoffs. {"uri": "8117853214", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:55:39", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:55:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:55:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5843137502670288, "url": "https://www.newsbytesapp.com/news/sports/abhishek-sharma-smashes-unbeaten-75-versus-lsg/story", "title": "Abhishek Sharma shines with an unbeaten 75 versus LSG: Stats", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad batter Abhishek Sharma scored a superb 75*-run knock versus Lucknow Super Giants in Match 57 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 season on Wednesday. Abhishek and his opening partner Travis Head helped SRH script a record-breaking chase in the IPL. LSG managed 165/4 in 20 overs. Abhishek and Head then posted a stunning 167*-run stand as SRH won in 9.4 overs.\n\nHead smashed Krishnappa Gowtham for a four off the final ball in the first over. Abhishek then took charge with four fours. The third over saw Gowtham get launched by Head for three sixes and a four. The massacre continued as 107 runs came in six overs. Abhishek reached his fifty from 19 balls in the 7th over as SRH walked past LSG.\n\nAbhishek made his presence felt with a 28-ball 75* (4s: 8, 6s: 4). He struck at 267.86. In the IPL 2024 campaign, Abhishek now owns 401 runs at 36.45. His strike rate is 205.64 (50s: 2). Overall, the southpaw has 1,294 IPL runs at 25.88 (SR: 153.13). He registered his 6th fifty. In T20s, he owns 2,588 runs at 30.44 (SR: 152.50).\n\nThe unbeaten 167-run stand between Abhishek and Head is SRH's third-highest partnership for any wicket. This is also SRH's second-highest stand for the opening wicket. Meanwhile, this is now the highest stand (any wicket) against LSG in the competition's history, surpassing the 142-run stand shared between Shubman Gill and Wriddhiman Saha for Gujarat Titans in IPL {"uri": "2024-05-348754836", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "09:13:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T09:13:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T08:50:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5843137502670288, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/picking-combined-srh-lsg-playing-11-ipl-2024-ft-travis-head-kl-rahul", "title": "Picking a combined SRH-LSG playing 11 for IPL 2024 ft. Travis Head and KL Rahul", "body": "We are almost into the final few days of IPL 2024 and Wednesday would be the first time that SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Supergiants (LSG) will play against each other this year. And they couldn't have picked up a more enthralling time - both are level on points after 11 games, fighting for the top four.\n\nBoth teams are coming off big losses. While LSG have been marred by injury concerns and an unstable batting order, SRH's playing 11 changes after their back-to-back losses in the middle of the season haven't worked too well.\n\nBut just to demonstrate the quality these two sides possess, we have picked a combined 11 from their squads. It brings together their best qualities with minimum weaknesses, by including the most in-form players. It's a hypothetical team but we have limited to players who are available for selection. Check it out:\n\nTop order: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma, and KL Rahul (WK)\n\nIt's hard to break the opening combination of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma this IPL. Thanks to them, SRH's powerplay run rate of 11.04 is only behind Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).\n\nWhile Head has smashed 444 runs at a strike rate of 189.74, Abhishek has 234 runs at a strike rate of 188.70. The two left-handers like to take on the bowlers from the first over itself and when they get going, they are almost impossible to stop.\n\nLSG have made it easier to keep them intact at the top of the order by dropping Quinton de Kock from their 11. Youngster Arshin Kulkarni hasn't been able to grab his opportunities yet while skipper KL Rahul has had his usual strike-rate issues where he has failed to get off the blocks quickly, apart from a couple of games.\n\nRahul, though would be the perfect number three for this team. The right-hander has scored 431 runs this season at an average of 39.18. Shifting him a position down the order would allow Head and Abhishek to continue as they have and give more steel to the middle order. Rahul's skills of moving the game with him, especially against spin, would work well for the big hitters following him.\n\nRahul's display of some exceptional wicketkeeping skills this year makes him the best option to take the gloves as well.\n\nMiddle order: Nicholas Pooran, Heinrich Klaasen, Nitish Reddy, and Abdul Samad\n\nThis would make one of the most fearsome middle orders in all IPL. Left-handed Nicholas Pooran has scored 315 runs at a strike rate close to 160 while Heinrich Klaasen has collected 339 runs, striking at over 186. The former's ability to take down all kinds of spinners would dovetail with the latter's unmatched pace-hitting skills.\n\nThey would be followed by two promising SRH youngsters Nitish Reddy and Abdul Samad. Reddy has been impressive with both bat and ball in IPL 2024, rescuing his team multiple times from a batting collapse. Apart from 239 runs at a strike rate of 152, he also has three wickets, making him a handy pace option.\n\nSamad, meanwhile, has shown the same promise he showed in his debut season which went missing in the last three years. More than his 151 runs at a strike rate of 181.93 which have provided crucial finishing touches for SRH, it's his willingness to take the responsibility to attack that makes him a stand-out batter.\n\nLSG also have some decent options for number five, especially someone like Marcus Stoinis who could be great value to the team. However, there has been a lot of shuffling and no one has scored runs as consistently as the SRH group.\n\nBowlers: Pat Cummins (C), Ravi Bishnoi, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, and T Natarajan\n\nSRH captain Pat Cummins was the obvious choice for captain as well as the leader of the bowling attack. Although Rahul has been great with a young team, Cummins is just more qualified and experienced to lead such a star-studded team.\n\nHis bowling has been superb too, much better than what most expected when he was signed. He has 13 wickets in 11 games, bowled the most important overs more often than not, and taken the key wickets even on the flattest tracks.\n\nHis pace partners at SRH, T Natarajan and Bhuvneshwar Kumar, are easy choices too. Natarajan has 15 wickets in nine games at 21.20. He has time and again shown that he's one of the best death bowlers in IPL, thanks to his ability to bowl pin-point yorkers at will and beat the batters with his slingy actions and variations.\n\nAlthough LSG have some excellent pacers in their ranks, like Mohsin Khan and Yash Dayal, neither have been at their best. Mayank Yadav would have been a sure-shot entrant but he has likely been ruled off the season due to injury.\n\nThis gives a slight edge to Bhuvneshwar Kumar, who has recently shown vintage form with five wickets in the last three games. His new ball skills and the kind of death-over experience he showed against Rajasthan Royals is hard to leave out.\n\nFinally, spin bowling. This has been an issue for both SRH and LSG. SRH's Mayank Markande was doing well but they chose to drop him. LSG's Ravi Bishnoi, thus, takes the spot despite not being at his best.\n\nHis economy rate and confidence in big duels have been decent but the leg-spinner has just lacked the usual consistency with his lines and lengths. As soon as he finds that, he'll be back picking a ton of wickets again.", "source": {"uri": "sportskeeda.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sportskeeda"}, "authors": [{"uri": "rudransh_khurana@sportskeeda.com", "name": "Rudransh Khurana", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucknow_Super_Giants", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Lucknow Super Giants"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travis_Head", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Travis Head"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K._L._Rahul", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "K. {"uri": "8117900366", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:35:15", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:35:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:34:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5843137502670288, "url": "https://www.rediff.com/cricket/report/ipl-2024-big-hitting-head-using-ipl-as-prep-for-t20-wc-srh-vs-lsg/20240508.htm", "title": "Big-hitting Head using IPL as prep for T20 WC", "body": "IMAGE: Travis Head samshed 8 sixes and 8 fours as he hammered 89 runs off just 30 balls. Photograph: BCCI\n\nFollowing his side's 10-wicket win against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) batter Travis Head, who secured the 'Player of the Match' award for his match-winning knock, said that he has been working on his batting against spin since it will play a big role on slow surfaces during the ICC T20 World Cup to be held this year from June 1 onwards in West Indies and USA.\n\nScorecard\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad openers Head and Abhishek Sharma smashed Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) bowlers to the pulp, registering a ten-wicket victory and chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs in their Indian Premier League (IPL) game at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nSpeaking after the match, Head said in the post-match presentation, \"Had a lot of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Abhishek Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay.\n\n\"It is something I have been working on (spin-hitting), it will be a big part of the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game. The last 12 months, that is how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that is what I have been told to do here as well.\"\n\nPraising his opening partner Abhishek for his hard work and \"deep thinking\", Head said: \"We complement each other very well. We didn't think about it till the Timeout, but after that, the boys came out and told us to score quickly.\n\n\"The crowd was exceptional tonight, that is what we needed after losing the last two. I haven't got many things over him, so that is good to know that I have more runs than David Warner did in his first SRH season,\" he concluded.\n\nAbhishek thanks Lara, Yuvraj\n\nIMAGE: Abhishek Sharma clobbered 75 off just 28 balls. Photograph: BCCI\n\nAfter his hurricane fifty, Abhishek thanked two left-handers, who had thrilled the audience during their playing days, for his success in the on-going IPL -- Yuvraj Singh and Brian Lara.\n\n\"I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,\" he said.\n\nAbhishek also thanked the SRH team management for the trust shown in him.\n\n\"I would never think of coming to such a tournament and playing at such a strike rate, but thanks to the team management.\n\n\"The message was clear from them and I backed myself.\"\n\nThere was a special mention of his opening partner -- Head.\n\n\"All the credit goes to him (Head). Chasing a target of 166, SRH achieved victory in just 9.4 overs, highlighting their dominance with the bat.\n\nSRH's aggression was evident right from the powerplay, where they amassed a staggering 107 runs, setting the tone for their commanding chase. The left-handed opening duo started cautiously, managing only eight runs in the first over, but quickly shifted gears, unleashing a barrage of boundaries and sixes.\n\nAbhishek's assault on Yash Thakur in the second over, followed by Head's onslaught on K Gowtham in the third over, left the LSG bowlers reeling. In the chase, they romped home in 9.4 overs, not losing a single wicket in the process.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar was brilliant with the ball for Sunrisers Hyderabad. The veteran pacer registered figures of 2-12 from his four overs, getting the major scalps of Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis. In the chase, Travis Head clobbered 89* in 30 balls, while Abhishek Sharma smashed 75* in 28 balls.\n\nFollowing the thumping win, Sunrisers Hyderabad find themselves at third position in the IPL 2024 points table. The toss ahead of the match will take place at 7:00 PM IST.\n\nWhile SRH are third in the IPL 2024 points table, Gujarat Titans are in last place. Even if the run rate equation comes into play, Gujarat's chances of progressing are negligible.\n\nWhen Gujarat met Hyderabad in the first half of IPL 2024 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, they hammered Pat Cummins and co. by seven wickets. Bowling first, Gujarat Titans held Hyderabad to 162-8 as Mohit Sharma claimed 3-25. In the chase, good contributions from the top and middle-order took them home in 19.1 overs.\n\nGujarat have been in woeful form lately, having lost four of their last five matches, three of them in succession. {"uri": "8117816908", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:26:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:26:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:26:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5803921818733215, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2932475-srh-dominate-lsg-with-convincing-10-wicket-win-led-by-head-and-abhisheks-heroics", "title": "SRH Dominate LSG with Convincing 10-wicket Win, Led by Head and Abhishek's Heroics | Sports-Games", "body": "But the Head and Sharma took any hint of competition out of the match once they bludgeoned 107 runs in the Power Play. But Rahul never looked at his usual best as he struggled to get his timing and finally departed in search of quick runs, caught by T Natarajan at deep backward square leg in the final delivery of the same over.\n\nThe remorseless domination of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, who carved lightning fast fifties, helped Sunrisers Hyderabad mount the fastest chase of a 160-plus target en route their convincing 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL match here on Wednesday. Chasing a modest target of 166, Head (89 not out, 30 balls, 8x4, 8x6) and Sharma (75 not out, 28 balls, 8x4, 6x6) toyed with LSG bowlers, finding boundaries and sixes at will to canter home in just 9.4 overs. The win propelled SRH to the third position in the standings with 14 points from 12 games, while LSG are struggling at the sixth spot with 12 points from the same number of matches. The result also meant that five-time champions Mumbai Indians, currently ninth with eight points from 12 matches, are out of the play-off race. The dance of destruction by Head and Sharma even left the legendary Sachin Tendulkar gushing. ''A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300,'' Tendulkar wrote in his X account. The Head and Sharma show came after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before losing the plot a bit. Ayush Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Nicholas Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch. But the Head and Sharma took any hint of competition out of the match once they bludgeoned 107 runs in the Power Play. It was an awesome hitting display from the Indo-Australian pair as they didn't spare a single LSG bowler, clobbering them to all parts of the ground. LSG's decision to start with Krishnappa Gowtham also backfired badly as both Head and Sharma, who are really good against spin, dismantled the off-spinner.\n\nSuch was the brutal assault that the likes Yash Dayal, Ravi Bishnoi and Naveen-ul-Haq were also taken to the cleaners, raining sixes and fours. Earlier, LSG were struggling at 27 for 2 at the end of the powerplay after opting to bat. The visitors lost Quinton de Kock, who replaced an injured Mohsin Khan, early, caught brilliantly by Nitish Kumar Reddy at deep backward square-leg off Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) in the third over. Bhuvneshwar struck again in the fifth over, dismissing the dangerous Marcus Stoinis but the credit for the dismissal should go to young Sanvir Singh, who took a stunning diving catch just inches from the ground at mid-on. The pitch also didn't help LSG's cause as the ball was coming on to the bat a bit slow, as their batters found it difficult to find the timing. While skipper KL Rahul (29) held one end up, Krunal Pandya (24) took it on himself to up the ante. Krunal pummelled Jaydev Unadkat for a six over long-on and then hit the bowler straight over his head for another maximum to accumulate 15 runs in the eighth over. Rahul hit the first boundary of LSG innings in the 10th over, slamming SRH skipper Pat Cummins over mid-off. But Rahul never looked at his usual best as he struggled to get his timing and finally departed in search of quick runs, caught by T Natarajan at deep backward square leg in the final delivery of the same over. SRH were brilliant on the field as Cummins' direct throw from mid-on sent Krunal packing soon when the batter went for a quick single. Badoni pressed the feet on the accelerator soon with three boundaries of left-arm pacer Natarajan's 14th over which yielded 17 runs. The Lucknow side finally got going as Pooran and Badoni struck a six and a four to accumulate 12 runs off the 15th over bowled by leg-spinner Vijayakanth Viyaskanth. They showed intent from the word go and didn't hesitate to play their strokes when the opportunity was presented to them. It was brilliant batting from Badoni as he swept and cut Natarajan for two consecutive boundaries in the 17th over. Badoni displayed some cheeky shots as the right-hander notched up his fifty in 28 balls.\n\n(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)", "source": {"uri": "devdiscourse.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Devdiscourse"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucknow_Super_Giants", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Lucknow Super Giants"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travis_Head", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Travis Head"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunrisers_Hyderabad", "type": "wiki", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Sunrisers Hyderabad"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sachin_Tendulkar", "type": "person", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Sachin Tendulkar"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fielding_(cricket)", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Fielding (cricket)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boundary_(cricket)", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Boundary (cricket)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T._Natarajan", "type": "person", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "T. {"uri": "2024-05-349503196", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "21:07:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T21:07:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T21:07:35Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5803921818733215, "url": "https://www.gulf-times.com/article/682113/sports/head-abhishek-help-hyderabad-to-10-wicket-win", "title": "Head, Abhishek help Hyderabad to 10-wicket win", "body": "'Kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting'\n\nOpeners Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smoked half-centuries as Sunrisers Hyderabad crushed Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets on Wednesday to boost their play-off hopes in the IPL.\n\nChasing a modest 166 for victory, Head, who smashed 89, and fellow left-hander Abhishek, who hit 75, tore into the opposition attack to romp home with 10.2 overs to spare at their home in Uppal.\n\n\"I'm lost for words. We've watched that batting on TV but that was unreal,\" Lucknow skipper K L Rahul said of the bludgeoning by the Hyderabad openers.\n\n\"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting.\"\n\nAustralia's Head attacked with a flurry of fours and sixes as he reached his fifty in 16 balls and went past 500 runs this season.\n\nHead is now third in the batting chart behind Virat Kohli (542) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (541) with his fourth half-century - he also has a ton - in this edition.\n\nHe took on the spinners with aplomb and said the skill will be invaluable on the slow pitches in the West Indies during the T20 World Cup in June.\n\n\"Something I have been working on with spin, something I have been working hard on. It will be a big part in the Caribbean,\" said man of the match Head.\n\n\"Nice to get 360 (degrees) and get to the parts of the ground I have not been to. We want to maximise the powerplay. It is not going to work every time but we want to go for it.\"\n\nThe 30-year-old Head lauded his younger partner Abhishek, 23, and said: \"His spin game is something else. We complement each other so well.\"\n\nAbhishek joined the charge as he got to his fifty in 19 balls after the pair took Hyderabad to 107 in the first six overs of powerplay, when only two fielders are allowed outside the inner circle.\n\nHyderabad, who won the IPL in 2016 under David Warner, registered their seventh win in 12 matches to hand a perfect gift to birthday boy and captain Pat Cummins, who turned 31 on Wednesday.\n\nAbhishek hit the winning six as Hyderabad moved to third in the 10-team table with 14 points. Lucknow stay sixth after the bruising loss.\n\nTop four teams will make the play-offs with the final on May 26 in Chennai.\n\nCummins said Head's unconventional hitting does not \"surprise\" him anymore and praised Abhishek for being \"an incredible player of spin\" and pace.\n\nSeam bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar set up victory with impressive bowling figures of 2-12 in his four overs to restrict Lucknow to 165-4 after they elected to bat first. Lucknow lost regular wickets until Nicholas Pooran, who hit 48, and Ayush Badoni, who smashed 55, put on an unbeaten stand of 99 in 52 balls to boost the team total. But the score proved too little against a team which posted record totals of 277 and 287 in this high-scoring edition of the T20 tournament.\n\nBRIEF SCORES\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad 167 for 0 (Head 89*, They recovered and posted 165/4, giving an impression they had done a good job on a tricky surface.\n\nTravis Head and Abhishek Sharma threw those assumptions out of the window. Exploring Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants' last match scorecards in IPL", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) will take on Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in match 57 of the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday (May 8).\n\nThe two teams have locked horns three times in the IPL. Interestingly, the Hyderabad-based franchise are yet to beat the Super Giants in the T20 tournament.\n\nLucknow beat Sunrisers by seven wickets in their most recent IPL faceoff in Hyderabad last year.\n\nBatting first, SRH posted 182/6 in 20 overs. Heinrich Klaasen starred with 47 runs off 29 balls, including three sixes and as many boundaries. Anmolpreet Singh, Aiden Markram, and Rahul Tripathi also chipped in with 36 (27), 28 (20), and 20 (13), respectively. Abdul Samad provided the late flourish with an unbeaten 37 off 25, hitting four sixes and one boundary.\n\nKrunal Pandya bagged two wickets for LSG, while Yudhvir Singh, Avesh Khan, Yash Thakur and Amit Mishra bagged one wicket apiece.\n\nIn response, Lucknow achieved the target with four balls to spare. They lost Kyle Mayers early but Prerak Mankad starred with the bat, scoring an unbeaten 64 off 45 deliveries with the help of two sixes and seven boundaries.\n\nNicholas Pooran and Marcus Stoinis also chipped in with 44*(13) and 40 (25), respectively. Meanwhile, Quinton de Kock added a valuable 29 off 19.\n\nSRH's scorecard from their last IPL match\n\nSRH lost to Mumbai Indians by seven wickets in their last IPL match held at Wankhede Stadium on May 6.\n\nAsked to bat first, SRH put up 173/8 in 20 overs. Travis Head top-scored with 48 off 30, including one six and seven boundaries. Captain Pat Cummins hit an unbeaten 35 off 17, comprising two maximums and as many fours to take his team to a fighting total. Nitish Reddy (20 off 15) and Abhishek Sharma (11 off 16) got starts but failed to consolidate.\n\nCaptain Hardik Pandya and Piyush Chawla starred with the ball for MI, returning with three wickets apiece. Meanwhile, Anshul Kamboj and Jasprit Bumrah picked up one wicket each.\n\nIn response, MI achieved the target with 16 balls to spare. They got off to the worst possible start and were reduced to 31/3 as Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan and Naman Dhir perished cheaply.\n\nSuryakumar Yadav led the chase, scoring an unbeaten 102 off 51 in an innings laced with six sixes and 12 boundaries. Meanwhile, Tilak Varma chipped in with an unbeaten 37 off 32. The duo shared an unbeaten 143-run partnership for the fourth wicket to take MI over the line.\n\nCummins, Marco Jansen and Bhuvneshwar Kumar scalped one wicket each for SRH.\n\nLSG lost to Kolkata Knight Riders by 98 runs in their last IPL game at Ekana Cricket Stadium on May 5.\n\nAsked to bat first, KKR posted 235/6 in 20 overs. Sunil Narine top-scored with 81 off 39, hitting seven sixes and six boundaries. Phil Salt and Angkrish Raghuvanshi chipped in with identical scores of 32, made off 14 and 26 deliveries, respectively. Meanwhile, Ramandeep Singh and skipper Shreyas Iyer contributed 25*(6) and 23 (15), respectively.\n\nNaveen-ul-Haq picked up three wickets for LSG but conceded 49 runs. Yash Thakur, Ravi Bishnnoi and Yudhvir Singh settled for one wicket each.\n\nIn response, the Super Giants were bundled out for 137 in 16.1 overs. Marcus Stoinis (36 off 21) and captain KL Rahul (25 off 21) were the standout batters as the entire batting unit bottled against the Knight Riders in the 200+ chase.\n\nHarshit Rana and Varun Chakaravarthy were the leading wicket-takers with three wickets apiece, while Andre Russell bagged two wickets. maximums.\n\nIn a season of breath-taking batting records, mostly set by the Sunrisers, this was the most extraordinary of all.\n\nLucknow's opening bowler, Krishnappa Gowtham, was the most economical The LSG boss vented it all on his skipper KL Rahul who conceded the 166-run target set by them in a mere 9.4 overs as SRH openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma made a mockery of the LSG bowling attack.\n\nLSG had opted to bat first and took a complete 20 overs to post 165/4 on the board. What took them more than an hour and a half was done and dusted by the SRH batters in less than an hour as they went all guns blazing and it seemed everything found the middle of the bat. Generally a team owner not happy with the performance of his side either refrains from expressing his displeasure or does it in a private space but that wasn't the case for RPSG group's founder chairman Goenka.\n\nThe 63-year-old boiled over KL Rahul seemingly for the performance of LSG in the match and was seen making some furious hand gestures as KL Rahul tried to plead his case and Goenka rebuffed it all. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six-hitting skills,\" Rahul said.\n\nRahul felt that SRH didn't give them a chance to read the pitch in the second innings. \"Was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one. {"uri": "8117519813", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "14:06:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T14:06:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T14:04:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5764706134796143, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/sports-news-ipl-2024-lucknow-super-giants-win-toss-opt-to-bat-against-sunrisers-hyderabad-5950429.html", "title": "Sports News | IPL 2024: Lucknow Super Giants Win Toss, Opt to Bat Against Sunrisers Hyderabad | LatestLY", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 8 (ANI): KL Rahul-led Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) won the toss and decided to bat against Pat Cummins' Sunrisers Hyderabad in the 57th match of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday.\n\nThe Lucknow-based franchise are coming into this match after conceding a 98-run loss against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Currently, LSG are holding the sixth place on the standings with 12 points.\n\nAlso Read | SRH vs LSG Live Score Updates of IPL 2024: KL Rahul Wins Toss and Opts to Bat First; Quinton de Kock Returns for Lucknow Super Giants, Vijayakanth Viyaskanth Makes IPL Debut.\n\nWhile the Sunrisers were in great form at the start of the tournament, however, they conceded three losses in their previous five matches. In their previous game, Pat Cummins-led SRH suffered a 7-wicket defeat against Mumbai Indians. They are standing in fourth place on the table with 12 points.\n\nWhile speaking at the toss, Cummins accepted that it would be tough to qualify for the playoffs of the tournament. He also confirmed that Vijayakanth Viyaskanth replaced Marco Jansen in the playing eleven.\n\nAlso Read | What Impact Will Result of SRH vs LSG Have on IPL 2024 Playoff Scenarios? Which Team Will Be Knocked Out First? Check Possible Outcomes.\n\n\"We would have batted as well. But we have won both ways here and hence not too upset. Hard to know (a good score) as it has been pretty high scoring. It is pretty tough (to qualify for the playoffs) and you have to keep winning till the end, we have not nailed it in the last couple of games and it is time to change that. We have a couple of changes - Sanvir comes in for Agarwal and Viyaskanth makes his debut and replaces Marco,\" Cummins said.\n\nWhile KL Rahul said they have made a few changes in the playing eleven. He confirmed Proteas batter Quinton de kock came back in the playing squad in place of Mohsin Khan.\n\n\"We will bat first. That (the pitch) plus a couple of games that have been played here. It is hard to complete forget how important this game is for both the sides, but we have played enough cricket. We will focus one thing at a time, first bat well and put the runs on the board. Playing at home becomes a difference, but we play so much cricket that we know how the conditions will be. Quinton comes in, Mohsin misses out and there are a few other changes,\" Rahul said.\n\nLucknow Super Giants (Playing XI): Quinton de Kock, KL Rahul (Wk/C), Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran, Ayush Badoni, Deepak Hooda, Krunal Pandya, Krishnappa Gowtham, Yash Thakur, Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (Playing XI): Travis Head, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klaasen (Wk), Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Sanvir Singh, Pat Cummins (C), Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jaydev Unadkat, Vijayakanth Viyaskanth, T Natarajan. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills.\n\n\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. It was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" he said.\n\nThis was after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch.\n\nRahul blamed the defeat on their poor display with the bat in powerplay, from which they scored just 27 runs for the loss of two wickets.\n\n\"Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum.\n\n\"Ayush (Badoni) and Nicky (Nicholas Pooran) batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well,\" he admitted.\n\nSRH skipper Pat Cummins said that it was an \"unreal\" batting display from Head and Sharma.\n\n\"The boys (Head and Sharma) have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal,\" he said.\n\n\"We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs.\" Cummins was effusive in his praise for both Head and Sharma.\n\n\"He's (Head) been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional.\n\n\"(Abhishek) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them,\" he said.\n\nHead, who was adjudged player-of-the-match for his pyrotechnics, said he was really enjoying batting with Sharma as they compliment each other well.\n\n\"Lots of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay,\" he said.\n\n\"I know how hard he (Abhishek Sharma) works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out in the last couple of games.\" Abhishek thanks Lara, Yuvraj ===================== After his hurricane fifty, Abhishek thanked two left-handers, who had thrilled the audience during their playing days, for his success in the on-going IPL -- Yuvraj Singh and Brian Lara.\n\n\"I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,\" he said.\n\nAbhishek also thanked the SRH team management for the trust shown in him.\n\n\"I would never think of coming to such a tournament and playing at such a strike rate, but thanks to the team management.\n\n\"The message was clear from them and I backed myself.\" There was a special mention of his opening partner -- Head.\n\n\"All the credit goes to him (Head). The duo is having an incredible season for their franchise and their style of attacking right from ball one and taking their team to totals of 250 or more is something that could cause a paradigm shift in T20 cricket in the near future.\n\nFormer Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) Director of Cricket Mike Hesson and cricket coach Mike Hesson backed young Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) opener Abhishek Sharma to open for Team India after the ICC T20 World Cup this year in West Indies and USA. Abhishek is having a wonderful Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 with the Orange Army. Tasked to smash sixes fearlessly at the top alongside Australian opener Travis Head, Abhishek is fulfilling his responsibility no doubt. The duo is having an incredible season for their franchise and their style of attacking right from ball one and taking their team to totals of 250 or more is something that could cause a paradigm shift in T20 cricket in the near future.\n\nAbhishek's fearless hitting at the top led to speculations that he could be one of the surprise entries to India's T20 World Cup squad. However, the 23-year-old all-rounder did not make it to the squad. Hesson however, backs this youngster to be a part of India's plans following the tournament, because of his ability to attack spin in the powerplay and an improved game against pace.\n\n\"Oh, look, I think so (whether Abhishek will play for India following T20 WC). I mean, I think his ability to take on spin in the power play. And he has improved greatly against pace. He is a high-quality player. He is a boundary hitter. He is a six-hitter and no doubt post-World Cup, and he will start to make some changes, whether it be Yashasvi Jaiswal, himself or Shubman Gill. To be fair, there are a few. There is plenty of names, but he will definitely be one that will have plenty of people talking about,\" said Hesson on JioCinema. Abhishek is the 11th-highest run-getter with 401 runs in 12 matches at an average of 36.45 and a strike rate of 205.64, with two fifties. His best score is 75*.\n\nComing to yesterday's match between SRH and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), LSG elected to bat first after winning the toss. The visitors got to a slow start, getting just 57 runs in the first 10 overs and losing three wickets. Skipper KL Rahul played a sluggish knock of 29 in 33 balls, with a four and a six. In the second half of the innings, Ayush Badoni (55* in 30 balls, with nine fours) and Nicholas Pooran (48* in 26 balls, with six fours and a six) turned things around with a 99-run stand, putting a score of 165/4 in 20 overs for LSG.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) was the top bowler for LSG. Pat Cummins also got a wicket. LSG is in the sixth spot with six wins, six losses and 12 points.
