{"uri": "8118532520", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:43:40", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:43:40Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:43:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.572549045085907, "url": "https://in.mashable.com/culture/74781/kl-rahul-advised-to-walk-away-as-owners-temper-flares-after-srh-defeat-fans-call-it-shameless", "title": "KL Rahul Advised To Walk Away As Owner's Temper Flares After SRH Defeat; Fans Call It 'Shameless'", "body": "Fans urge KL Rahul to leave LSG after owner's outburst in SRH clash\n\nTravis Head and Abhishek Sharma didn't just play cricket; they painted a masterpiece on the IPL canvas. Their partnership was like watching a symphony unfold, as they guided Sunrisers Hyderabad to a resounding 10-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Imagine fireworks on the cricket pitch - that's what their batting display felt like. They chased down a daunting target of 166 with such grace and ease, setting a new record for the fastest chase of a 160-plus target in IPL history.\n\nHead's innings was like poetry in motion - an unbeaten 89 off just 30 balls. Sharma, on the other hand, was a force of nature, smashing 75 not out from just 28 deliveries. The LSG bowlers could only watch in disbelief as boundaries and sixes rained down on them.\n\nThe win lifted Sunrisers Hyderabad to the third spot in the IPL standings, reaffirming their status as serious playoff contenders. Meanwhile, Lucknow Super Giants found themselves slipping to sixth place, despite having the same number of points.\n\nThe aftermath of the match was bittersweet. LSG captain KL Rahul, usually so composed, was left speechless by the onslaught from the SRH duo. A viral post-match video showed Rahul in a tense conversation with LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka, whose frustration was palpable.\n\nFans were divided in their reaction. While many criticized Goenka for publicly confronting Rahul, others empathized with the captain's predicament. They felt that such discussions should have been held in private, away from the prying eyes of the public.\n\nUnder Rahul's leadership, the Super Giants have been a consistent force in the IPL, making it to the playoffs in both seasons since their debut. However, this year poses a tougher challenge, especially after the humbling defeat to SRH. With just two matches left in the league stage, Rahul and his team need to pull off some miracles to secure a playoff berth.\n\nDespite Rahul's impressive batting stats this season, his strike rate has been a point of contention. The match against SRH only added fuel to the fire, with Rahul managing just 29 runs off 31 balls. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" said Abhishek, who has hit 35 sixes so far, the highest by any batter this season.\n\nNotably, SRH's total of 167 during the run chase is now the highest by any team inside the first ten overs in men's T20 history.\n\n\"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy,\" said Abhishek who played a key role in Punjab's title-winning campaign in SMAT last season.\n\nHe was the second-highest run-getter in the tournament with 485 runs in 10 matches, only behind Assam's Riyan Parag who amassed 510 runs.\n\n\"I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this,\" he added.\n\nAbhishek and Head have been a remarkable pair in the IPL 2024 so far, having stitched a few memorable partnerships and smashed multiple records.\n\nBoth batters also contributed to SRH's historic outing against Royal Challengers Bengaluru when they scored the IPL's highest-ever total of 287/3.\n\nAbhishek hailed the way Head played spin.\n\nALSO READ: Hardik Pandya's Leadership In Question As MI's 'Senior Players' Express Concern Over Decline In Team's Morale\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays spin better than Travis. Head (89) and Sharma (75) needed just 9.4 overs to surpass the target.\n\nLucknow lost Quinton de Kock and Marcus Stoinis inside the powerplay overs with the pitch seeming to be on the slower side. Captain KL Rahul and vice-captain Krunal Pandya rebuilt the innings but Hyderabad struck in quick succession to leave Lucknow stuttering at 66/4 after 11.4 overs.\n\nAyush Badoni (55) and Nicolas Pooran (48) stitched together an unbeaten 99-run stand to rescue their side and post a competitive target.\n\nHowever, Head and Sharma came out all guns blazing in the chase. The pair blasted 107 runs in the opening six overs, a score which Lucknow took 16 overs to get to.\n\nHead, who has been in scintillating form this season, reached his half century in just 16 balls. Just to illustrate how destructive Head was, he physically ran his first run after having plundered 64 runs from boundaries.\n\nAt the other end, Sharma was equally devastating with the bat taking 19 runs to score his 50. The carnage did not end after the powerplay as they raced to clinch the win with an IPL record 62 balls to spare.\n\nOf the 167 runs the pair scored, 148 came off boundaries. With the win, Hyderabad have climbed to third while Lucknow stay in fifth place with their net run rate taking a beating.\n\nNeed we look past anyone beyond Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma? The pair posted their 100+ partnership for the first wicket this season on Wednesday and it was the most destructive one by a country mile.\n\nHead and Sharma matched each other shot for shot and at times it looked like rather than playing against Lucknow, they were competing against each other to see who can come up with the most unbelievable shot on the night.\n\nFor their scarcely believable batting, Head and Sharma are our joint Players of the Match.\n\nThe match was headed only in one direction the moment Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma got going in the chase.\n\nKL Rahul looked stunned at the carnage Head and Sharma dealt Rahul's team in Hyderabad. The Lucknow captain was sporting to applaud the Hyderabad batters' hitting after the match stating that there is nothing that teams can do when someone bats the way Head and Sharma did in the {"uri": "8117935098", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "19:05:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T19:05:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T19:05:20Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5686274766921997, "url": "https://gulftoday.ae:443/sport/2024/05/08/head-held-high-hyderabad-humble-hapless-lucknow-to-boost-playoff-hopes", "title": "Head, Abhishek star as 'unreal' Hyderabad crush Lucknow by 10 wickets", "body": "Travis Head (4R) is congratulated by umpires and Lucknow Super Giants' players for his innings and his team's win at the end of their match in Hyderabad on Wednesday night. AFP\n\nOpeners Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smoked half-centuries as Sunrisers Hyderabad crushed Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets on Wednesday to boost their play-off hopes in the Indian Premier League (IPL).\n\nChasing a modest 166 for victory, Head, who smashed 89, and fellow left-hander Abhishek, who hit 75, tore into the opposition attack to romp home with 10.2 overs to spare at their home in Uppal.\n\n\"I'm lost for words. We've watched that batting on TV but that was unreal,\" Lucknow skipper KL Rahul said of the bludgeoning by the Hyderabad openers.\n\n\"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting.\" Australia's Head attacked with a flurry of fours and sixes as he reached his fifty in 16 balls and went past 500 runs this season.\n\nHead is now third in the batting chart behind Virat Kohli (542) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (541) with his fourth half-century -- he also has a ton -- in this edition.\n\nHe took on the spinners with aplomb and said the skill will be invaluable on the slow pitches in the West Indies during the T20 World Cup in June.\n\n\"Something I have been working on with spin, something I have been working hard on. It will be a big part in the Caribbean,\" said man of the match Head.\n\n\"Nice to get 360 (degrees) and get to the parts of the ground I have not been to. We want to maximise the powerplay. It is not going to work every time but we want to go for it.\"\n\nThe 30-year-old Head lauded his younger partner Abhishek, 23, and said: \"His spin game is something else. We complement each other so well.\"\n\nAbhishek joined the charge as he got to his fifty in 19 balls after the pair took Hyderabad to 107 in the first six overs of powerplay, when only two fielders are allowed outside the inner circle.\n\nHyderabad, who won the IPL in 2016 under David Warner, registered their seventh win in 12 matches to hand a perfect gift to birthday boy and captain Pat Cummins, who turned 31 on Wednesday.\n\nAbhishek hit the winning six as Hyderabad moved to third in the 10-team table with 14 points. Lucknow stay sixth after the bruising loss. With 12 points in the bank, SRH are currently at no.4 in the table while LSG follow them at no.5.\n\nSRH were outclassed by the Mumbai Indians in their last encounter. The Orange Army had a struggle to post 173 runs on the board which the five-time former champions managed to chase in 17 overs courtesy of a magical century from Suryakumar Yadav. SRH's formidable opening order failed to deliver after their star opener Abhishek Yadav departed early while Travis Head stayed firm. However, as the latter departed at 48, the SRH batting line-up tumbled miserably.\n\nOn the other hand, the Lucknow Super Giants were beaten by the Kolkata Knight Riders in a dominating fashion. The team's bowling unit was blown away by KKR's southpaw Sunil Narine (81 off 39 balls) as he propelled the team to 235 runs. {"uri": "8118276954", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "01:14:03", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T01:14:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T01:13:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5686274766921997, "url": "https://www.insidesport.in/cricket/ipl-2024-abhishek-sharma-is-exciting-talent-for-indian-cricket-travis-head-says-srh-vs-lsg/", "title": "Abhishek Sharma is 'exciting talent' for Indian cricket, his brother in destruction Travis Head says", "body": "Head's comments echo the wider sentiment in the cricketing world. Sharma's explosive batting display has undoubtedly ignited excitement about his potential for the Indian national team.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) cemented their reputation as an offensive powerhouse with a dominant 10-wicket victory over the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). The architects of this demolition were the opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, whose explosive partnership left the LSG bowlers helpless.\n\nChasing a modest target of 166, SRH wrapped up the chase in a mere 9.4 overs. This emphatic performance highlights the team's potent batting lineup, currently considered among the most feared in the IPL.\n\nTravis Head, Sunrises Hyderabad batter, in the post-match press conference on SRH batting said:\n\n\"Yeah, very happy with how we operate in power play and also glad to see how we scored runs outside of power play today. At time out we spoke about NRR (Net Run Rate) being important. Very pleased that checked out.\"\n\nThe foundation for this victory was laid in the powerplay, a phase where SRH has consistently dominated throughout the tournament. They amassed a staggering 107 runs in the powerplay itself, effectively sealing the match in the first six overs.\n\nThe LSG bowlers simply had no answer to the relentless assault by the SRH openers.\n\nWhile their eight-run start may have caused a flicker of hope for LSG, the unleashing began in the second over. Abhishek Sharma's four boundaries off Yash Thakur were just the beginning. Head joined the party in the third over, smashing three sixes and a four off K Gowtham. This onslaught forced LSG captain KL Rahul to introduce spin early, but Ravi Bishnoi proved equally ineffective. By the fifth over, Head had reached his blistering half-century, and the score had crossed 100.\n\nIn the post-match press conference, Travis Head praised his opening partner, highlighting Abhishek Sharma's exceptional talent and calling him an \"exciting talent for Indian cricket.\"\n\n\"Abhishek Sharma is an exciting talent for Indian cricket, kind of exceptional. We kind of compliment each other. He is very very enjoyable to be around. He is very very excited and think about the game.\"\n\nThe run-fest continued throughout the innings. Both Sharma and Head seemed determined to chase down the target within ten overs. Boundaries rained from both ends, with neither bowler able to contain the rampant duo. The winning moment arrived when Sharma launched a towering six over cover off Thakur.\n\nHead's comments echo the wider sentiment in the cricketing world. Sharma's explosive batting display has undoubtedly ignited excitement about his potential for the Indian national team. The winners of this duel will take a major step in the playoff race. The Pat Cummins-led side has ample talent but has been unable to hold on to a winning run recently. Sunrisers have lost three of their last four matches, mainly because their destructive batting line-up hasn't delivered.\n\nIn their last match against Mumbai Indians, which they lost by seven wickets, they failed to put up a good target on the board, which has been their strong suit this season. Barring Travis Head, who has been their stand-out performer, the other batters in the side have faced a recent slump.\n\nAfter displaying his power-hitting ability, young opener Abhishek Sharma has breached the 30-run mark just once in the last four games. And while SRH head coach Daniel Vettori has conceded that the openers are not expected to do the job all the time, the middle order needs to step up.\n\nThe flamboyant Heinrich Klaasen has also been unable to strike the ball consistently and Nitish Reddy too has been patchy. The bowlers have fared better compared to their batting counterparts.\n\nT Natarajan has been consistent with the ball while seasoned seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar also seems to have found his mojo after his incisive spell helped SRH eke out a one-run win against RR. LSG, on the other hand, have to get over their overall lacklustre display against Kolkata Knight Riders, when they not only conceded the first-ever 200-plus score at the Ekana Stadium but also folded their innings at 137.\n\nIt was a day when skipper KL Rahul failed to anchor the innings while the likes of Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran were unable to get the big shots when needed. Ayush Badoni has had a subdued run in this IPL and the uncapped Indian player would be keen to shrug off the rustiness.\n\nLSG's struggles with the ball have been majorly due to the lack of firepower in their pace-bowling department. With tearaway pacer Mayank Yadav ruled out of the IPL and left-arm pacer Mohsin Khan also picking up an injury, the onus will be on Afghan quick Naveen-ul-Haq, young Yash Thakur, Stoinis and spinners {"uri": "8118417914", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "03:55:58", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T03:55:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T03:55:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5686274766921997, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/we-didnt-have-an-answer-to-srhs-incredible-hitting-lsg-consultant-adam-voges-after-thumping-defeat20240509092354/", "title": "\"We didn't have an answer to SRH's incredible hitting\": LSG consultant Adam Voges after thumping defeat", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 9 (ANI): Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) consultant Adam Voges was left speechless after Sunrisers Hyderabad's (SRH) hard-hitting destroyed his team and handed the visitors a thumping defeat in a one-sided contest in their Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 match.\n\nSRH destroyed the LSG, dominating them with the new ball in the first place and then chasing down 166 in 9.4 overs beating LSG by 10 wickets, the fastest 10-over score in T20.\n\nThe brilliant batting of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, who reached their fifties in 16 and 19 balls, respectively, shared the greatest powerplay scores in T20 cricket history by scoring a century stand inside the powerplay for the second time this IPL.\n\n\"I think we all are in awe a little bit of what we've just seen. I think sometimes you've gotta tip your hat and say well played to the opposition. I think might have hit miss, hit one or two balls in the nine and a bit overs that we bowled at them. That was incredible batting and hitting. We clearly didn't have an answer,\" Voges said in a post-match press conference\n\nCourtesy of the explosive combination of Head and Sharma, Hyderabad got off to a flying start. No bowler was given any breathing room by either batter. Head and Abhishek both reached their half-centuries in less than 20 balls apiece and denied any bowler an opportunity. While Head hit 89 off just 30 deliveries, Abhishek Sharma scored 75 runs in just 28 balls and the dup never ceased pushing limits with their first swing.\n\n\"I haven't spoken to the guys yet about whether there was a difference in terms of the innings but clearly our powerplay compared to Sunrisers was at the two extremes. We were put under immense pressure with the ball right from the start. We weren't able to apply that same pressure with the bat, to begin with,\" he added.\n\nThe Super Giants were reeling at 66/4 in 11.2 overs when the pair got together the duo of Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran stitched up an unbeaten 99-run stand in 52 balls to give LSG slight hope of a competitive total. By moving around in the crease and controlling the field, Badoni spearheaded the attack and reached a fifty in 28 balls.\n\nVoges said Badoni and Pooran's partnership gave LSG a fighting chance however the total of 165 \"was clearly not enough.\"\n\n\"I thought our backend of the innings was really good. Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran's partnership got us, it was probably still under par total but it gave us a fighting chance at least. But that obviously was clearly not enough,\" Voges said.\n\nThe loss was LSG's sixth in the IPL 2024, and because of the wide margin of defeat, it severely damaged their net run-rate as well. They are currently ranked sixth after falling below Delhi Capitals in the most recent rankings. {"uri": "2024-05-349673793", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "02:29:34", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T02:29:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T01:42:25Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5647059082984924, "url": "https://www.insidesport.in/cricket/as-abhishek-sharma-travis-head-toy-with-lsg-bowlers-heres-full-list-of-records-they-broke/", "title": "As Abhishek Sharma & Travis Head toy with LSG bowlers, here's full list of records they broke", "body": "In IPL 2024, Abhishek Sharma has scored 401 runs in 12 matches at a strike rate of 205, while Travis Head has scored 533 runs at a strike rate of 201.\n\nOn Wednesday, the Hyderabad crowd witnessed some exceptional hitting by SRH's opening combination of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, as the duo took their team past the finish line vs LSG in only 9.4 overs. All this while chasing a decent total of 166. What was even more surprising is that the duo remained unbeaten till the end, striking it big, at will.\n\nWhile Travis Head managed to score 89 from 30 at a strike rate of 296, Abhishek scored 75 from 28 at a strike rate of 267. That was enough to take the team to the third spot in the IPL points table, with seven wins. Interestingly, SRH's NRR also improved considerably in the match vs LSG. Prior to the match, it stood at -0.065, and after the carnage, it is at +0.406. But there are a few more records that were broken on the way.\n\nAbhishek Sharma & Travis Head Break Records Galore\n\nHead has been going great guns this IPL 2024. He now has the most sub 20-ball fifties in the tournament, along with fellow-Aussie Jake Fraser-McGurk. The next on the list is Sunil Narine, Kieron Pollard and Ishan Kishan -- two each. Not just that, Head also has the second-most scores of fifties inside the powerplay now -- 4 -- only surpassed by David Warner (6).\n\nComing to Abhishek, he has the most number of sixes in IPL 2024 -- 35. The next on the list is Narine at 32. That also make Sunrisers Hyderabad the team with most sixes in any year -- 146. Before this, CSK held the record at 145, that they made in 2018.\n\nAll Records Held by SRH in IPL 2024\n\nThat's not it. The highest-ever score in IPL, after 10 overs now also is under SRH's name. 167 in 9.4 overs beats the previous record SRH held, that was made in the match vs DC. In that match, the Men in Orange scored 158/4 in 10 overs. Also, in terms of most balls spared while chasing -- this record too stands broken. Chasing a modest target of 166, SRH openers wreaked havoc on the LSG bowling attack, reaching the target in a mere 9.4 overs. This dismal performance was followed by another blow for LSG captain KL Rahul, who was caught on camera receiving a public dressing down from the team owner, Sanjiv Goenka.\n\nThe foundation for SRH's victory was laid by their openers, Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head. Their explosive batting display, featuring a combined 14 sixes and 16 fours, left the LSG bowlers helpless. Sharma's unbeaten 75 off 28 balls and Head's unbeaten 89 off 30 balls sealed the win for SRH.\n\nPrior to the bowling collapse, KL Rahul himself had a forgettable outing with the bat, scoring a sluggish 29 runs off 33 balls. LSG's batting was eventually rescued by Nicholas Pooran (48* off 26 balls) and Ayush Badoni (55* off 30 balls), who helped them reach a somewhat respectable total of 165 for 4.\n\nFollowing the crushing defeat, cameras captured Sanjiv Goenka engaging in a heated conversation with KL Rahul near the LSG dugout.\n\nThe animated exchange sparked outrage on social media, with many fans criticizing the public display of reprimand. Commentators even weighed in, suggesting such conversations are best held behind closed doors.\n\nCommentator on air said: \"You always feel these conversations should always be behind closed doors. There are so many cameras that miss nothing, and KL Rahul is not going to go at press conferences and various other things and probably potentially explain what is being discussed there. He has done well here to keep his cool.\"\n\nThe video of Sanjiv Goenka's outburst went viral, attracting strong reactions from fans. Terms like \"open dressing room\", \"in bad taste\", and \"unacceptable\" dominated social media discussions. Some fans even urged KL Rahul to consider leaving the LSG franchise.\n\nThis defeat pushes LSG down to the sixth position on the points table, with their playoff qualification chances hanging by a thread. {"uri": "2024-05-349657911", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "01:59:38", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T01:59:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T01:58:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5647059082984924, "url": "https://sports.ndtv.com/ipl-2024/kl-rahul-shell-shocked-as-sunrisers-hyderabad-chase-down-166-in-58-balls-says-am-at-loss-for-words-5620413", "title": "KL Rahul Shell-Shocked As SunRisers Hyderabad Chase Down 166 In 58 Balls. Says, \"Am At Loss For Words\"", "body": "Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul on Wednesday said they were completely outplayed by the incredible power-hitting of Sunrisers Hyderabad's openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, terming it \"unreal batting.\" Head and Sharma added another chapter to their remorseless domination over bowlers while carving lightning fast unbeaten fifties to power SRH to a convincing 10-wicket win over LSG in a crucial IPL match. Chasing a modest 166, Head (89 not out, 30 balls, 8x4s, 8x6s) and Sharma (75 not out, 28 balls, 8x4s, 6x6s) toyed with LSG bowlers, finding boundaries and sixes at will to canter home in just 9.4 overs.\n\n\"I am at loss for words. We have watched that kind of batting on TV. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. It was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" he said.\n\nThis was after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch.\n\nRahul blamed the defeat on their poor display with the bat in powerplay, from which they scored just 27 runs for the loss of two wickets.\n\n\"Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum.\n\n\"Ayush (Badoni) and Nicky (Nicholas Pooran) batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well,\" he admitted.\n\n\"The boys (Head and Sharma) have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal,\" he said.\n\n\"We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs.\" Cummins was effusive in his praise for both Head and Sharma.\n\n\"He's (Head) been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional.\n\n\"(Abhishek) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them,\" he said.\n\nHead, who was adjudged player-of-the-match for his pyrotechnics, said he was really enjoying batting with Sharma as they compliment each other well.\n\n\"Lots of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay,\" he said.\n\n\"I know how hard he (Abhishek Sharma) works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out in the last couple of games.\"\n\nAbhishek thanks Lara, Yuvraj\n\nAfter his hurricane fifty, Abhishek thanked two left-handers, who had thrilled the audience during their playing days, for his success in the on-going IPL -- Yuvraj Singh and Brian Lara.\n\n\"I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,\" he said.\n\nAbhishek also thanked the SRH team management for the trust shown in him.\n\n\"I would never think of coming to such a tournament and playing at such a strike rate, but thanks to the team management.\n\n\"The message was clear from them and I backed myself.\" There was a special mention of his opening partner -- Head.\n\n\"All the credit goes to him (Head). Sharma regained his lost touch with an undefeated 75 off 28 balls.\n\nThe win lifted Hyderabad to No. 3 with 14 points and more importantly gave it a healthy net run-rate of 0.41 with two home games to go. The huge defeat has pushed Lucknow in the tight corner for the playoffs with 12 points from 12 games.\n\nEarlier, Ayush Badoni (55) and Nicholas Pooran (48) propelled Lucknow to 165-4 with a 99-run unbeaten fifth-wicket stand after Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2-12) gave away just 12 singles and dismissed the big hitters - Quinton de Kock (2) and Marcus Stoinis (3) - inside the power play.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad's Abhishek Sharma, left, celebrates his fifty runs with Travis Head during the Indian Premier League cricket match between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants in Hyderabad, India, Wednesday, May 8, 2024. (AP Photo/Mahesh Kumar A.)\n\nHead and Sharma charged against pace and spin as Yash Thakur was smashed for 47 off his 16 balls while spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Krishnappa Gowtham gave away 63 runs off their four overs.\n\nLucknow had a moment to separate the destructive pair but Thakur couldn\u00b4t hold onto a sharp one-handed catch of Sharma at short third-man when the batter was on 18 in the third over. Sharma had another escape after completing his half-century when leg-spinner Bishnoi dropped a hard two-handed return catch.\n\nEarlier, Kumar had buckled down Lucknow 27-2 in the first six overs on a tacky wicket and Rahul struggled to give the innings momentum before pulled skipper Pat Cummins to deep backward square leg and got dismissed for struggling 29 off 33 balls.\n\nPooran and Badoni countercharged in the death overs with Badoni playing some orthodox shots on square of the wicket as pace duo of T Natarajan and Cummins conceded 34 runs off the final two overs.\n\nAP cricket: https://apnews.com/hub/cricket\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad's Travis Head plays a shot during the Indian Premier League cricket match between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants in Hyderabad, India, Wednesday, May 8, 2024. {"uri": "2024-05-347726050", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "12:39:02", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T12:39:02Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T12:36:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5647059082984924, "url": "https://www.thestatesman.com/?p=1503298104", "title": "Rain likely to play a part in potential shootout between SRH & LSG", "body": "As the IPL 2024 heads into its final leg, Kolkata Knight Riders (16 points) and Rajasthan Royals (16) are the only teams who look to be sitting with any degree of comfort.\n\nThe Sunrisers Hyderabad will be looking to resurrect their topsy-turvy campaign on home soil when they take on the Lucknow Super Giants even as chances of precipitation looms large on the 57th league match of IPL 2024.\n\nAs the IPL 2024 heads into its final leg, Kolkata Knight Riders (16 points) and Rajasthan Royals (16) are the only teams who look to be sitting with any degree of comfort. The other two spots are still up for grabs, with Chennai Super Kings (12), Sunrisers Hyderabad (12) and Lucknow Super Giants (12) among the frontrunners to claim them. Delhi Capitals (10) could also find themselves in the fray if they manage to win the remaining three games.\n\nAs such, Wednesday's clash between the Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants could be a potential shootout with the winner gaining a significant edge in the race to the playoffs. However, with CSK boasting of a superior net run rate of 0.700 at this point, both SRH (-0.065) and LSG (-0.371) will have one eye on improving their NRR in case if the teams end on same points after completion of the league stages.\n\nAnd quite expectedly, both sides have endured a similar graph in terms of performances winning six of their 11 matches so far. And both sides head into Wednesday's game on the back of loses in their respective previous matches.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad are coming off a 7-wicket loss to Mumbai Indians on Monday night, their third loss in four games, primarily because their destructive batting line-up hasn't fired as a unit. Against MI, the team struggled to put up a sizeable total, which has been their strongest point this season.\n\nBarring Travis Head, who has been their stand out performer this season, the other batters have faced a recent slump. Head's opening partner Abhishek Sharma has managed to score past 30 just once in the last four games while the flamboyant Heinrich Klaasen has also been unable to strike the ball consistently and Nitish Reddy too has been patchy.\n\nInstead their bowling unit has been an improved lot with skipper Pat Cummins leading the way, along with T. Natarajan's consistency at the death. The seasoned Bhuvneshwar Kumar also seems to have regained his touch after his incisive spell helped SRH eke out a one-run win against Rajasthan Royals.\n\nLSG, on the other hand, are also coming into the game on the back of a humiliating 98-run loss to Kolkata Knight Riders, when they not only conceded the first-ever 200 plus score at the Ekana Stadium but also folded their innings at 137.\n\nWhile Saturday's match turned out a collective failure of the side, the onus will now be again on skipper KL Rahul to marshal his troops to get the 5th-ranked side out of the mid-table logjam. For that, Rahul will be expected to make amends in his batting, with a slightly more aggressive intent. His new opening partner Arshin Kulkarni has failed to deliver in his first two games, and it remains to be seen whether the LSG management goes back to their tested pair of Rahul and seasoned South African Quinton de Kock.\n\nThe middle order comprising the likes of Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran and Deepak Hooda will be expected to add meat to their totals, something which they failed against KKR. Ayush Badoni has had a subdued run in this IPL and he would be keen to shrug off the rustiness.\n\nMore than their batting, LSG's struggles with the ball have compounded after the loss of their express pacer Mayank Yadav, who has been ruled out of the IPL and left-arm pacer Mohsin Khan also picked up an injury. We've watched that batting on TV but that was unreal,\" Lucknow skipper KL Rahul said of the bludgeoning by the Hyderabad openers.\n\n\"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting.\"\n\nAustralia's Head attacked with a flurry of fours and sixes as he reached his fifty in 16 balls and went past 500 runs this season.\n\nHead is now third in the batting chart behind Virat Kohli (542) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (541) with his fourth half-century -- he also has a ton -- in this edition.\n\nHe took on the spinners with aplomb and said the skill will be invaluable on the slow pitches in the West Indies during the T20 World Cup in June.\n\n\"Something I have been working on with spin, something I have been working hard on. It will be a big part in the Caribbean,\" said man of the match Head.\n\n\"Nice to get 360 (degrees) and get to the parts of the ground I have not been to. We want to maximise the powerplay. It is not going to work every time but we want to go for it.\"\n\n'Incredible'\n\nThe 30-year-old Head lauded his younger partner Abhishek, 23, and said: \"His spin game is something else. We complement each other so well.\"\n\nAbhishek joined the charge as he got to his fifty in 19 balls after the pair took Hyderabad to 107 in the first six overs of powerplay, when only two fielders are allowed outside the inner circle.\n\nHyderabad, who won the IPL in 2016 under David Warner, registered their seventh win in 12 matches to hand a perfect gift to birthday boy and captain Pat Cummins, who turned 31 on Wednesday.\n\nAbhishek hit the winning six as Hyderabad moved to third in the 10-team table with 14 points. Lucknow stay sixth after the bruising loss.\n\nTop four teams will make the play-offs with the final on May 26 in Chennai.\n\nCummins said Head's unconventional hitting does not \"surprise\" him anymore and praised Abhishek for being \"an incredible player of spin\" and pace.\n\nSeam bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar set up victory with impressive bowling figures of 2-12 in his four overs to restrict Lucknow to 165-4 after they elected to bat first.\n\nLucknow lost regular wickets until Nicholas Pooran, who hit 48, and Ayush Badoni, who smashed 55, put on an unbeaten stand of 99 in 52 balls to boost the team total.\n\nBut the score proved too little against a team which posted record totals of 277 and 287 in this high-scoring edition of the T20 tournament.", "source": {"uri": Kolkata Knight Riders and the Rajasthan Royals occupy the top two spots in the points table and have more or less secured their playoff qualification.\n\nChennai Super Kings, Sunrisers Hyderabad, and the Lucknow Super Giants occupy the next three spots in the points table with six wins and five losses in the 11 games they have played so far. CSK have the best net run rate among these three teams but they all need to keep winning to give themselves the best chance of qualifying for the playoffs.\n\nComing to the qualification scenario for the Sunrisers and the Super Giants, both teams have almost an equal chance of making it through to the playoffs. Their fate is in their own hands and if they win at least two of their remaining three matches, their chances of playoff qualification will increase drastically.\n\nRecent form of SRH and LSG\n\nThe Sunrisers Hyderabad have displayed an ultra-attacking batting approach this season, racking up massive scores of 287, 277, and 266. The opposition bowling attacks were taken to the cleaners by the opening duo of Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head.\n\nAfter blistering starts, SRH got momentum from Heinrich Klaasen and Nitish Kumar Reddy in the middle overs which helped them post massive totals.\n\nHowever, the scenario has changed in the last few games. Sunrisers have only managed to win one of their last four games which has pushed them to a corner where they need to win at least two of their last three games to go through to the playoffs.\n\nThe batting line-up has failed to deliver as a unit in the last few games which has resulted in SRH losing their way a bit. Had Pat Cummins and Bhuvneshwar Kumar not got them out of jail against the Rajasthan Royals, things would have been worse for the Sunrisers. They lost their previous game against the Mumbai Indians by seven wickets.\n\nThe batting department was restricted to a below-par score which was chased down by MI on the back of a splendid century from Suryakumar Yadav.\n\nSRH will definitely look to get back to winning ways in the coming matches but the batters need to rise to the occasion and help them post massive scores which can provide a cushion for their bowlers.\n\nComing to the Lucknow Super Giants, they are currently 5th in the points table but have an inferior net run rate when compared to Sunrisers. Their form has been indifferent to say the least.\n\nTheir performance during the 98-run loss against the Kolkata Knight Riders will surely raise a few eyebrows within the team management and the players.\n\nThe Ekana Stadium has become a fortress for LSG where they have unleashed their spinners to dismantle the opposition. However, it was totally different against a resurgent KKR batting line-up and the whole bowling cartel was dispatched to all corners of the park. A score of 235 was a massive one for a stadium like Ekana and it was evident from LSG's performance with the bat.\n\nLucknow started off their campaign with a defeat against the Rajasthan Royals. They got their campaign back on track with three consecutive wins against Punjab Kings, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, and the Gujarat Titans.\n\nA couple of defeats against Delhi and KKR followed before they again returned to winning ways against the Chennai Super Kings. They won both their matches against the yellow army before losing against the Rajasthan Royals. The winning team will solidify their position in the points table and inch closer to the playoffs berth.\n\nLucknow will end their campaign with matches against the Delhi Capitals and the Mumbai Indians. The Capitals will try to keep their hopes alive and the only way that can happen is to keep winning. LSG can't afford a slip up at this stage of the tournament. They will play their final group game against the Mumbai Indians on May 17.\n\nHyderabad will be playing all their remaining three games in Hyderabad where they put up massive scores. The pitch has looked a belter and SRH will be hoping that the batting unit returns to their destructive best. After their clash against LSG, SRH will be up against the Gujarat Titans and the Punjab Kings in their final two games on May 16 and 19, respectively.\n\nWho has a better chance of qualifying through the IPL playoffs?\n\nIn a tournament where there are no easy games, it's very difficult to predict which team has a better chance of going through to the playoffs. With SRH and LSG slated to lock horns against each other on May 8, the result of this contest might well decide which team will go through to the playoffs.\n\nHyderabad will have the advantage as they will be playing in front of their home crowd and on a surface where they have plundered the opposition's bowling attacks.\n\nLucknow have to come prepared for the onslaught but the home advantage certainly gives the edge to Hyderabad. {"uri": "8117847962", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:52:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:52:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:51:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5607843399047852, "url": "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-2024-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-power-sunrisers-hyderabad-to-commanding-10-wicket-win-over-lucknow-super-giants/articleshow/109957957.cms", "title": "IPL 2024: Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma power Sunrisers Hyderabad to commanding 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants | Cricket News - Times of India", "body": "NEW DELHI: Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's unreal assault, featuring blistering half-centuries, propelled Sunrisers Hyderabad to the fastest chase of a 160-plus target en route their convincing 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL on Wednesday.\n\nPursuing a relatively modest target of 166, Head (89 not out, 30 balls, 8x4, 8x6) and Sharma (75 not out, 28 balls, 8x4, 6x6) made a mockery of the LSG bowling attack, effortlessly finding the fence and clearing the ropes at will, cruising to victory in a mere 9.4 overs.\n\nThe comprehensive win catapulted SRH to the third spot on the points table with 14 points from 12 matches, while LSG find themselves in a precarious position at sixth place, having accumulated 12 points from an equal number of games.\n\nThe result also meant that five-time champions Mumbai Indians, currently ninth with eight points from 12 matches, are out of the play-off race.\n\nThe dance of destruction by Head and Sharma even left the legendary Sachin Tendulkar gushing.\n\n\"A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300,\" Tendulkar wrote in his X account.\n\nThe Head and Sharma show came after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before losing the plot a bit.\n\nAyush Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Nicholas Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch.\n\nAs It Happened\n\nBut the Head and Sharma took any hint of competition out of the match once they bludgeoned 107 runs in the Power Play.\n\nIt was an awesome hitting display from the Indo-Australian pair as they didn't spare a single LSG bowler, clobbering them to all parts of the ground.\n\nLSG's decision to start with Krishnappa Gowtham also backfired badly as both Head and Sharma, who are really good against spin, dismantled the off-spinner.\n\nSuch was the brutal assault that the likes Yash Dayal, Ravi Bishnoi and Naveen-ul-Haq were also taken to the cleaners, raining sixes and fours.\n\nEarlier, LSG were struggling at 27 for 2 at the end of the powerplay after opting to bat.\n\nThe visitors lost Quinton de Kock, who replaced an injured Mohsin Khan, early, caught brilliantly by Nitish Kumar Reddy at deep backward square-leg off Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) in the third over.\n\nBhuvneshwar struck again in the fifth over, dismissing the dangerous Marcus Stoinis but the credit for the dismissal should go to young Sanvir Singh, who took a stunning diving catch just inches from the ground at mid-on.\n\nThe pitch also didn't help LSG's cause as the ball was coming on to the bat a bit slow, as their batters found it difficult to find the timing.\n\nWhile skipper KL Rahul (29) held one end up, Krunal Pandya (24) took it on himself to up the ante.\n\nKrunal pummelled Jaydev Unadkat for a six over long-on and then hit the bowler straight over his head for another maximum to accumulate 15 runs in the eighth over.\n\nRahul hit the first boundary of LSG innings in the 10th over, slamming SRH skipper Pat Cummins over mid-off.\n\nBut Rahul never looked at his usual best as he struggled to get his timing and finally departed in search of quick runs, caught by T Natarajan at deep backward square leg in the final delivery of the same over.\n\nSRH were brilliant on the field as Cummins' direct throw from mid-on sent Krunal packing soon when the batter went for a quick single.\n\nBadoni pressed the feet on the accelerator soon with three boundaries of left-arm pacer Natarajan's 14th over which yielded 17 runs.\n\nThe Lucknow side finally got going as Pooran and Badoni struck a six and a four to accumulate 12 runs off the 15th over bowled by leg-spinner Vijayakanth Viyaskanth.\n\nThey showed intent from the word go and didn't hesitate to play their strokes when the opportunity was presented to them.\n\nIt was brilliant batting from Badoni as he swept and cut Natarajan for two consecutive boundaries in the 17th over.\n\nBadoni displayed some cheeky shots as the right-hander notched up his fifty in 28 balls.\n\n(With inputs from PTI)\n\nThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting Notably, after opting to bat first, LSG were rocked by a couple of strikes by Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) who got rid of Quinton de Kock (2 off 5) and Marcus Stoinis (3 off 5) inside the powerplay to leave Lucknow reeling at 27/2 after six overs.\n\nAfter the early blows, captain KL Rahul got under his shell and tried to bide his time at the crease but was eventually dismissed for 29 (33) in the tenth over by Pat Cummins. However, the approach didn't go down well with Hayden, who called them out for not showing enough intent.\n\n\"I have to call them (LSG) out. This is not a five runs per over wicket. Somebody needed to show intent. They had one of the slowest power plays. That took the innings nowhere. When the opposition team has Travis Head and Heinrich Klaasen, your intention should be to go at 10s and over. 160-170 will never be enough,\" Hayden said on commentary.\n\nAfter losing their captain, LSG were further rocked by the run-out dismissal of Krunal Pandya (24 off 21) which left them further reeling at 66/4 after 11.2 overs. Seeing their team in trouble, Nicholas Pooran (48* off 26) and Ayush Badoni (55* off 30) bailed their team out of trouble with an unbeaten 99-run standoff 52 balls to get them to a total of 165/4 in 20 overs.\n\nHowever, the total didn't prove to be enough for SRH as they made a complete mockery of their score with their opening duo Abhishek Sharma (75* off 28) and Travis Head (89* off 30) chasing it down in just 9.4 overs. The LSG bowling was taken to the cleaners by the aggressive opening duo, who shattered the record for the highest total chased within the first ten overs in T20 cricket.\n\nFollowing the game, LSG owner Sanjeev Goenka was seen having a heated chat with captain KL Rahul as he openly expressed his discontentment with his team's shambolic loss. Meanwhile, LSG are now placed sixth in the points table with 12 points from as many games and will be desperate to win their remaining two fixtures to keep their hopes of playoff qualification In what turned out to be the perfect birthday gift for Head's teammate and Test captain Pat Cumminsthe SRH opener scored an outrageous 89 not out off just 30 balls to seal a crushing win over Lucknow Super Giants that left the cricket world stunned.\n\nHead hit eight sixes and eight fours in the extraordinary innings, while his opening partner Abhishek Sharma dismissed at the other end with an equally eye-catching 75 not out off 28 balls. The opening pair's fireworks saw the Sunrisers chase down Lucknow Super Giants' 4-165, playing less than half of their allotted 20 overs.\n\nThe staggering unbeaten opening stand of 167 runs came off just 9.4 overs at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad, giving SRH victory with 62 balls to spare, which is the largest margin for a chase of over 150 runs in history of the IPL. SRH's total of 167 runs is also the highest score by any team at the end of the tenth in the history of Men's T20.\n\nThe resounding victory was the perfect 31st birthday present for Cummins and his Sunrisers side, cementing their place at third on the ladder and boosting their play-off hopes. Defeated Lucknow skipper KL Rahul could only marvel at Head and Sharma's masterclass after the match and admitted that they had witnessed something quite incredible. I'm out of words. We saw that batting on TV but it was unreal, the Lucknow skipper said about the Hyderabad openers. Everything hit the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they worked really hard on their six-hitting.\n\nRELATED:\n\nHead's latest masterclass saw him move to third place on the IPL points table this season with a whopping 533 runs at an average of 53.30 and a strike-rate of 201.89. And Cummins echoed the thoughts of fans around the world after marveling at his Australian teammate's incredible ball-striking ability. \"It certainly doesn't surprise me anymore,\" Cummins said of Head. \"He's been like that over the years. He may not be super conventional, but he's got a good eye, he's hitting the middle of the bat a lot and he's having a great tournament.\"\n\nIn an ominous sign of his form ahead of next month's T20 World Cup in the US and Caribbean, Head scored 22 off Krishnappa Gowtham's second over and then increased it in the fifth over after hitting Naveen-ul-Haq bowled out for 24 runs in his six. deliveries. The audacious display of big strokes saw Head race past his half-century in just sixteen balls.\n\n\"A lot of fun,\" said a smiling Head of his stroke in the game. \"The last twelve months that I've been back with the Australian team, they wanted me to play like that and I'm not trying to change anything, I'm just trying to maximize that power play. It's not always going to work but I'm going to try to be as consistent as possible to give myself the best opportunities and hopefully do my bit for the team.\"\n\nSunrisers are now in a good position to make the play-offs with Hyderabad sitting at the third spot with 14 points and their net run-rate getting a serious boost from the huge win. Ayush Badoni (55 off 30) and Nicholas Pooran (48 off 26) were the only two batters to have a decent day with the bat for LSG.\n\nSRH chased down LSG's modest total of 165/4 in just 9.4 overs without losing a wicket. The SRH openers, Travis Head (89* off 30) and Abhishek Sharma (75* off 28) were in brilliant form, scoring their second-fastest fifties of the season to power their team to a powerful victory.\n\nAlso read: I and Travis Head have become good friends off the pitch, have started spending more time: Abhishek Sharma\n\nHayden, who was on commentary duty for the match, was visibly frustrated with LSG's approach, especially after they won the toss and elected to bat first. Despite losing just four wickets, LSG's batters failed to capitalize on the good batting conditions, scoring at a slow pace throughout their innings.\n\n\"I have to call them out. This is not a 5 runs per over wicket. Somebody needed to show intent. They had one of the slowest powerplays. That took the innings nowhere,\" Hayden said in a commentary.\n\nAlso read: Yuvraj Singh peps up Abhishek Sharma further after yet another blistering knock\n\nThe Australian legend emphasized that against a formidable batting line-up like SRH's, LSG's total was well below par, and their poor show with the bat ultimately cost them the match.\n\n\"When the opposition team has Travis Head, Heinrich Klaasen, your intention should be to go at 10s and over. 160-170 will never be enough Hayden added.\n\nSRH is currently placed at No. 3 position on the points table, with seven wins in 12 games. {"uri": "2024-05-349386910", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:30:35", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:30:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:30:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://www.news18.com/sports/head-and-sharmas-electrifying-opening-stand-earns-hyderabad-10-wicket-win-over-lucknow-8883284.html", "title": "Head And Sharma's Electrifying Opening Stand Earns Hyderabad 10-wicket Win Over Lucknow", "body": "The opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma shared a massive 167run stand as Sunrisers Hyderabad required just 58 balls to rout Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets in the Indian Premier League on Wednesday.\n\nHYDERABAD, India: The opening pair of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma shared a massive 167-run stand as Sunrisers Hyderabad required just 58 balls to rout Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets in the Indian Premier League on Wednesday.\n\nHead and Sharma cranked 16 fours and 14 sixes in an extraordinary display of power-hitting in the first-ever IPL game that saw so many runs being scored inside the first 10 overs.\n\nHead has been scoring consistently for the batting power-house of Hyderabad this season and raced to his half-century off 16 balls before he eventually finished on an unbeaten 89 off 30 balls.\n\nSharma followed the Australian left-hander soon when he reached his 50 off 19 balls as they raced to century-stand inside the batting power play. Sharma regained his lost touch with an undefeated 75 off 28 balls.\n\nThe win lifted Hyderabad to No. 3 with 14 points and more importantly gave it a healthy net run-rate of 0.41 with two home games to go. The huge defeat has pushed Lucknow in the tight corner for the playoffs with 12 points from 12 games.\n\nEarlier, Ayush Badoni (55) and Nicholas Pooran (48) propelled Lucknow to 165-4 with a 99-run unbeaten fifth-wicket stand after Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2-12) gave away just 12 singles and dismissed the big hitters -- Quinton de Kock (2) and Marcus Stoinis (3) -- inside the power play.\n\nHead and Sharma charged against pace and spin as Yash Thakur was smashed for 47 off his 16 balls while spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Krishnappa Gowtham gave away 63 runs off their four overs.\n\nLucknow had a moment to separate the destructive pair but Thakur couldn't hold onto a sharp one-handed catch of Sharma at short third-man when the batter was on 18 in the third over. Sharma had another escape after completing his half-century when leg-spinner Bishnoi dropped a hard two-handed return catch.\n\nEarlier, Kumar had buckled down Lucknow 27-2 in the first six overs on a tacky wicket and Rahul struggled to give the innings momentum before pulled skipper Pat Cummins to deep backward square leg and got dismissed for struggling 29 off 33 balls.\n\nPooran and Badoni countercharged in the death overs with Badoni playing some orthodox shots on square of the wicket as pace duo of T Natarajan and Cummins conceded 34 runs off the final two overs.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "2024-05-349379757", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:21:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:21:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:17:34Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/ipl/travis-head-abhishek-sharma-srh-vs-lsg-run-chase-9316909/", "title": "IPL 2024: SRH Head & shoulders above LSG as Aussie and Abhishek Sharma make mockery of chase", "body": "The chase, on what was considered a slow surface, started in stark contrast to the LSG innings. Though the ball was skidding on better than in the first innings, when pace was taken off, it was sticking in the pitch. However, it made no difference to the SRH approach. Unlike Rahul and Quinton de Kock, who tried to play the orthodox way, Head and Abhishek looked to send every ball into the stands, which they almost did in the Powerplay which yielded 107 runs.\n\nThis is the second time this season Sunrisers have gone past 100 in the Powerplay. There was no respite no matter what was bowled at them as everything seemed destined for the stands.\n\nHead was the more dynamic at the crease, moving away at times or going further back inside it. One of his best shots of the night came when he went on the backfoot and clobbered Ravi Bishnoi into the stands over long-off.\n\nOn the other hand, Abhishek stood still at the crease and hit through the line, depositing balls into the stands. Head got to his half-century in 16 balls while his opening partner got there in 19.\n\nAs had been the case many times before this season, the bowling side was shell-shocked and short of ideas. The partnership not only ensured the win but also made sure SRH's net run rate (+0.406 after the game) shot up, taking them from the mid-table jam and into third position.\n\nLSG, who suffered a heavy defeat against Kolkata Knight Riders, endured more damage to their net run rate (-0.769 after Wednesday's game).\n\nBhuvneshwar starts well before Badoni blitz\n\nIt was the slowest surface in Hyderabad so far this season. The ball was taking an age to reach the batsmen. As a result, the Lucknow Super Giants top order struggled to score quickly.\n\nLSG batters hit only three sixes and one boundary in the first 10 overs, indicative of the slowness of the surface. Bhuvneshwar Kumar, after a slow start to the season, seems to have found his rhythm and looks close to his best. Despite there being minimal swing on offer, the 34-year-old bowled stump-to-stump and kept hitting the good length area.\n\nBhuvneshwar's discipline, accompanied by some electric fielding in the initial overs, contributed to LSG scoring their lowest Powerplay total of the season (27/2). First, it was Nitish Kumar Reddy who took a brilliant catch on the boundary to dismiss De Kock before Sanvir Singh at mid-on dived forward to take a low catch to dismiss dangerman Marcus Stoinis.\n\nHowever, young Ayush Badoni played a street-smart innings. He kept his weight on the backfoot throughout his knock, and let the ball come to him instead of trying to muscle it. With sublime wristwork, he played some cheeky shots square of the wicket to get boundaries.\n\nBadoni found an excellent ally in Nicholas Pooran, who played his part in their 99-run partnership. Though the wicket did not have enough pace to work with, the left-hander is blessed with one of the quickest bat-swings in world cricket which can overcome the slowness of the surface and slower balls. Both combined to take LSG to 165, a score that looked beyond them after the first 10 overs of the innings and felt like a fighting total.\n\nThe Badoni-Pooran partnership put SRH pacers, other than Bhuvneshwar, to the sword. Sri Lankan leg-spinner Vijayakanth Viyashkanth made an impressive debut. With Mayank Markande falling out of favour the performance from the 22-year-old is a confidence-booster for SRH as it provides an attacking option in the middle overs as surfaces would grip as the mercury rises.\n\nBrief scores: Lucknow Super Giants 165/4 in 20 overs (Ayush Badoni 55 not out, Nicholas Pooran 48; Bhuvneshwar Kumar 2/12) lost to Sunrisers Hyderabad 167 for no loss in 9.4 overs {"uri": "2024-05-349792989", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:38:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:38:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T01:10:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://www.telegraphindia.com/sports/cricket/travis-head-abhishek-sharma-lead-onslaught-as-sunrisers-hyderabad-crush-lucknow-super-giants/cid/2018592", "title": "Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma lead onslaught as Sunrisers crush Super Giants", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad's Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma celebrate after their thumping victory against Lucknow Super Giants in Hyderabad on Wednesday. PTI\n\nAt the end of Powerplay, Lucknow Super Giants were 27/2. Sunrisers Hyderabad, in pursuit of 166, were 107 without loss after six overs at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wedneday.\n\nTravis Head (89 not out off 30 balls) and his opening partner Abhishek Sharma (75 not out off 28 balls) had already done more than three-fourth of the job for the Sunrisers as they eventually crushed the Super Giants by 10 wickets with a good 10.2 overs remaining. The game didn't even last three hours, courtesy Head and Sharma's onslaught which helped their team overhaul Lucknow's 165/4 in barely 45 minutes.\n\nSuch a commanding win propelled the Sunrisers to third in the points table alongside boosting their net run rate, while it also brought about the end of Mumbai Indians' campaign in this IPL. For MI to keep their playoffs hopes alive, Lucknow had to beat the Sunrisers.\n\nOn a slow surface, it was a struggle for the Lucknow batsmen early on as they were languishing at 66/4 in the 12 th over before Ayush Badoni's unbeaten 55 off 30 balls and Nicholas Pooran's 48 not out off 26 balls pushed the visitors past the 160-mark. But even though dew didn't seem to be a factor, the Hyderabad pitch certainly looked easier for batting as the game progressed, which Lucknow too found out during their defence of the total.\n\nIn the run chase, Head, in the form of his life at present, was on the ball right away, cashing in on anything had even a little bit of width and room. Sharma, too, did the same, making sure not to let go of even one loose ball.\n\nIn other words, it was just insane hitting by the Sunrisers openers as it seemed they were out there at a six-hitting practice session facing net bowlers. With due respect to the Lucknow bowlers, they were mediocre to say the least and often fed Head and Sharma with awfully poor deliveries.\n\nEarlier, Badoni produced an innings of quality improvisation that was pivotal in lifting the Super Giants total. At ease against both quicks and spinners, Badoni found the boundaries on both sides of the wicket as his unbroken 99-run stand with Pooran was massive in taking the Super Giants to a total that looked challenging, till the Sunrisers' run chase began.\n\nLucknow's turnaround began from the 14th over when Badoni's innovative shots earned 17 runs off T. Natarajan's over.\n\nThe Sunrisers, meanwhile, had given a debut to the Jaffna-based leg-spinner Vijayakanth Viyaskanth -- first in the IPL from Sri Lanka's northern tip, which used to be the epicentre of the civil war in the country. The 22-year-old finished wicketless, but was expensive only in his final over, not giving away much in his first three.\n\nBut at the end of the day, what mattered for the Sunrisers was their opening duo's amazing performance which came as an ideal birthday present to skipper Pat Cummins, who turned 31 on Wednesday.\n\nFor Head though, it was good fun batting with Sharma. \"It was a lot of fun. Abhi and I have had good partnerships. It was nice to get it done and yeah, very, very good fun. I've been concentrating hard and trying to get into good positions,\" Head said.\n\nNot just against pacers, but even against spinners, Head has been looking quite intimidating, dating back to last year's ODI World Cup.\n\nWith just a few weeks left for the T20 World Cup in the Caribbean and the United States, where spin is likely to play an important role, Head's rhythm bodes really well for {"uri": "8117766226", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "16:49:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T16:49:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T16:48:23Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5529412031173706, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/firstcricket/sports-news/ipl-2024-1000-sixes-fewest-balls-srh-vs-lsg-13768780.html", "title": "IPL 2024 witnesses 1000 sixes in fewest balls, milestone achieved during SRH vs LSG game", "body": "IPL 2024 also witnessed the tournament take the fewest balls to achieve 1000 sixes in a single edition. It\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s taken just 13,079 balls to get to 1000 maximums in IPL 2024. read more\n\nFor only the third time in the history of the Indian Premier League (IPL), 1000 sixes have been hit across a single season. The feat was achieved during an IPL 2024 match between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The 100th six of this year\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s IPL came when LSG\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s Krunal Pandya smashed a short ball from Jaydev Unadkat towards the long-on fence in the eighth over of the contest.\n\nIPL 2024 also witnessed the tournament take the fewest balls to achieve 1000 sixes in a single edition. It\u00e2\u20ac\u2122s taken just 13,079 balls to get to 1000 maximums in IPL 2024. It had taken 15,390 balls to complete 1000 sixes in IPL 2023, whereas the same milestone was achieved in 16,269 balls in IPL 2022.\n\nThis season has witnessed teams posting scores of 200 and even 250-plus consistently. Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) broke the record for the highest all-time team total in IPL not once, but twice this year. On 27 March, SRH had posted 277/3 against Mumbai Indians (MI) on the back of fifties from Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma and Heinrich Klaasen, only to break their record just a few weeks later when they registered 287/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on 15 April.\n\nOn Wednesday, LSG, after opting to bat posted 165/4 on the back of knocks from Nicholas Pooran (48*) and Ayush Badoni (55*). The two put on an unbeaten 99-run stand for the fifth wicket.\n\nSRH were off to an explosive start in their reply, with Abhishek Sharma (46*) and Travis Head (58*) taking them to 107/0 in six overs, However, SRH's win meant that they went to 14 points on the table. With DC and LSG set to face on May 14, one of the two would also get 14 points. {"uri": "8118443291", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:20:45", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:20:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T04:20:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5490196347236633, "url": "https://liveindia.tv/we-didnt-have-an-answer-to-srhs-incredible-hitting-lsg-consultant-adam-voges/", "title": "We didn't have an answer to SRH's incredible hitting: Adam Voges", "body": "In a post-match reaction that summed up the sentiment of disbelief, Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) consultant Adam Voges could hardly find words to describe the battering his team received from Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in a staggering IPL 2024 encounter. SRH dominated from the outset, achieving the fastest 10-over score in T20 history by chasing down a target of 166 in just 9.4 overs, securing a 10-wicket victory.\n\nThe match featured extraordinary performances from SRH's Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, who blasted their way to fifties in 16 and 19 balls, respectively, setting a record for the highest powerplay score in T20 cricket. Voges acknowledged the sheer scale of SRH's dominance, saying, \"I think we all are in awe a little bit of what we've just seen. I think sometimes you've gotta tip your hat and say well played to the opposition. That was incredible batting and hitting. We clearly didn't have an answer.\"\n\nWhile SRH's batsmen stole the show, Voges reflected on LSG's inability to exert similar pressure, stating, \"I haven't spoken to the guys yet about whether there was a difference in terms of the innings but clearly our powerplay compared to Sunrisers was at the two extremes. We were put under immense pressure with the ball right from the start. We weren't able to apply that same pressure with the bat, to begin with.\"\n\nDespite the challenging game, Voges highlighted a positive aspect for LSG: the partnership between Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran, who managed a 99-run stand that briefly gave LSG hope of a competitive total. \"I thought our backend of the innings was really good. Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran's partnership got us, it was probably still under par total but it gave us a fighting chance at least. But that obviously was clearly not enough,\" he admitted.\n\nThe defeat, LSG's sixth of the season, not only affected their standings, dropping them below Delhi Capitals, but also severely impacted {"uri": "2024-05-349777208", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:17:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:17:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T23:20:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5490196347236633, "url": "https://au.sports.yahoo.com/travis-head-stuns-cricket-world-in-record-ipl-drama-amid-awesome-pat-cummins-detail-232002151.html", "title": "'Lost for words': Cricket world stunned by Travis Head act in record drama", "body": "Travis Head has sent a stunning warning to his cricket rivals ahead of the T20 World Cup, with an astonishing batting display for Sunrisers Hyderabad in the Indian Premier League. In what proved to be the perfect birthday present for Head's teammate and Test captain Pat Cummins, the SRH opener belted an outrageous 89 not out off just 30 balls to set up a crushing win over Lucknow Super Giants that left the cricket world gobsmacked.\n\nHead bludgeoned eight sixes and eight fours in the extraordinary innings, with his opening partner Abhishek Sharma teeing off at the other end with an equally eye-catching 75 not out off 28 balls. The opening pair's pyrotechnics saw the Sunrisers chase down Lucknow Super Giants' 4-165 with less than half of their allotted 20 overs played.\n\nThe staggering unbeaten 167-run opening stand came off just 9.4 overs at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, clinching the win for SRH with 62 balls still remaining, which is the biggest margin for a 150+ run chase in IPL history. SRH's 167-run total is also the highest score by any team by the end of the tenth over in men's T20 history.\n\nThe resounding win was the perfect 31st birthday present for Cummins and his Sunrisers side, cementing their spot in third on the ladder and strengthening their playoff hopes. Beaten Lucknow skipper KL Rahul could only marvel at the masterclass from Head and Sharma after the match, admitting they had witnessed something quite unbelievable. \"I'm lost for words. We've watched that batting on TV but that was unreal,\" the Lucknow skipper said of the Hyderabad openers. \"Everything was hitting the middle of the bat, kudos to their skill, they've worked very hard on their six-hitting.\"\n\nRELATED:\n\nCricket world loses it as Travis Head stars in record scenes\n\nHead's latest masterclass saw him move into third on the run-scoring charts in the IPL this season with a whopping 533 runs at an average of 53.30 and a strike-rate of 201.89. And Cummins echoed the thoughts of fans around the world after marvelling at his Aussie teammate's incredible ball-striking ability. \"It certainly doesn't surprise me any more,\" Cummins said about Head. \"He's been like this for the last few years. He might not be super-conventional but he's got a great eye, hits the middle of the bat a lot and he's having a wonderful tournament.\"\n\nTravis Head on fire ahead of T20 World Cup\n\nIn an ominous sign of his form ahead of next month's T20 World Cup in the USA and Caribbean, Head cracked 22 off Krishnappa Gowtham's second over and then stepped it up in the fifth over after dispatching Naveen-ul-Haq for 24 runs off his six deliveries. The brutal display of big-hitting saw Head race past his half-century in just 16 balls.\n\n\"Very, very good fun,\" a smiling Head said about his batting the game. \"The last 12 months being back in the Australian team, that's how they've wanted me to play and I'm not trying to change anything, just trying to maximise that powerplay. It's not going to work all the time but I'm going to try to be as consistent as I can, give myself the best opportunity and hopefully do my part for the team.\"\n\nSunrisers are now in a good position to make the playoffs, with Hyderabad third in the table on 14 points and with their net run-rate enjoying a serious boost from the massive win. Photograph: BCCI\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad will be eager to move on from their underwhelming batting display when they host Lucknow Super Giants in a crucial Indian Premier League match in Hyderabad on Wednesday.\n\nBoth teams are locked in at 12 points from 11 games with SRH making the top four cut based on a slightly superior net run rate of -0.065 compared to LSG's -0.371.\n\nThe Sunrisers find themselves in a fierce competition for the top four spot with Kolkata Knight Riders (16), Rajasthan Royals (16) and Chennai Super Kings (12) stationed above them on the points table.\n\nThe winner of the duel will take a leap in the playoff race.\n\nThe Pat Cummins-led side has ample talent but has been unable to hold on to a winning run recently. Sunrisers have lost three of their last four matches, mainly because their destructive batting line-up hasn't delivered.\n\nIn their last match against Mumbai Indians, which they lost by seven wickets, they failed to put up a good target on the board, which has been their strong suit this season.\n\nBarring Travis Head, who has been their stand out performer, the other batters in the side have faced a recent slump.\n\nAfter displaying his power-hitting ability, young opener Abhishek Sharma has breached the 30-run mark just once in the last four games.\n\nAnd while SRH head coach Daniel Vettori has conceded that the openers are not expected to do the job all the time, the middle order needs to step up.\n\nThe flamboyant Heinrich Klaasen has also been unable to strike the ball consistently and Nitish Reddy too has been patchy.\n\nThe bowlers have fared better compared to their batting counterparts.\n\nT Natarajan has been consistent with the ball while seasoned seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar also seems to have found his mojo after his incisive spell helped SRH eke out a one-run win against RR.\n\nIMAGE: Lucknow Super Giants captain K L Rahul with head coach Justin Langer. Photograph: BCCI\n\nLSG, on the other hand, have to get over their overall lacklustre display against Kolkata Knight Riders, when they not only conceded the first-ever 200 plus score at the Ekana Stadium but also folded their innings at 137.\n\nIt was a day when skipper KL Rahul failed to anchor the innings while the likes of Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran were unable to get the big shots when needed.\n\nAyush Badoni has had a subdued run in this IPL and the uncapped Indian player would be keen to shrug off the rustiness.\n\nLSG's struggles with the ball have been majorly due to the lack of firepower in their pace-bowling department.\n\nWith tearaway pacer Mayank Yadav ruled out of the IPL and left-arm pacer Mohsin Khan also picking up an injury, the onus will be on Afghan quick Naveen-ul-Haq, young Yash Thakur, Stoinis and spinners Krunal Pandya and Ravi Bishnoi to deliver.\n\nSquads:\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad: Abhishek Sharma, Travis Head, Heinrich Klaasen (wk), Aiden Markram, Quinton de Kock, KL Rahul (c & wk), Deepak Hooda, Ayush Badoni, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran (wk), Krunal Pandya, Ravi Bishnoi, Mohsin Khan, Shamar Joseph, Yash Thakur, Manimaran Siddharth, Prerak {"uri": "2024-05-348621398", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "07:16:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T07:16:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T07:06:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5490196347236633, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/news-they-start-like-bullet-train-aakash-chopra-picks-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-among-srh-players-focus-ipl-2024-clash-vs-lsg", "title": "\"They start like a bullet train\" - Aakash Chopra picks Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma among SRH players in focus in IPL 2024 clash vs LSG", "body": "Aakash Chopra has noted that SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) openers Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma have almost invariably given them explosive starts in IPL 2024. Head wasn't a part of SRH's playing XI in their season opener against the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) but has batted at the top of the order since making his debut for the franchise in their second game.\n\nSRH will face the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Hyderabad on Wednesday, May 8. With 12 points from 11 games, the hosts are placed fourth on the points table and a win against LSG will help them leapfrog the Chennai Super Kings (CSK) into third position.\n\nIn a video shared on his YouTube channel, Chopra chose Head and Abhishek as the first two SunRisers Hyderabad players to watch out for in Wednesday's game.\n\n\"If this team has to win, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma need to play for long and explosively because they do two things. One is they score runs and secondly, they attack you hard mentally. It just demotivates you the way they start. They start like a bullet train,\" he reasoned (5:20).\n\nThe former India opener noted that Head has shown different facets of his game in IPL 2024.\n\n\"Travis Head needs to be talked about first because he is in that kind of form. We have seen him playing differently a few times. He played slightly cautiously in the last match at home against Rajasthan because the pitch was like that. He started scratchily in the last match as well but eventually got close to his fifty,\" Chopra observed.\n\nWhile acknowledging that Abhishek fell cheaply in SRH's previous game, Chopra expects the Indian youngster to deliver the goods against LSG.\n\n\"Travis Head will once again be my guy in focus because you expect runs from him. When the business end of the tournament has come, Hyderabad is entrusted to you. The second player I am picking is Abhishek Sharma. He has batted well. He didn't score runs in the last match. I expect him to play well,\" he said.\n\nWith 444 runs at a strike rate of 189.74 in 10 innings, Head is SRH's highest run-scorer in IPL 2024. Abhishek is the franchise's third-highest run-getter this season, with his 326 runs in 11 innings coming at a strike rate of 195.20.\n\n\"I stand corrected\" - Aakash Chopra praises SRH skipper Pat Cummins for proving him wrong\n\nAakash Chopra picked Pat Cummins as the third SunRisers Hyderabad player in focus against the Lucknow Super Giants. He admitted that the Australian Test and ODI skipper has proved his pre-tournament skepticism wrong.\n\n\"The third, I am going with Pat Cummins. He is captaining well, even batting well now, and bowling in the right areas. When he was selected as a captain, I felt what were they doing as they were spending so much money and his IPL numbers were not great. However, I stand corrected,\" he explained (6:45).\n\n\"Pat Cummins Sir, you have been absolutely outstanding and I am happy to course correct. You are doing very well. So Pat Cummins is my third player to watch out for,\" the renowned commentator added.\n\nCummins has picked up 13 wickets at an economy rate of 9.02 in 11 innings in IPL 2024.
