Moody reckoned that Abhishek's career has raced up with the SunRisers in this season of the cash-rich league. Abhishek's scintillating knock of 75 runs was crucial in SRH thumping LSG by 10 wickets at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad on May 8, Wednesday. SRH uplifted themselves to the 3rd position in the points table with an emphatic win as they look to solidify their places in the top 4 with the race to the playoffs intensifying.\n\nMoody, while speaking to Star Sports, mentioned that it has been in SRH's DNA to trump the opposition this way. He was also happy with the rise of Abhishek as a player and how he has flourished while partnering with Travis Head.\n\nIPL 2024 Full Coverage | IPL 2024 Points Table and Standings | 2024 IPL Full Schedule\n\n\"It's part of their DNA. Abhishek Sharma, is a young emerging Indian player and an incredibly exciting player to have worked alongside Travis Head, who is at top of his game, be it international cricket or IPL in all formats. His career has been fast-tracked at million miles an hour,\" Moody said.\n\nHead and Abhishek shared their 3rd 100-plus opening stand of the season as they have been key contributors to SRH's success in the season so far. The duo latched onto the LSG bowlers as they plundered 167 runs within 9.4 overs. This was the highest total in the first ten overs of IPL after 10 overs.\n\nABHISHEK'S RISE WITH SRH\n\nMoody hailed Abhishek for continuing his good domestic form into IPL as well. He called Abhishek as a 'natural striker of the ball' and was happy with his progress with SRH so far. The all-rounder was roped in by SRH in 2019 and Abhishek finally repaid the years of trust showcased in him by the franchise.\n\n\"He is coming into this IPL with incredibly good domestic season. A successful one with Punjab so he is coming in-form. He has experienced IPL cricket for a number of years now he is a young emerging player.\"\n\n\"He is embracing IPL cricket, he is embracing the partnership he got with Travis Head. He is embracing the way the management has set the tone with how they wanna play. So, he is complimenting his game. He is a natural ball-striker, he is not doing anything extra-ordinary. He likes to hit sixes, he has always hits sixes. This brand of cricket is suiting him,\" Moody added.\n\nAbhishek was striking at 267.86 as he smacked 75 runs off just 28 balls. {"uri": "8117507604", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "13:57:06", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T13:57:06Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T13:56:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5137255191802979, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/ipl-2024-lucknow-super-giants-win-toss-opt-to-bat-against-sunrisers-hyderabad20240508192017/", "title": "IPL 2024: Lucknow Super Giants win toss, opt to bat against Sunrisers Hyderabad", "body": "Hyderabad (Telangana) [India], May 8 (ANI): KL Rahul-led Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) won the toss and decided to bat against Pat Cummins' Sunrisers Hyderabad in the 57th match of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Wednesday.\n\nThe Lucknow-based franchise are coming into this match after conceding a 98-run loss against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Currently, LSG are holding the sixth place on the standings with 12 points.\n\nWhile the Sunrisers were in great form at the start of the tournament, however, they conceded three losses in their previous five matches. In their previous game, Pat Cummins-led SRH suffered a 7-wicket defeat against Mumbai Indians. They are standing in fourth place on the table with 12 points.\n\nWhile speaking at the toss, Cummins accepted that it would be tough to qualify for the playoffs of the tournament. He also confirmed that Vijayakanth Viyaskanth replaced Marco Jansen in the playing eleven.\n\n\"We would have batted as well. But we have won both ways here and hence not too upset. Hard to know (a good score) as it has been pretty high scoring. It is pretty tough (to qualify for the playoffs) and you have to keep winning till the end, we have not nailed it in the last couple of games and it is time to change that. We have a couple of changes - Sanvir comes in for Agarwal and Viyaskanth makes his debut and replaces Marco,\" Cummins said.\n\nWhile KL Rahul said they have made a few changes in the playing eleven. He confirmed Proteas batter Quinton de kock came back in the playing squad in place of Mohsin Khan.\n\n\"We will bat first. That (the pitch) plus a couple of games that have been played here. It is hard to complete forget how important this game is for both the sides, but we have played enough cricket. We will focus one thing at a time, first bat well and put the runs on the board. Playing at home becomes a difference, but we play so much cricket that we know how the conditions will be. Quinton comes in, Mohsin misses out and there are a few other changes,\" Rahul said.\n\nLucknow Super Giants (Playing XI): Quinton de Kock, KL Rahul (Wk/C), Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran, Ayush Badoni, Deepak Hooda, Krunal Pandya, Krishnappa Gowtham, Yash Thakur, Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq.\n\nSunrisers Hyderabad (Playing XI): Travis Head, Nitish Reddy, Heinrich Klaasen (Wk), Abdul Samad, Shahbaz Ahmed, Sanvir Singh, Pat Cummins (C), Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jaydev Unadkat, Vijayakanth Viyaskanth, T Natarajan. {"uri": "8118654255", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "07:17:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T07:17:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T07:17:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5137255191802979, "url": "https://in.mashable.com/culture/74799/sachin-tendulkar-hails-sunrisers-hyderabad-after-166-run-chase-in-just-10-overs-calls-openers-destru", "title": "Sachin Tendulkar Hails Sunrisers Hyderabad After 166 Run-Chase In Just 10 Overs; Calls Openers 'Destructive' In Viral Po", "body": "In a thrilling showdown that had fans on the edge of their seats, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) once again showcased their mastery of the game in the IPL 2024 match against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Wednesday. With their trademark powerful batting performances, SRH replicated their earlier success by chasing down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs, leaving KL Rahul's team struggling to keep pace.\n\nThe backbone of SRH's victory was none other than their dynamic opening pair, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, whose fearless approach to the game guided their team to victory without conceding a single wicket. Their exceptional performance garnered widespread praise, with cricket experts and fans alike hailing their partnership as \"destructive,\" with even Indian batting legend Sachin Tendulkar expressing his admiration on social media platform X (formerly Twitter).\n\nThe sheer magnitude of SRH's triumph left spectators in awe, as they marveled at the brilliance of Head and Sharma's partnership. However, the aftermath of the match saw a heated discussion between LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka and skipper KL Rahul, a moment captured by cameras and shared online, sparking controversy. Experts on Jio Cinema chimed in, suggesting that such discussions should remain private to avoid unnecessary distractions for the team.\n\nWith this crucial win, SRH surged to the third position on the points table, accumulating a total of 14 points and displacing Chennai Super Kings to fourth place with 12 points. Additionally, this victory marked the end of the road for five-time champions Mumbai Indians, who faced elimination from the tournament after suffering eight losses out of 12 matches, leaving them with a maximum attainable points tally of 12.\n\nAs the IPL 2024 season progresses, SRH's dominant performance serves as a testament to their formidable presence in the tournament, instilling fear in their opponents and bringing joy to their fans. The SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) opening pair smashed the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) bowlers all around the park in their IPL 2024 clash in Hyderabad on Wednesday, May 8.\n\nLSG set SRH a 166-run target after opting to bat first. Head and Abhishek then stitched together an unbroken 167-run partnership in just 9.4 overs to help the hosts register a comprehensive win and climb to the third position on the points table.\n\nReviewing the game on Star Sports, Kaif pointed out that the Australian mindset has been instilled in the SRH lineup and that Head and Abhishek's batting approach threatens the bowlers' careers.\n\n\"Pat Cummins - Aussie captain, Travis Head - player from Australia. So this is the Aussie intent. I remember the 2003 World Cup final - Australia against India. The conditions were overcast. We won the toss and (Sourav) Ganguly said we would win the match as the ball would swing. Australia made 360,\" he said.\n\n\"This has not happened for the first time. We have seen in this entire IPL that bowlers are unable to stop these two batters. This is career-ending batting, that the bowler is dropped from the next match, they are batting like that,\" Kaif added.\n\nHead clubbed eight fours and as many sixes in his unbeaten 30-ball 89. Abhishek's unbeaten 75 off 28 deliveries was studded with eight fours and six maximums.\n\n\"This wasn't slogging but top-class batting\" - Mohammad Kaif on Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's partnership\n\nMohammad Kaif noted that Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma's approach was in sharp contrast to the Lucknow Super Giants' top-order batters.\n\n\"The intent we should have seen from Lucknow in a big match was totally missing. They scored 27 runs in six overs and SRH reached 100 in six overs. This wasn't slogging but top-class batting. It's just watch the ball and hit the ball. They moved the right leg away and played shots off good balls,\" he observed.\n\nThe former India batter warned the Gujarat Titans and the Punjab Kings, who will be the SunRisers Hyderabad's opponents in their last two league games at home.\n\n\"I believe there was another test in today's game. Hyderabad showed that they can play like this when a do-or-die game comes. Winning the match by 10 wickets is a statement to the other teams who will come to play here. Gujarat will come to play the next match at this ground. Come with a plan,\" Kaif stated.\n\nSRH's crushing win against LSG helped them boost their net run rate to 0.406. Goenka seemed upset about the team's annihilating loss and had an animated chat with Rahul. LSG suffered a thumping defeat by 10 wickets as they lost their 2nd game on the trot amid an intensifying race to the playoffs.\n\nGoenka had come to watch the encounter and show his support to the team. However, the team did let him down with their overall performance. After the match, Rahul seemed speechless while interacting with Goenka, who wasn't happy with the team's performance. The LSG skipper, known for his calm demeanour, quietly listened to the team's owner.\n\nThe experts on Jio Cinema seemed upset with Goenka's gesture, as Graeme Smith mentioned that such conversations should happen behind closed doors. Meanwhile, Scott Styris came out in Rahul's support and said that he had done enough to keep his cool in this situation. IPL 2024, SRH vs LSG: Match Report | Highlights\n\n\"The emotions are all over. You always feel that these conversations should always happen behind closed doors. There are so many cameras around, they miss nothing. KL Rahul is not gonna go and do press-conferences and probably potentially explain what is being discussed here,\" Smith said while speaking to Jio Cinema. Playing at home becomes a difference, but we play so much cricket that we know how the conditions will be. Quinton comes in, Mohsin misses out and there are a few other changes,\" Rahul said. Abhishek Sharma (75* runs) spoke exclusively to JioCinema on Match Centre Live about his relationship with Travis Head, his approach while batting, and how he tackled the LSG bowlers.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays better spin than Travis. I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this. Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that. They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot.\"\n\nSharma also discussed how he tackled the LSG bowlers - \"They were bowling cutters in the middle. If the game is washed out, both teams will share the points which will take both the sides at third and fourth spot in the points table. Both these teams will replace Chennai Super Kings, who will drop down to the fifth spot. But again, SRH and LSG would have played a extra game compared to CSK, who have played 11.\n\nCurrently, both teams are locked in at 12 points from 11 games with SRH making the top four cut based on a slightly superior net run rate of -0.065 compared to LSG's -0.371. The Sunrisers find themselves in a fierce competition for the top four spot with KKR, Rajasthan Royals and Chennai Super Kings (12) stationed above them on the points table.\n\nThe threat of rain looms large. There are 40 per cent chances of rain on the match-day with the temperature hovering around 28 degrees. The message was clear from them and I backed myself. All the credit goes to him (Head). The way he starts against all bowlers.. he goes after them from the start and takes the pressure off. The bowlers told us (during the innings break) that it was getting better, but myself and Travis thought it was not doing much. I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach\" said Abhishek in post match conference.\n\nThe win propelled SRH to the third position in the standings with 14 points from 12 games, while LSG are struggling at the sixth spot with 12 points from the same number of matches.\n\nThe result also In response, Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma took the LSG bowlers to the cleaners as SRH marched on to victory in just 9.4 overs. Hayden said on commentary that someone needs to show intent for LSG and after having one of the slowest powerplays, they just never recovered and ended up with a score that was absolutely below-par with respect to the playing surface.\n\n\"I have to call them out. This is not a 5 runs per over wicket. Somebody needed to show intent. They had one of the slowest powerplays. That took the innings nowhere. When the opposition team has Travis Head, Heinrich Klaasen, your intention should be to go at 10s and over. 160-170 will never be enough,\" Hayden said in commentary.\n\n\"Am lost for words. We have watched that kind of batting on tv. But this is unreal batting. Everything seemed to find the middle of the bat. Kudos to their skills. They have worked hard on their six hitting skills. The 23-year-old Punjab left-hander fired from all cylinders for Hyderabad this season, making 401 runs from 12 matches and those runs have come at an awesome strike-rate of 205. \"Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that,\" Abhishek said on JioCinema Match Centre Live after their record 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants here on Wednesday.\n\n\"They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" said Abhishek, who has hit 35 sixes so far, highest by any batter this season.\n\nThe SRH openers Abhishek (75 not out off 28 balls) and Travis Head (89 not out off 30 balls) scaled down 166 in just 9.4 overs, rewriting the record for the quickest chase of 150-plus in T20 cricket.\n\nSRH's total of 167 was also the highest by any team by the end of the tenth over in men's T20s.\n\n\"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy,\" said Abhishek who played a key role in Punjab winning the domestic T20 title last season.\n\nAbhishek (485 runs from 10 matches) was the second highest run-getter behind Riyan Parag (510) of Assam in last season's SMAT.\n\n\"I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this,\" he added.\n\nWith Head at his explosive best, SRH have smashed many batting records this season including the highest ever IPL total of 287/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays spin better than Travis. The shots he hit off (Krishnappa) Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is.\n\n\"He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of him over the last year that I have followed him.\n\n\"When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time,\" he added.\n\nAbhishek then touched upon his strategy against the LSG bowlers, especially pacers.\n\n\"They were bowling cutters in the middle. I thought the cutters could slow down on their way, but Travis and I had planned to play it the way you would hit a spinner with the spin.\n\n\"So, if it's an off-cutter, we look to hit towards long-off covers. The 17th edition of the IPL has seen boundaries being struck with increasing frequency, setting a rapid pace of scoring unmatched in previous seasons.\n\nThe encounter between the Sunrisers Hyderabad and the Lucknow Super Giants at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad, although promising to be an exciting contest between two sides desperately eyeing a spot to be a part of the playoff, resulted in being a thoroughly one-sided affair, particularly in the second half of the fixture.\n\nThe openers of SRH, Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head, clobbered their way to a stupendous victory in the end, making extremely light work of the 166-run target set by LSG. A host of records got eclipsed along the way; the difference in the powerplay totals by sides in a particular match (80-27/2 and 107/0), winning with the most number of deliveries to spare while chasing targets in excess of 100 (62), etc. These, along with a few more, were achieved in the second innings of the game.\n\nAlso Read: Watch: LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka seen bickering with KL Rahul post SRH drubbing, sends netizens into a frenzy\n\nA breakthrough feat was broken in the first innings after it was Krunal Pandya's second successive six off Jaydev Unadkat's slot delivery which the former stroked over the bowler's head for a maximum. That six marked the 1000th six in IPL 2024, which came in record time in terms of the number of deliveries (13,079), as compared to 2023 and 2022 - where this endeavour had taken 15,390 and 16,269 deliveries, respectively.\n\nAlso Read: IPL 2024, Match 57 Stats Review: SRH register highest total in the first 10 overs, Travis Head's batting heroics and other stats\n\nThe past couple of seasons have been surreal for batters, where extraordinarily turbo-charged batting has led to an upsurge in the rate at which runs were amassed. The previous couple of seasons saw a total of 1124 and 1062 sixes being hit, respectively. {"uri": "8117856405", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "17:58:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T17:58:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T17:57:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4941176474094391, "url": "https://newsable.asianetnews.com/cricket-sports/cricket-ipl-2024-sunrisers-hyderabad-s-dominant-victory-propels-them-to-third-place-in-ipl-standings-osf-sd6hig", "title": "IPL 2024: Sunrisers Hyderabad's dominant victory propels them to third place in IPL standings", "body": "In a stunning display of power-hitting, Sunrisers Hyderabad's opening duo propelled their team to third place in the points table with one of the most emphatic 10-wicket wins in IPL history, decimating Lucknow Super Giants with an astonishing 62 balls to spare.\n\nOpting to bat first on what seemed like a slow and challenging pitch, Lucknow Super Giants managed to post 165/4 in their allotted 20 overs. Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran anchored the innings, remaining unbeaten on 55 and 48 respectively. Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) and Pat Cummins (1/47) were the sole wicket-takers for Sunrisers.\n\nSunrisers' chase kicked off with off-spinner Krishnappa Gowtham's tidy first over, but a boundary off the final ball ignited an onslaught from the opening pair. Travis Head (89* off 30) and Abhishek Sharma (75* off 28) tore apart the opposition's bowling attack, including Yash Thakur, Gowtham, Naveen-ul-Haq, Ayush Badoni, and Ravi Bishnoi, dispatching the ball to all corners of the ground with relentless aggression.\n\nDespite Ravi Bishnoi creating a couple of opportunities, Lucknow Super Giants failed to capitalize as chances were missed, allowing the Sunrisers' onslaught to continue unabated. A staggering 148 of the 167 runs were amassed through boundaries, with Head smashing 8 fours and an equal number of sixes, while Abhishek Sharma contributed with 8 fours and 6 maximums.\n\nWith Lucknow Super Giants languishing at sixth place in the points table, their next encounter against Delhi Capitals looms crucial. Meanwhile, Sunrisers Hyderabad enjoys a week-long break before facing Gujarat Titans at home.\n\nIn a significant turn of events, Mumbai Indians have officially been eliminated from the playoffs race Reddy made the catch look easy as he lobbed the ball back in when stepping over and came back in to claim it. Kumar struck again to dismiss dangerous Marcus Stoinis (3) as Sanvir Singh took a low catch diving forward at mid-on.\n\nLSG scored 27 runs in the Power Play-their slowest before this was 45. Debutant Vijayakanth Viyaskanth came for his first over and hit some perfect areas and gave only three in his first. First impressions of a leggie quick through the air, didn't turn any of the balls big, but showed his variations: the wrong'un, the front-of-the-hand ball.\n\nFirst impressions of a leggie quick through the air, didn't turn any of the balls big, but has shown his variations: the wrong'un, the front-of-the-hand ball. Skipper KL Rahul on the other end played the anchor role and was struggling with 20 runs in 25 deliveries but Krunal Pandya showed intent to score big when he launched back-to-back sixes to Jaydev Unadkat in the eighth over.\n\nA slower bouncer from Jaydev Unadkat, almost head high, but Pandya flat-batted it for a six over long-on. The next one was more orthodox, a drive back over Unadkat's head as he pitched it up and gave the pace. LSG were reeling on 45 for 2 in eight overs.\n\nSkipper Pat Cummins got the prize wicket of Rahul as he bowled on pace, sliding onto the pads, Rahul felt he had to have a swing at it and flicked it in the air, trying to go behind square on the leg side, but was caught at deep square, and went for 29 off 33. Cummins hit down the middle stump to get rid of Pandya on 24.\n\nFinally, the run rate went past six an over with Ayush Badoni maneuvering T Natarajan for three boundaries in the 14th over. Then Nicholas Pooran smashed a six of the debutant and Badoni ended the over with a boundary as Viyaskanth ended his spell without a wicket giving away 27 runs. T Natarajan went for 35 runs in three overs as Badoni moved around in the crease and managed to place him in the gaps. Badoni is not a power-hitter but in a game where the seven and over might be the going rate, his pitch was right up his alley.\n\nHe was 35 off 19, and the partnership went to 59 off 33 with Pooran. Both the batters collected 15 off Natarajan's last over and with a boundary on the very first ball of Cummins LSG went par 150. Badoni reached his fifty off just 28 balls and kept LSG alive in this contest. He has manipulated fields and the lines of the bowlers by moving around in the crease and has also played some orthodox shots just hard enough to clear the field. Unfortunately, Natarajan also got his fifty, conceding 15 in the 19th over.\n\nThe 52-ball 99-run partnership for the fifth wickets between Badoni and Pooran-highest for LSG for the fifth wickets- helped them to recover from 66 for 4 to 165 for 4 at the end of 20 overs. Pat Cummins vs KL Rahul", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad welcome Lucknow Super Giants to the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium in Uppal, Hyderabad, in the 57th match of IPL 2024 on Wednesday, May 8.\n\nWhile the hosts are fourth in the league table with 12 points to their name at the moment, the visitors are perched just one spot below them in the standings with the same number of points.\n\nThis game is crucial for both teams as it will decide which of them manages to make the cut and become the fourth side to try and push for future qualification into the playoffs this season.\n\nWe look at three key player battles to watch out for in this game:\n\n#1 Pat Cummins vs KL Rahul\n\nOne of the biggest battles in this game will be the one between the skippers of the respective franchises. While SRH have been led by Australia's World Cup-winning captain Pat Cummins this year, LSG have entrusted their hopes in India wicketkeeper-batter KL Rahul.\n\nRahul will open the innings for LSG in this game and is expected to come up against Cummins. If he manages to better Cummins by picking up his slower bouncers well and treating them like they are meant to be, LSG will be in the ascendancy.\n\nHowever, if Cummins manages to get the upper hand over Rahul, SRH will be able to dictate terms throughout the game.\n\nStar LSG bowler Naveen-ul-Haq, who picked up three wickets in his side's previous game, a disappointing defeat to KKR in Lucknow on Sunday, will have to contend with the marauding Travis Head in this game.\n\nThe latter is known to tuck into all bowlers who aim to come into the powerplay and deliver the goods.\n\nHead looks to make room for himself and carve deliveries up and over the cover fielder to pick up runs and this is where Naveen will have to be careful. He cannot afford to give Head the room and pace needed to play his shots or manufacture any to take SRH towards a big total.\n\nThe Afghan seamer will need to have his wits around him to compete against Head.\n\n#3 Nitish Kumar Reddy vs Ravi Bishnoi\n\nSRH's newfound sensation Nitish Kumar Reddy, who plies his trade for Andhra in domestic cricket, will have to compete against leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi in this game.\n\nReddy has shown excellent form of late, and he will have the responsibility of carrying the SRH middle order upon his shoulder in this game.\n\nBishnoi is a wily operator and he will know just exactly how much spin and bounce will be operable at the Uppal stadium on Wednesday. He hammered 9 fours during his time on the crease.\n\nWhile speaking after the first inning, Badoni said the pitch at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium was on the slower side.\n\nHe added the Sunrisers bowlers were delivering slower balls in the first inning, so just tried to found gaps on the shorter square.\n\n\"The wicket was on the slower side, just wanted to take it deep and just play cricketing shots, didn't want to throw my wicket away. It's not a wicket where you can go from ball 1. The bowlers were bowling short slower balls, so I was looking to find the gap on the shorter square. It's a good score if the dew doesn't come, I think our bowlers will defend it. As of now, there's no dew,\" Badoni said.\n\nRecapping the first inning of the match between Lucknow and Hyderabad, LSG won the toss and decided to bat first. Ayush Badoni (55) and Nicholas Pooran (48) were the only standout batters and powered the visitors to 165/4. KL Rahul (29) and Krunal Pandya (24) displayed an average performance or else Lucknow could have added more runs on the scoreboard.\n\nBhuvneshwar Kumar led the Sunrisers bowling attack as he bagged two wickets and gave just 12 runs in his four-over spell at an economy rate of 3.00. While skipper Pat Cummins bagged one wicket in his four-over spell.\n\nThe hosts need to make 166 runs to win the match in Hyderabad. {"uri": "8118706919", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "07:51:34", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T07:51:34Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T07:51:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4901960790157318, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/backing-of-captain-cummins-srh-support-staff-matters-a-lot-abhishek-sharma-101715241005183.html", "title": "Backing of captain Cummins, SRH support staff matters a lot: Abhishek Sharma", "body": "Hyderabad, The unwavering support from skipper Pat Cummins and the entire think-tank played a big role in his success in the on-going IPL, reckoned Sunrisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma.\n\nThe 23-year-old Punjab left-hander fired from all cylinders for Hyderabad this season, making 401 runs from 12 matches and those runs have come at an awesome strike-rate of 205.\n\n\"Our support staff and Pat , the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that,\" Abhishek said on JioCinema Match Centre Live after their record 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants here on Wednesday.\n\n\"They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" said Abhishek, who has hit 35 sixes so far, highest by any batter this season.\n\nThe SRH openers Abhishek and Travis Head scaled down 166 in just 9.4 overs, rewriting the record for the quickest chase of 150-plus in T20 cricket.\n\nSRH's total of 167 was also the highest by any team by the end of the tenth over in men's T20s.\n\n\"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy,\" said Abhishek who played a key role in Punjab winning the domestic T20 title last season.\n\nAbhishek was the second highest run-getter behind Riyan Parag of Assam in last season's SMAT.\n\n\"I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this,\" he added.\n\nWith Head at his explosive best, SRH have smashed many batting records this season including the highest ever IPL total of 287/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.\n\nAbhishek hailed the way Head played spin.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays spin better than Travis. The shots he hit off Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is.\n\n\"He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of him over the last year that I have followed him.\n\n\"When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time,\" he added.\n\nAbhishek then touched upon his strategy against the LSG bowlers, especially pacers.\n\n\"They were bowling cutters in the middle. I thought the cutters could slow down on their way, but Travis and I had planned to play it the way you would hit a spinner with the spin.\n\n\"So, if it's an off-cutter, we look to hit towards long-off covers. After suffering a seven wicket defeat against Mumbai Indians in their previous game, SRH needed to win the game to bolster their playoffs chances and they won it in style.\n\nSet a target of 166 runs, the Hyderabad-based outfit chased down the total in just 9.4 overs to create history. They broke the record for the highest total chased inside 10 overs. Head and Sharma went all out against LSG to power their team to the seventh win of the season.\n\nBoth the batters came out all guns blazing right from the start. Head smashed a 16-ball fifty while Sharma did it in just 19 balls. Head went on to hit an unbeaten 89 runs off just 30 balls with the help of eight fours and eight sixes. On the other hand, Sharma remained unbeaten on 75 runs. His knock came off just 28 balls and was studded with eight fours and six sixes.\n\nHead and Sharma's whirlwind batting left everyone in the cricketing fraternity stunned. Not only the fans but present and former players were also stunned with their power-hitting. Sachin Tendulkar, arguably the most decorated batter in the history of the game, also had a similar reaction. The former India batsman stated that the SRH would have scored 300 runs if they batted first.\n\n\"A destructive opening partnership would be an understatement tonight. Had these boys batted first, they would've scored 300!\" Sachin Tendulkar wrote on X (formerly Twitter).\n\nWhile Sachin Tendulkar was mighty impressed by Head and Sharma's batting, SRH's win has also knocked out Mumbai Indians out of IPL 2024. The former cricketer is currently a part of Mumbai Indians' support staff. Mumbai Indians are currently languishing at the ninth spot in the points table with 8 points from 12 games.\n\nEven if they go on to win their remaining two league games, they will finish on 12 points. However, at least four teams are confirmed to finish with at least 14 points this season. The Australian was handed the Player of the Match award for his exploits and expressed his delight in the partnership he has formed with the young Indian.\n\n\"It was a lot of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi and I have had a few partnerships like this,\" the southpaw began.\n\nThe SRH openers have been a nightmare for opposition bowling units this season and Head delved into their approach stating that they looked to maximise on the powerplay overs.\n\n\"We just try to concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay,\"\n\nThe Aussie southpaw opened up on attacking spinners and opined that it is something he has been focusing on ahead of the ICC T20I World Cup, slated to begin following the conclusion of the IPL.\n\n\"It is something I have been working on, it will be a big part in the Caribbean as well. It is important to go 360 in the modern game,\" he explained.\n\nHe also addressed the maverick brand of cricket he has been playing and stated that it has been the same he has been trying to implement in international colours too.\n\n\"The last 12 months, that's how they wanted me to play in the Aussie team, and that's what I've been told to do here as well. There is not much that I have to change,\" he revealed.\n\nThe Australin heaped praise on his SRH opening partner and expressed delight with the youngster's showing.\n\n\"I know how hard he works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We complement each other very well. {"uri": "8118455467", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "04:32:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T04:32:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T04:31:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4862745106220245, "url": "https://www.insidesport.in/cricket/we-almost-forgot-about-bhuvneshwar-kumars-heroics-as-srh-batsmen-lsg-owner-take-centerstage/", "title": "We almost forgot about Bhuvneshwar Kumar's heroics, as SRH batsmen & LSG owner take centerstage", "body": "Bhuvneshwar Kumar was the hero of the SRH vs LSG match as he returned with figures of 2/12 in his four overs.\n\nHe might not have made it to the India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2024, he might have missed the opportunity to impress the selectors for various tournaments, but Bhuvneshwar Kumar is in a league of his own. On Wednesday, during the SRH vs LSG match, where the Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head, and after the match, Sanjiv Goenka and KL Rahul made the headlines, Bhuvi went about his business quietly.\n\nIn a match where Pat Cummins gave away 12.50 runs per over, Bhuvneshwar Kumar returned with miserly figures of 2/12. This, when he isn't considered to be at his best. In IPL 2024, Bhuvi has only 11 wickets in 12 games, at an average of 37, but he still does his job with an economy of 9.13. That too considering, he also bowls at the start of the innings, and also the death overs.\n\nIn his first spell itself, vs LSG, Bhuvi gave hints that it was going to be his day. First he removed LSG opener Quinton de Kock early for 2, and then got rid of Marcus Stoinis in the very next over. That meant, the opposition could only score 27/2 in the powerplay overs. If that was not enough to show Bhuvi's brilliance, then consider this. When the bowler wasn't operating in the middle overs, that was when the most runs were scored.\n\nTill the 16th over, Ayush Badoni and Nicholas Pooran had taken the score to 112/4 at the end of the 16th over. That means runs in that period came at a much rapid pace of around 8.5. Then coming in to bowl the 18th over, the fast bowler gave away only five singles. The 19th over brought 15 runs, while the 20th brought 19. So, easily, Bhuvi emerged as the best bowler for SRH.\n\nThe out-of-favour India pacer, Bhuvi, despite a 'so-called' ordinary IPL 2024 season, is nothing short of a legend. He has 181 wickets in 172 matches at an average of 26. What's even better is his economy rate of 7.51. Forget the IPL, he has even better numbers in T20Is. In 87 matches, he has 90 wickets to his name, at an average of 23, and an economy of 6.96. That speaks volumes this UP player.\n\nBut then, as is the case in cricket. The batsmen hog all the limelight. This time it was Abhishek Sharma (75 from 28), and Travis Head (89 from 30), who stole Bhuvi's thunder. The duo achieved the 166-run target in only 9.4 overs. Abhishek Sharma's explosive knock of 75 runs off just 28 balls, including 8 fours and 6 sixes, set the tone for Sunrisers' dominance. Travis Head, equally impressive, complemented Sharma's onslaught with his own brilliant innings, scoring an unbeaten 89 runs off 30 balls, featuring 8 fours and 6 sixes.\n\nTogether, they chased down the target of 166 runs in just 9.4 overs without losing a single wicket, showcasing exceptional skill and determination. Their partnership not only secured a comprehensive victory for Sunrisers Hyderabad but also highlighted the team's formidable batting prowess.\n\nIn the end, Sunrisers Hyderabad's emphatic win by 10 wickets not only earned them crucial points in the tournament but also served as a stark reminder of their potential as serious contenders in the league. The unwavering support from skipper Pat Cummins and the entire think-tank played a big role in his success in the on-going IPL, reckoned Sunrisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma.\n\nHyderabad, May 9 (PTI) The unwavering support from skipper Pat Cummins and the entire think-tank played a big role in his success in the on-going IPL, reckoned Sunrisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma.\n\nThe 23-year-old Punjab left-hander fired from all cylinders for Hyderabad this season, making 401 runs from 12 matches and those runs have come at an awesome strike-rate of 205.\n\nAlso Read | IPL 2024 Punjab Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Free Live Streaming Online on JioCinema: Get TV Channel Telecast Details of PBKS vs RCB T20 Cricket Match on Star Sports.\n\n\"Our support staff and Pat (Cummins), the way they think, I have never seen anyone else think like that,\" Abhishek said on JioCinema Match Centre Live after their record 10-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants here on Wednesday.\n\n\"They're like, 'Go out there and express yourself. Play as aggressively as you can, we'll back you.' I think that matters a lot,\" said Abhishek, who has hit 35 sixes so far, highest by any batter this season.\n\nAlso Read | India Women vs Bangladesh Women, 5th T20I 2024 Live Streaming Online: Get Free Live Telecast of IND-W vs BAN-W Cricket Match on TV With Time in IST.\n\nThe SRH openers Abhishek (75 not out off 28 balls) and Travis Head (89 not out off 30 balls) scaled down 166 in just 9.4 overs, rewriting the record for the quickest chase of 150-plus in T20 cricket.\n\nSRH's total of 167 was also the highest by any team by the end of the tenth over in men's T20s.\n\n\"I think this approach was something I took on during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy,\" said Abhishek who played a key role in Punjab winning the domestic T20 title last season.\n\nAbhishek (485 runs from 10 matches) was the second highest run-getter behind Riyan Parag (510) of Assam in last season's SMAT.\n\n\"I feel when I play this way, look at the ball, and react, my shots come off better and the bowler comes under pressure. I always thought if I play in the IPL, I'll try to maintain this,\" he added.\n\nWith Head at his explosive best, SRH have smashed many batting records this season including the highest ever IPL total of 287/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.\n\nAbhishek hailed the way Head played spin.\n\n\"I don't think anyone plays spin better than Travis. The shots he hit off (Krishnappa) Gowtham, normally batters can't do that, that shows how special he is.\n\n\"He's very clear, whenever I talk to him, the way he compliments me, I have always been a big fan of him over the last year that I have followed him.\n\n\"When our understanding was established and our partnership improved, we became good friends off the pitch and have started spending more time,\" he added.\n\nAbhishek then touched upon his strategy against the LSG bowlers, especially pacers.\n\n\"They were bowling cutters in the middle. I thought the cutters could slow down on their way, but Travis and I had planned to play it the way you would hit a spinner with the spin.\n\n\"So, if it's an off-cutter, we look to hit towards long-off covers. {"uri": "8118530740", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:42:25", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:42:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:41:44Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4823529422283173, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/t20-world-cup-2024-abhishek-sharma-shubman-gill-and-yashasvi-jaiswal-in-a-3-way-race-for-indian-openers-post-wc-reveals-mike-hesson/", "title": "T20 World Cup 2024: Abhishek Sharma, Shubman Gill, and Yashasvi Jaiswal in a 3-way race for Indian openers post WC reveals Mike Hesson", "body": "Abhishek Sharma Is An Incredible Player Of Spin And Pace - Pat Cummins\n\nFormer Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) coach Mike Hesson made an interesting remark on young opening batter Abhishek Sharma's future with the Indian national cricket team. Mike Hesson predicted that Abhishek Sharma will become an opener for Team India following the T20 World Cup 2024.\n\nAbhishek Sharma showcased his batting prowess during the match between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). Sharma scored an unbeaten 75 runs off 28 balls, including eight fours and six sixes. Along with Travis Head, he helped SRH chase the target of 166 in just 9.4 overs.\n\nTravis Head scored an unbeaten 89 runs off just 30 deliveries, including eight fours and eight sixes. Interestingly, SRH didn't even need their middle-order batsmen like Heinrich Klaasen and Nitish Kumar Reddy to bat. Abhishek and Head dominated the LSG bowlers with their powerful hitting abilities.\n\nAbhishek Sharma has amassed 401 runs in 12 matches with an average of 36.45 and an outstanding strike rate of 205.64, including two fifties. Notably, his strike rate is better than players like Virat Kohli, Sanju Samson, Rishabh Pant, Shivam Dube, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Suryakumar Yadav, and Rohit Sharma.\n\nSpeaking on JioCinema, Mike Hesson praised Abhishek's aggressive batting style and highlighted his ability to take on spin in the powerplay. Hesson stated that Abhishek could secure a spot in the India squad after the T20 World Cup. He described Abhishek as a high-quality player and boundary hitter.\n\n\"Oh, look, I think so. I mean, I think his ability to take on spin in the power play. And he's improved greatly against pace. He is a high-quality player. He's a boundary hitter. He is a six-hitter and no doubt post-World Cup, and he will start to make some changes, whether it be Jaiswal, himself, or Shubman Gill. To be fair, there's a few. There's plenty of names, but he will definitely be one that will have plenty of people talking about,\" Hesson told JioCinema.\n\nFollowing the T20 World Cup, Team India is scheduled to tour Zimbabwe for a five-match T20I series. If Abhishek Sharma secures a spot in the Indian squad, he could replace Rohit Sharma at the top. The selectors could pick the young team for the upcoming tour to the African nation in July.\n\nSRH skipper Pat Cummins praised opener Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma. Cummins described him as an incredible player against both spin and pace. He stated that it would be difficult for bowlers to face batters like Travis and Abhishek.\n\n\"(On did he change the pitch) Maybe Travis and Abhishek did. We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs. (On Travis Head) He's been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional. (On Abhishek Sharma) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them,\" Pat Cummins said.", "source": {"uri": "cricketaddictor.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "CricketAddictor"}, Electing to bat, LSG were in all sorts of trouble at 66 for 4 in 11.2 overs before Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand. LSG were struggling at 27 for 2 at the end of the powerplay. The visitors lost Quinton de Kock, who replaced an injured Mohsin Khan, failed to deliver, caught brilliantly by Nitish Kumar Reddy at deep backward square-leg off Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) in the third over. They showed their intent from the word go and didn't hesitate to play their strokes when the opportunity was presented to them. It was brilliant batting from Badoni as he swept and cut Natarajan for two consecutive boundaries in the 17th over with the deck seemed to have got better. {"uri": "8115079792", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-07", "time": "07:46:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-07T07:46:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-07T07:45:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "https://theprint.in/sport/inconsistent-srh-take-on-lsg-in-push-for-play-offs-spot/2073430/", "title": "Inconsistent SRH take on LSG in push for play-offs spot", "body": "The Sunrisers find themselves in a fierce competition for the top four spot with Kolkata Knight Riders (16), Rajasthan Royals (16) and Chennai Super Kings (12) stationed above them on the points table.\n\nThe winner of the duel will take a leap in the playoff race.\n\nThe Pat Cummins-led side has ample talent but has been unable to hold on to a winning run recently. Sunrisers have lost three of their last four matches, mainly because their destructive batting line-up hasn't delivered.\n\nIn their last match against Mumbai Indians, which they lost by seven wickets, they failed to put up a good target on the board, which has been their strong suit this season.\n\nBarring Travis Head, who has been their stand out performer, the other batters in the side have faced a recent slump.\n\nAfter displaying his power-hitting ability, young opener Abhishek Sharma has breached the 30-run mark just once in the last four games.\n\nAnd while SRH head coach Daniel Vettori has conceded that the openers are not expected to do the job all the time, the middle order needs to step up.\n\nThe flamboyant Heinrich Klaasen has also been unable to strike the ball consistently and Nitish Reddy too has been patchy.\n\nThe bowlers have fared better compared to their batting counterparts.\n\nT Natarajan has been consistent with the ball while seasoned seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar also seems to have found his mojo after his incisive spell helped SRH eke out a one-run win against RR.\n\nLSG, on the other hand, have to get over their overall lacklustre display against Kolkata Knight Riders, when they not only conceded the first-ever 200 plus score at the Ekana Stadium but also folded their innings at 137.\n\nIt was a day when skipper KL Rahul failed to anchor the innings while the likes of Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran were unable to get the big shots when needed.\n\nAyush Badoni has had a subdued run in this IPL and the uncapped Indian player would be keen to shrug off the rustiness.\n\nLSG's struggles with the ball have been majorly due to the lack of firepower in their pace-bowling department.\n\nWith tearaway pacer Mayank Yadav ruled out of the IPL and left-arm pacer Mohsin Khan also picking up an injury, the onus will be on Afghan quick Naveen-ul-Haq, young Yash Thakur, Stoinis and spinners Krunal Pandya and Ravi Bishnoi to {"uri": "8118389540", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "03:23:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T03:23:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T03:22:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "https://www.insidesport.in/cricket/will-lsg-kl-rahul-suffer-ms-dhonis-fate-sanjiv-goenkas-anger-reignites-memories-of-rps-captaincy-change/", "title": "Will Rahul suffer Dhoni's fate? Sanjiv Goenka's anger reignites memories of RPS captaincy change", "body": "The post-match conversation between LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka and skipper KL Rahul has become the talk of the town, after the team suffered a heavy loss.\n\nCricket is a sport of great uncertainties; you win some, & you lose some. Try telling this to an IPL franchise owner, whose team underwent one of the worst losses in IPL history, where first the batsmen failed miserably to score, and then the bowlers could only hold the fort for 9.4 overs. That is exactly what happened in the match between SRH and LSG on Wednesday, in Hyderabad, where the visitors had no clue, as to what went wrong with them.\n\nBut the carnage just did not end there. LSG skipper KL Rahul was on the receiving end from the team owner Sanjiv Goenka, who perhaps reprimanded the latter, or just had an overtly animated chat after the match. In either case, it was just a little too much caught on the camera.\n\nAfter opting to bat first, Lucknow team struggled big time to get going. The pitch looked sluggish, and the batters could not get boundaries in the powerplay. In a poor display of batting, LSG could only score 27/2 in six overs. Rahul scored 29 from 33, while Quinton de Kock failed. It was only Nicholas Pooran (48 from 26) and Ayush Badoni (55 from 30), who took the team to a respectable total.\n\nBut the second innings was a complete turnaround. Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma went bonkers, and scored 107 in the powerplay itself. They achieved the target in only 9.4 overs and 62 deliveries to spare, giving a jolt to LSG, where it would be difficult for them to make a comeback in IPL 2024.\n\nWinning and losing might be part of the game, but visibly there was something disastrously wrong with LSG against SRH. The bowlers couldn't bowl, and the batter couldn't bat. In between, the skipper couldn't lead from the front. But does that really give the license to the owner to display such reactions with cameras around? Of course, a lot of money is invested, but these players earning million bucks, can make errors too.\n\nIf one was to read between the lines, this conversation between LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka and KL Rahul might just have some repercussions. No one knows what, but the team owner is already being called out on social media for his behaviour. But owners hardly care about these things, and for all you know, the current skipper might be demoted, or not retained for next year, before the mega auction.\n\nIf history is to go by..Dhoni was also sacked unceremoniously as the captain of Rising Pune Superginat by the same owners on account of non-performance. In 2016, the team finished second last, and at the start of the 2017 season Steve Smith was made the captain. Back then, many publications reported Sanjiv Goenka as saying, that the team wanted someone young and fit as the leader of the team.\n\nSuch was the situation that even Sakshi Dhoni had jumped into defend her husband on X. While there were no confirmed reports of the same, but a few publications suggested that the Pune management wasn't happy with Dhoni's behaviour. It was claimed that the latter would miss team meetings, and was not available on phone. {"uri": "8117920735", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:54:22", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:54:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:52:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "https://theprint.in/sport/lost-for-words-unreal-batting-from-head-abhishek-lsg-skipper-kl-rahul/2076508/", "title": "Lost for words, unreal batting from Head, Abhishek: LSG skipper KL Rahul", "body": "\"They didn't give us a chance to know what the pitch played in the second innings. It was hard to stop them as they teed off from ball one,\" he said.\n\nThis was after SRH bowlers started brilliantly before Badoni (55 not out off 30 balls) and Pooran (48 not out off 25 balls) stitched crucial 95-runs off 55 balls for the unbeaten fifth-wicket stand to guide LSG to a competitive 165 for four on a sluggish pitch.\n\nRahul blamed the defeat on their poor display with the bat in powerplay, from which they scored just 27 runs for the loss of two wickets.\n\n\"Once you are on the losing side, there are question marks on the decisions taken. We were 40-50 runs short. When we lost wickets in the powerplay, we couldn't get any momentum.\n\n\"Ayush (Badoni) and Nicky (Nicholas Pooran) batted well to get us to 166. But even if we would have got 240, they could have chased it as well,\" he admitted.\n\nSRH skipper Pat Cummins said that it was an \"unreal\" batting display from Head and Sharma.\n\n\"The boys (Head and Sharma) have had a fantastic season, but to win this with less than 10 overs played is unreal,\" he said.\n\n\"We just let them go, they are two guys who are very positive and I'm a bowler, it is tough for me to give them any inputs.\" Cummins was effusive in his praise for both Head and Sharma.\n\n\"He's (Head) been like this for 2 years, he hits the tough areas, hits the middle a lot, might not be super conventional.\n\n\"(Abhishek) Just an incredible player of spin and pace. With just 2 fielders out, it is really difficult for the bowlers against them,\" he said.\n\nHead, who was adjudged player-of-the-match for his pyrotechnics, said he was really enjoying batting with Sharma as they compliment each other well.\n\n\"Lots of fun today. Nice to get this done in 10 overs. Abhi (Sharma) and I have had a few partnerships like this. Just concentrate on getting in good positions, watch the ball hard and try to maximise the powerplay,\" he said.\n\n\"I know how hard he (Abhishek Sharma) works and how deep he thinks, his spin play is second to none. We compliment each other very well. Nice to see him back amongst the runs after missing out in the last couple of games.\" Abhishek thanks Lara, Yuvraj ===================== After his hurricane fifty, Abhishek thanked two left-handers, who had thrilled the audience during their playing days, for his success in the on-going IPL -- Yuvraj Singh and Brian Lara.\n\n\"I think the hard work I put in before the tournament is showing now, thanks to Yuvi Paaji, Brian (Lara) as well and my father, who is my first coach,\" he said.\n\nAbhishek also thanked the SRH team management for the trust shown in him.\n\n\"I would never think of coming to such a tournament and playing at such a strike rate, but thanks to the team management.\n\n\"The message was clear from them and I backed myself.\" There was a special mention of his opening partner -- Head.\n\n\"All the credit goes to him (Head). The way he starts against all bowlers...he goes after them from the start and takes the pressure off me.\" PTI SSC SSC UNG", "source": {"uri": "theprint.in", "dataType": "news", "title": "ThePrint"}, The fight for the remaining two spots is heating up with Chennai Super Kings (12) and Delhi Capitals (12) also in contention.\n\nSunrisers' batting came a cropper against five-time champions Mumbai, posting a below-par 173/8. Photograph: BCCI\n\nThe visitors lost Quinton de Kock, who replaced an injured Mohsin Khan, failed to deliver, caught brilliantly by Nitish Kumar Reddy at deep backward square-leg off Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12) in the third over.\n\nBhuvneshwar struck again in the fifth over, dismissing the dangerous Marcus Stoinis but the credit for the dismissal goes to young Sanvir Singh, who took a stunning diving catch just inches from the ground at mid-on.\n\nThe pitch also didn't help LSG's cause as the ball was a bit slow and was stopping, as their batters found it difficult to find timing.\n\nWhile skipper KL Rahul (29) held one end up, Krunal Pandya (24) took it on himself to up the ante.\n\nIMAGE: Sunrisers Hyderabad players celebrate the wicket of KL Rahul. {"uri": "8118529964", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:41:24", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:41:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:40:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4745098054409027, "url": "https://crickettimes.com/2024/05/ipl-2024-fans-call-for-abhishek-sharmas-inclusion-in-indias-t20-world-cup-2024-squad-after-srh-crushes-lsg/", "title": "IPL 2024: Fans call for Abhishek Sharma's inclusion in India's T20 World Cup squad after SRH crushes LSG", "body": "Abhishek Sharma, the dynamic opening batter for SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) orchestrated a batting spectacle on Wednesday (May 8), propelling his team to a commanding ten-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Match 57 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024. Abhishek left spectators in awe as he unleashed a breathtaking innings, scoring a scintillating 75 in just 28 balls, adorned with an array of eight boundaries and six maximums. His stellar performance not only sealed the win for SRH but also elevated his season tally to over 400 runs, cementing his status as a key contributor to the team's success.\n\nAbhishek's performance this season has been nothing short of exceptional, amassing 401 runs at an across 12 games. While this marks only his second half-century of the season, his impact for SRH has been monumental, contributing significantly to the team's record-breaking feats with the bat. Notably, SRH's remarkable run-chase of 167 runs in just 9.4 overs shattered the all-time IPL record for the most runs scored in the first 10 overs, showcasing Abhishek's instrumental role in the team's success. His partnership with Travis Head was equally remarkable, reaching the century mark in a mere 30 balls, establishing a new record for the quickest partnership to three figures in IPL history.\n\nThis season's performance has seen Abhishek elevate his game to new heights, surpassing his previous best tally in the IPL. With 401 runs in 12 matches, he trails only behind his exceptional 2022 campaign, where he amassed 426 runs in 14 matches for SRH. Boasting an average of 36.45 and a strike rate of 205.64, The 23-year-old has emerged as the season's leading six-hitter, with an impressive tally of 35 maximums to his name. His recent innings against LSG was a testament to his explosive batting prowess, comprising eight boundaries and six sixes, as he and Head wreaked havoc, accumulating 107 runs in the powerplay overs alone.\n\nAbhishek's consistent stellar performance throughout the season has ignited a fervent demand among fans for his inclusion in India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2024. Despite his explosive batting displays, Abhishek was notably absent from the recently announced 15-member squad for the tournament, set to take place in the West Indies and the United States of America (USA) in June. His omission from both the primary squad and the list of traveling reserves has left supporters clamoring for his inclusion. With the International Cricket Council (ICC) still allowing time until May 25 for any last-minute adjustments to the squad, hopes remain high among fans for Abhishek to secure a spot and showcase his {"uri": "8117876822", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:14:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:14:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:14:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4745098054409027, "url": "https://www.newsbytesapp.com/news/sports/lsg-s-ayush-badoni-and-nicholas-pooran-register-this-partnership-record/story", "title": "Pooran and Badoni register LSG's highest 5th-wicket stand in IPL", "body": "Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni shared a superb 99*-run stand against Sunrisers Hyderabad in Match 57 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 season. Badoni joined Pooran in the middle when Lucknow Super Giants lost Krunal Pandya with the score reading 66/4 in 11.2 overs. The duo's brilliance helped LSG get to a respectable score. However, this wasn't enough as SRH (167/0) won.\n\nLSG were off to a slow start and losing wickets at key junctures hurt their cause. The wicket was pretty slow and the two players took the match until the end to provide their team with something. The two batters showed positive intent right from the start. Badoni finished with a half-century as Pooran missed out, scoting an unbeaten 48.\n\nBadoni managed 55* from 30 balls (4s: 9). He struck at 183.33. The youngster has surpassed 600 IPL runs (606) at 24.24. He smashed his 4th IPL fifty (SR: 133.48). Pooran managed 48* from 26 balls (4s: 6, 6s: 1). He has raced to 1,633 IPL runs at 30.81 (SR: 157.93). In the ongoing season, Pooran has scored 363 runs at 60.50 (SR: 162.05).\n\nAs per ESPNcricinfo, the 99*-run stand between the two is now LSG's highest tally for the fifth wicket in IPL history. The previous-best record was an 87-run stand between Deepak Hooda and Badoni versus GT in IPL 2022. This is also the 4th-best stand for LSG (any wicket) in the competition. It's also their best stand against SRH in the IPL.\n\nThis was LSG's eighth 50+ partnership for the fifth wicket or below in IPL. Notably, Badoni is part of five such partnerships. {"uri": "8117313231", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "11:57:18", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T11:57:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T11:56:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4745098054409027, "url": "https://www.crictracker.com/social-tracker-cricket/ipl-2024-thunderstorm-casts-doubt-over-srh-vs-lsg-encounter-in-hyderabad/", "title": "IPL 2024: Thunderstorm casts doubt over SRH vs LSG encounter in Hyderabad", "body": "The 57th match of the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 clash between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Wednesday is unpredictable. Constant thunderstorms might play spoilsport in Hyderabad on 08th May. With both teams with 12 points in the standings and eyeing a playoff spot, the outcome of this match could have a major impact on the qualification scenario.\n\nHyderabad has been experiencing thunder-showers over the past few days, bringing relief from the scorching heat but raising concerns over the scheduled evening match at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Videos circulating on social media show the stadium ground drenched, with covers protecting the playing area.\n\nThe weather forecast indicates a high possibility of rain on the match day as well. According to AccuWeather, there will be a 23% cloud cover on Thursday, with slight chances of precipitation. If the game cannot be completed due to bad weather, both teams will share a point each, temporarily securing the third and fourth positions based on their net run rates.\n\nAlso read: Rohit Sharma seen teary-eyed after early dismissal against SRH\n\nHowever, this would hand defending champions Chennai Super Kings (CSK) a significant advantage. If CSK defeats the Gujarat Titans in their next clash, they will jump to 14 points and almost confirm their births for the Playoffs.\n\nLSG and SRH would then be left with just two more matches to secure one of the remaining two playoff berths. But recent losses to the Royal Challengers Bengaluru at home, the Chennai Super Kings, and the Mumbai Indians away have rocked their boat.\n\nLSG, on the other hand, started modestly, only to pick up pace midway through the tournament and earn the right for a spot in the playoffs. At the time of writing, SRH are fourth in the table with 12 points while LSG are seventh with the same points as the former.\n\nThe race for qualification into the playoffs has been made interesting by Delhi Capitals' win over Rajasthan Royals at the Feroz Shah Kotla on Tuesday, through which they have climbed up to the fifth spot. The duo put the SRH attack to the sword while trying to chase down the 183-run target quickly.\n\nStoinis departed after a well-made 25-ball 40, while Mankad batted at the other end. Another West Indian, Nicholas Pooran, then strode out to the crease and took the crowd by storm. He stroked 44 runs in just 13 balls, including three boundaries and four sixes. After setting a 166-run target, LSG faced the wrath of SRH's opening duo of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, as they smashed the bowlers all around the park to chase the target down in just 9.4 overs.\n\nGoenka was displeased with how LSG were taken to the cleaners in the match and seemingly expressed his displeasure at Rahul after the match. The visuals from their interaction became viral on social media platforms, with many fans criticising the LSG owner for his rather aggressive chat publicly. Fans stated Goenka could have waited for the players to reach a private space to have the conversation, and during the live broadcast, the duo of Mike Hesson and Graeme Smith - both of whom have been associated with IPL franchises before - felt the same.\n\nHesson believed Goenka's displeasure was understandable, but he seemed surprised with the LSG owner choosing to express the sentiment publicly. He also stated that there was a gap in quality between the two teams and that the Super Giants were too conservative in their approach. While both SRH openers played at a strike rate well beyond 250, LSG captain Rahul scored 29 off 31 balls.\n\n\"He's on his head, isn't he? He's voicing his concerns, and KL is going, 'hang on, not quite sure what are you asking us to do'. Today was pretty clear: SRH were on from ball one in the field, and LSG were a bit conservative in terms of how they operate. If you compare that with how Sunrisers play, no doubt there was a distinct gap. He's voicing his displeasure,\" Hesson told JioCinema.\n\nGraeme Smith believed the owner was \"passionate\", but there is a time and place to have such conversations. He also sympathised with Rahul, adding that it will be difficult for the LSG skipper to answer potential questions about his chat with Goenka.\n\n\"It's the owner who is very passionate about his team. His team has taken an absolute drubbing, and the emotions have rolled over. You feel these conversations should be happening behind closed doors. There are so many cameras around; they're not missing anything. {"uri": "8118488471", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:05:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:05:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:04:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4627451002597809, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2932790-cricket-australias-head-says-ipl-form-no-guarantee-for-world-cup-success", "title": "Cricket-Australia's Head says IPL form no guarantee for World Cup success | Sports-Games", "body": "Sunrisers Hyderabad batsman Head has scored 533 runs in 11 IPL matches so far, with only Virat Kohli (542) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (541) above him, and the 30-year-old's aggressive approach has marked him out as one to watch at the June 1-29 World Cup. He hit an unbeaten 30-ball 89 as Hyderabad thumped Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets with 62 balls to spare on Wednesday, but Head said his blistering form on flat Indian wickets would not automatically translate to similar pyrotechnics elsewhere.\n\nTravis Head has decimated bowling attacks in the Indian Premier League (IPL) this year but the Australian tempered expectations ahead of next month's Twenty20 World Cup in the West Indies and United States, where turning tracks could make batting tougher. Sunrisers Hyderabad batsman Head has scored 533 runs in 11 IPL matches so far, with only Virat Kohli (542) and Ruturaj Gaikwad (541) above him, and the 30-year-old's aggressive approach has marked him out as one to watch at the June 1-29 World Cup.\n\nHe hit an unbeaten 30-ball 89 as Hyderabad thumped Lucknow Super Giants by 10 wickets with 62 balls to spare on Wednesday, but Head said his blistering form on flat Indian wickets would not automatically translate to similar pyrotechnics elsewhere. \"Whenever you're playing, you want to be as consistent as you can, you want to be getting runs. It's nice to be playing well (but) that's not going to guarantee anything in the West Indies,\" Head told reporters.\n\n\"I think we'll face a fair bit of spin in the Caribbean and the wickets might become tougher as the tournament goes on. \"I'm very pleased I was able to play spin tonight and the things I'm working on in training are somewhat working at the moment. But I'm trying to stay relaxed as I have done for the last couple of years and be ready to go.\"\n\nHyderabad, who posted the biggest IPL total earlier this season with 287-3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, chased down Lucknow's total and finished with 167 for no loss - the highest 10-over score in men's T20 cricket. Head's opening partner Abhishek Sharma made an unbeaten 75 from 28 balls, with the duo smashing a combined 14 sixes and 16 fours.\n\n\"I'm lost for words,\" Lucknow skipper KL Rahul said. \"We've watched that kind of batting on TV, but this was unreal.\" Third-placed Hyderabad's seventh win in 12 games kept them firmly in the hunt for the playoffs, while the result ended the hopes of five-times champions Mumbai Indians.\n\n(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)", "source": {"uri": "devdiscourse.com", "dataType": "news", both coming here after huge defeats - Lucknow losing to Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers bowing down to the might of Suryakumar Yadav of Mumbai Indians.\n\nIn a way, it is a must win game for both the teams as the IPL is in the real business-end and any loss here at this stage would only dent further the hopes of making it to the playoffs.\n\nBoth the teams have three games to make the desired amends and in quick time too.\n\nFor Sunrisers, the loss against Mumbai was a clear wake-up call with the batters struggling on a pitch which was helpful to the bowlers, and batters with the exception of a lucky Travis Head at the top and a belligerent captain Pat Cummins, the others were just not equal to the task.\n\nThe conditions here are expected to be different and far easier for Sunrisers to give the kind of freedom the free-stroking opening pair of Head and in-form Abhishek Sharma should be looking to set the stage for the likes for Heinrich Klaasen, Nitish Kumar Reddy to help the team's cause of scoring big.\n\nAlso read | No plans to rest Bumrah yet ahead of T20 World Cup, says MI batting coach Pollard\n\nIt would be interesting to see whether Sunrisers would opt to give the big-hitting New Zealand all-rounder Glen Phillips, who has been mostly confined to dug-out this season, in place of Marco Jansen who was the most expensive with the ball against Mumbai. And also, if left-arm pacer Jaydev Unadkat who was badly missed against Mumbai, is back, then the balance would be near-perfect for Sunrisers giving them the choice of having someone like the fiery Umran Malik as an Impact Player.\n\nThere is no doubt that Sunrisers bowling has been pretty inconsistent and largely depends on the experience of Bhuvneshwar Kumar at the top and the duo of Pat Cummins and left-arm pacer T. Natarajan, considered to be one of the best death overs specialists.\n\nLucknow Super Giants look for an overall, improved performance from the likes of pacers Mohsin Khan, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Marcus Stoinis to give the right kind of cushion for the spinners | Photo Credit: SANDEEP SAXENA/ The Hindu\n\nLucknow Super Giants look for an overall, improved performance from the likes of pacers Mohsin Khan, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Marcus Stoinis to give the right kind of cushion for the spinners | Photo Credit: SANDEEP SAXENA/ The Hindu\n\nOn the other hand, Lucknow captain and opener K.L. Rahul needs to stand up and lead by example if his team were to be in with a chance to move further in the points table. A solid start at the top is imperative for the big guns like Marcus Stoinis, Deepak Hooda, and Nicholas Pooran to turn the heat on and post challenging totals. But again, these batters have been inconsistent - one day dominating any bowling attack and looking very ordinary the next day.\n\nEven in bowling, Lucknow look for an overall, improved performance from the likes of pacers Mohsin Khan, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Marcus Stoinis to give the right kind of cushion for the spinners Krunal Pandya and Ravi Bishnoi to strike it big.\n\nBy all means, it should be a thriller from the spectators point of view given the fact that the two teams will go all out to pick those two crucial points and keep the hopes alive. {"uri": "2024-05-349431659", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "19:28:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T19:28:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:33:06Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4588235318660736, "url": "https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/srh-vs-lsg-travis-head-abhishek-sharma-partnership-in-numbers-as-sunrisers-duo-scripts-history-280883.html", "title": "SRH vs LSG: Travis Head-Abhishek Sharma Partnership In Numbers as Sunrisers Duo Scripts History", "body": "In a breathtaking display of aggressive batting, Sunrisers Hyderabad's Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma shattered multiple records during their astonishing 167-run partnership against Lucknow Super Giants. This phenomenal stand, achieving the chase of 166 in just 9.4 overs, marked the fastest ever chase of a 160-plus target in IPL history.\n\nTravis Head, blasting 89 not out from 30 deliveries, and Abhishek Sharma, with 75 not out from 28 balls, made the evening at Hyderabad a spectacle of sheer dominance. Their partnership saw SRH propel to third in the IPL 2024 standings, leaving a trail of shattered records and awestruck fans.\n\nTravis Head-Abhishek Sharma Record-Breaking Performances\n\nThe duo's innings included some of the most memorable IPL records:\n\n1. Most 50+ Scores Inside Powerplay: Travis Head's aggressive start contributed to his tally for the season, placing him second only to David Warner with four 50+ scores in the powerplay-all scored in IPL 2024.\n\n2. Fewest Balls to 100-Run Partnership: The pair set a new benchmark for the fastest 100-run partnership, achieving the milestone in just 30 balls against LSG, beating their own previous record of 34 balls earlier in the season.\n\n3. Most Sub-20 Ball 50s in IPL: Travis Head also equaled the record for the most 50s scored in less than 20 balls, a testament to his explosive batting style that has been a hallmark of IPL 2024.\n\n4. Highest Total After First 10 Overs: SRH's 167/0 in 9.4 overs is now the highest total in the first 10 overs, surpassing multiple previous records set earlier in the season.\n\nTheir onslaught began from the powerplay, where they scored 107/0, marking it as one of the highest powerplay totals in IPL history. This explosive start was crucial in setting the tone for what was a record-breaking chase.\n\nHistorical Context\n\nThis partnership wasn't just about winning a match but rewriting the history books. Such performances have turned Head and Sharma into icons of the T20 format, showcasing their ability to dominate bowling attacks mercilessly. Sachin Tendulkar, cricketing legend, praised the duo highly, suggesting that they could have scored 300 if they batted first, highlighting the destructive nature of their batting.\n\nThe chase left the opposition and cricket pundits in awe, as SRH not only secured a victory but did so by rewriting the annals of T20 cricket. {"uri": "8118804749", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "08:58:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T08:58:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T08:58:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4588235318660736, "url": "https://www.crictracker.com/social-tracker-cricket/should-team-india-include-abhishek-in-the-bench-strength-harbhajan-singh-floats-idea-after-srh-openers-blitzkrieg-vs-lsg/", "title": "'Should Team India include Abhishek in the bench strength?' - Harbhajan Singh floats idea after SRH opener's blitzkrieg vs LSG", "body": "Harbhajan Singh wondered if Abhishek Sharma could be added to India's reserve players' list for the impending T20 World Cup 2024, after the southpaw played a scintillating knock to help Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) annihilate Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad on Wednesday, May 8.\n\nChasing a target of 166, Sunrisers romped home with 10 wickets in hand and 62 balls to spare as Travis Head and Abhishek played sizzling knocks to orchestrate the win. While Head scored 89 not out off 30 balls, Abhishek smashed 75* off just 28. The Punjab batter hit eight fours and six sixes during his exhilarating knock as the LSG bowlers had no answer to his onslaught.\n\nLegendary off-spinner Harbhajan was one of the many cricket enthusiasts who were stunned by Abhishek's ball-striking ability. The off-spinner floated the idea of adding Abhishek among the reserve players for India in next month's T20 World Cup.\n\n\"What just happened in Hyderabad! Travishead & IamAbhiSharma4 hitting sixes like taking singles. Chased 165 in 9.4 overs. Should Team India include Abhishek in the bench strength?\" Harbhajan asked in a social media post on Wednesday.\n\nThe 23-year-old is having a stellar season in IPL 2024. He has amassed 401 runs from 12 matches at an average of 36.45 and has a strike rate of 205.64. Abhishek has hit 30 fours and 35 sixes so far this season. No one has hit more sixes than him in the ongoing IPL.\n\nThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) announced a 15-man squad to represent the Men in Blue in the upcoming T20 World Cup next month. Rohit Sharma and Yashasvi Jaiswal were the two specialist openers picked in the side, with Virat Kohli expected to bat at No. 3. Shubman Gill and Rinku Singh were named among the reserves as Abhishek failed to get the nod. It's nice to be playing well (but) that's not going to guarantee anything in the West Indies,\" Head told reporters.\n\n\"I think we'll face a fair bit of spin in the Caribbean and the wickets might become tougher as the tournament goes on.\n\n\"I'm very pleased I was able to play spin tonight and the things I'm working on in training are somewhat working at the moment. This alarming performance prompted franchise owner Sanjiv Goenka to express his disappointment, particularly directing his frustration towards team captain KL Rahul.\n\nRahul faced criticism after his 29-run innings off 33 balls on what appeared to be a challenging pitch in Hyderabad initially. However, any doubts about the pitch's difficulty were quickly dispelled by Travis Head's explosive 89 off 30 balls and Abhishek Sharma's blistering 75 off 28 balls. Their aggressive intent and high-quality strokeplay left no room for speculation about the pitch conditions.\n\nGoenka's demeanor towards KL Rahul was nearly scolding before coach Justin Langer intervened in their intense one-sided discussion. Rahul appeared visibly uncomfortable, and upon Langer's arrival, he promptly exited the scene.
